The interpretation of this report is that we understand it as a form of disapproval, not prohibition. The earlier reports indicate permissibility and lift the prohibition. And what Mu’alla ibn Khunays’s report implies, that there is nothing wrong with it if it is about a span in height, is also to be understood as emphasizing caution, not prohibition, if it is not like that, based on what the earlier reports imply.

[77 - Chapter on the Prohibition of Hoarding] [403] 1 - Al-Ḥusayn ibn Saʿīd from Faḍālah from Ismāʿīl ibn Abī Ziyād from Abū ʿAbdillāh (peace be upon him) from his father, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) said: "No one hoards food except a sinner."
[404] 2 - Sahl ibn Ziyād from Jaʿfar ibn Muḥammad al-Ashʿarī from Ibn al-Qaddāḥ from Abū ʿAbdillāh (peace be upon him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) said: "The importer is blessed with provision, and the hoarder is cursed."
[405] 3 - ʿAlī ibn Ibrāhīm from his father from al-Nawfalī from al-Sakūnī from Abū ʿAbdillāh (peace be upon him) said: "Hoarding during times of plenty lasts for forty days, and during times of hardship and calamity, it lasts for three days. [406] 4 - Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad from Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyā from Ghiyāth ibn Ibrāhīm from Abū ʿAbdillāh (peace be upon him) who said: "Hoarding is only applicable to wheat, barley, dates, raisins, and clarified butter."
[407] 5 - Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad from Yaḥyā from Muḥammad ibn Sinān from ʿAbdullāh ibn Manṣūr from Abū ʿAbdillāh (peace be upon him) who said: "Food became scarce during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family), and the Muslims came and said, 'O Messenger of Allah, food has been lost, and nothing remains except with so-and-so, so order him to sell it.' text:
رفع الحديث إلى النبي صلى الله عليه وآله أنه مر بالمحتكرين فأمر بحكرتهم أن تخرج إلى بطون الأسواق وحيث تنظر الابصار إليها فقيل لرسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله لو قومت عليهم فغضب حتى عرف الغضب في وجهه فقال: أنا أقوم عليهم إنما السعر إلى الله تعالى يرفعه إذا شاء ويخفضه إذا شاء.
قال محمد بن الحسن: هذه الأخبار عامة في النهي عن الاحتكار على كل حال وقد روي أن المحظور من ذلك هو أنه إذا لم يكن في البلد طعام غير الذي عند المحتكر ويكون واحدا فإنه يلزمه إخراجه وبيعه بما يرزقه الله كما فعل النبي صلى الله عليه وآله وينبغي أن نحمل هذه الأخبار المطلقة على هذه المقيدة كما بيناه في مواضع كثيرة.
[409] 7 - وروى ما قلناه علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: الحكرة أن يشتري طعاما ليس في المصر غيره فيحتكره فإن كان في المصر طعام أو بياع غيره فلا بأس بأن يلتمس بسلعته الفضل، قال: وسألته عن الزيت فقال: إذا كان عند غيرك فلا بأس بإمساكه.

The ḥadīth is traced back to the Prophet, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, that he passed by hoarders and ordered their hoarded goods to be brought out into the open markets, where all could see them. It was said to the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, "Why don't you set prices for them?" He became angry, so that the anger was visible on his face, and said, "I should set prices for them? Verily, prices are up to God Almighty; He raises them when He wills and lowers them when He wills."
Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan said: These narrations are general in prohibiting hoarding in all circumstances. It has been narrated that what is forbidden is when there is no food in the town other than what is with the hoarder, who is alone. In that case, he is obligated to bring it out and sell it for what God provides, as the Prophet, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, did. These unrestricted narrations should be interpreted in light of these restricted ones, as we have explained in many places.
[409] 7 - It was narrated what we said by ‘Alī ibn Ibrāhīm, from his father, from Ibn Abī ‘Umayr, from Ḥammād, from al-Ḥalabī, from Abū ‘Abd Allāh, peace be upon him, who said: "Hoarding is when one buys food that is not available in the city other than with him, and he hoards it. But if there is food or another seller in the city besides him, then there is no harm in seeking profit from his goods." He said: And I asked him about olive oil, and he said: "If it is available with others besides you, then there is no harm in withholding it."
[410] 8 - Abū ‘Alī al-Ash‘arī from Muḥammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbār from Ṣafwān from Abū al-Faḍl ibn Sālim al-Ḥannāṭ, who said: Abū ‘Abd Allāh, peace be upon him, said: "What is your work?" I said: "A wheat seller; sometimes I come upon prosperity (1) and sometimes I come upon stagnation, so I withhold." He said: "What do those around you say about it?" I said: "They say I am a hoarder." He said: "Does anyone besides you sell it?" I said: "I don't sell a part of a thousand parts." He said: "There is no harm. This was only about a man from Quraysh called Ḥakīm ibn Ḥizām, who, when food entered the city, would buy it all. The Prophet, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, passed by him and said: 'O Ḥakīm ibn Ḥizām, beware of hoarding.'"
[411] 9 - ‘Alī ibn Ibrāhīm from his father from Ibn Abī ‘Umayr from Ḥammād from al-Ḥalabī from Abū

text:
عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن الرجل يحتكر الطعام ويتربص به هل يجوز ذلك؟
فقال: إن كان الطعام كثيرا يسع الناس فلا بأس به، وإن كان الطعام قليلا لا يسع الناس فإنه يكره أن يحتكر الطعام ويترك الناس ليس لهم طعام.
[78 - باب العدد الذين تثبت بينهم الشفعة] [412] 1 - علي بن إبراهيم عن محمد بن عيسى بن عبيد عن يونس بن عبد الرحمان عن عبد الله بن سنان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: لا تكون الشفعة إلا لشريكين ما لم يتقاسما فإذا صاروا ثلاثة فليس لواحد منهم شفعة.
[413] 2 - يونس عن بعض رجاله عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن الشفعة لمن هي؟ وفي أي شئ هي؟ ولمن تصلح؟ وهل يكون في الحيوان شفعة؟ وكيف هي؟
فقال: الشفعة جائزة في كل شئ من حيوان أو أرض أو متاع إذا كان الشئ بين شريكين لا غيرهما فباع أحدهما نصيبه فشريكه أحق به من غيره وإن زاد على الاثنين فلا شفعة لاحد منهم.
[414] 3 - الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة عن محمد بن زياد وصفوان عن عبد الله بن سنان قال: قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام المملوك يكون بين شركاء فباع أحدهم نصيبه فقال أحدهم أنا أحق به أله ذلك؟ قال: نعم إذا كان واحدا.
[415] 4 - أحمد بن محمد عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام أنه قال: في المملوك بين شركاء فيبيع أحدهم نصيبه فيقول صاحبه أنا أحق به أله ذلك؟ قال: نعم إذا كان واحدا، فقيل له أفي الحيوان شفعة؟ فقال: لا.
[416] 5 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن أحمد بن محمد عن البرقي عن النوفلي

'Abdullah (peace be upon him) said: "I asked him about a man who hoards food and waits for (prices to rise). Is that permissible?"

He said: "If the food is plentiful and sufficient for the people, there is no harm in it. But if the food is scarce and not sufficient for the people, then it is disliked to hoard the food and leave the people without food."
[78 - Chapter on the Number of Partners Between Whom Preemption is Established] [412] 1 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from Muhammad ibn Isa ibn Ubayd from Yunus ibn 'Abd al-Rahman from 'Abdullah ibn Sinan from Abi 'Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: "There is no preemption except for two partners as long as they have not divided (the property). If they become three, then none of them has preemption."
[413] 2 - Yunus from some of his men from Abi 'Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: "I asked him about preemption: for whom is it? And in what things is it? And for whom is it suitable? And is there preemption in animals? And how is it?"

He said: "Preemption is permissible in everything, whether animal, land, or goods, if the thing is between two partners only. If one of them sells his share, his partner is more entitled to it than others. But if they are more than two, then none of them has preemption."
[414] 3 - Al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama'ah from Muhammad ibn Ziyad and Safwan from 'Abdullah ibn Sinan who said: "I said to Abi 'Abdullah (peace be upon him): 'A slave is owned by partners, and one of them sells his share. One of them says, "I am more entitled to him." Does he have that right?' He said: 'Yes, if he is one (partner)'."
[415] 4 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ibn Abi Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabi from Abi 'Abdullah (peace be upon him) that he said: "Regarding a slave owned by partners, and one of them sells his share, and his partner says, "I am more entitled to him." Does he have that right?' He said: 'Yes, if he is one (partner).' It was said to him: 'Is there preemption in animals?' He said: 'No.'"
[416] 5 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Mahbub narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Barqi from al-Nawfali

text:
عن السكوني عن جعفر عن أبيه عن آبائه عن علي عليهم السلام قال: الشفعة على عدد الرجال.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على ضرب من التقية لأنه مذهب بعض العامة.
[417] 6 - وأما ما رواه علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن جميل بن دراج عن منصور بن حازم قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلا م عن دار فيها دور وطريقهم واحد في عرصة الدار فباع بعضهم منزله من رجل هل لشركائه في الطريق أن يأخذوا بالشفعة؟ فقال: إن كان باع الدار وحول بابها إلى طريق غير ذلك فلا شفعة لهم وإن باع الطريق مع الدار فلهم الشفعة.
[418] 7 - أحمد بن محمد عن علي بن الحكم عن الكاهلي عن منصور بن حازم قال:
قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام دار بين قوم اقتسموها وأخذ كل واحد منهم قطعة فبناها وتركوا بينهم ساحة فيها ممرهم فجاء رجل فاشترى نصيب بعضهم أله ذلك؟
قال: نعم ولكن يسد بابه ويفتح بابا إلى الطريق أو ينزل من فوق البيت ويسد بابه، وإن أراد صاحب الطريق بيعه فإنهم أحق به، وإلا فهو على طريقه يجئ ويجلس على ذلك الباب.
فالوجه في هذين الخبرين وإن كان الأصل فيهما منصور بن حازم وهو واحد أحد شيئين، أحدهما: أن يكون المراد بالقوم شريكا واحدا وإنما يكون تجوز في اللفظة بأن عبر عنه بالقوم، والوجه الثاني أن نحمله على ما حملنا عليه الخبر الأول من التقية دون ما يجب العمل عليه من واجب الشرع.
[419] 8 - وأما ما رواه الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة عن محمد بن زياد عن هشام بن سالم

From al-Sakuni, from Ja'far, from his father, from his forefathers, from Ali (peace be upon them) who said: "The pre-emption right (shuf'a) is according to the number of men."
The interpretation of this report is that we should consider it as a form of taqiyya (dissimulation), because it is the opinion of some of the common people (ʿāmma).
[417] 6 - As for what Ali ibn Ibrahim narrated from his father, from Ibn Abi Umayr, from Jamil ibn Darraj, from Mansur ibn Hazim who said: "I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a house that has courtyards and their path is one in the courtyard of the house, and some of them sold his house to a man. Do the partners in the path have the right to take it by pre-emption (shuf'a)?" He said: "If he sold the house and moved its door to a path other than that, then they have no pre-emption right. But if he sold the path with the house, then they have the pre-emption right."
[418] 7 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from al-Kahili from Mansur ibn Hazim who said:
"I said to Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him): 'A house between people who divided it and each one of them took a piece and built it, and they left between them a space in which they pass. Then a man came and bought the share of some of them. Is that for him?'"
He said: "Yes, but he closes his door and opens a door to the road, or descends from above the house and closes his door. And if the owner of the road wants to sell it, then they are more entitled to it, otherwise he is on his way, comes and sits on that door."
The interpretation of these two reports, even though the source of both is Mansur ibn Hazim, and he is one, [is one of] two things. One of them is: that what is meant by the people (al-qawm) is a single partner, and it is only a figurative expression in the wording by expressing it as "the people." The second interpretation is that we interpret it as we interpreted the first report as taqiyya (dissimulation), not according to what must be acted upon from the obligatory aspects of the law.

text:
عن سليمان بن خالد عن أبي عبد الله عيه السلام قال: ليس في الحيوان شفعة.
فلا ينافي ما قدمناه من الاخبار لان الاخبار التي قدمناها على ضربين، ضرب منها عامة في كل شئ وذلك يدخل فيها الحيوان وغيره فلا يجوز تخصيصها بخبر واحد والضرب الآخر: خاصة بأن الحيوان فيه شفعة وهو خبر يونس وعبد الله بن سنان والحلبي، والوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على أن لا يكون في الحيوان شفعة إذا كان بين أكثر من شريكين كما قلناه في غيره من الأشياء.
[420] 9 - فأما ما رواه علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن النوفلي عن السكوني عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: قال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله لا شفعة في سفينة ولا في نهر ولا في طريق.
فلا ينافي خبر منصور بن حازم الذي قال فيه انه تثبت الشفعة بالممر والطريق إذا أراد صاحبه بيعه لان الوجه فيه أن نحمله على ضرب من التقية لان ذلك مذهب بعض العامة.
[79 - باب الرهن يهلك عند المرتهن] [421] 1 - علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في الرجل يرهن عند الرجل رهنا فيصيبه شئ أو يضيع قال:
يرجع المرتهن بماله عليه.
[422] 2 - الحسين بن سعيد عن القاسم بن محمد وفضالة عن أبان عن عبيد بن زرارة قال: قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام رجل رهن سوارين (1) فهلك أحدهما فقال:

translation:
T Text:

From Sulayman ibn Khalid, from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him), who said: "There is no pre-emption (shuf'a) regarding animals."

This does not contradict what we have previously mentioned in the narrations, because the narrations we presented are of two types: one is general in everything, which includes animals and other things, so it is not permissible to specify it with a single narration. The other type is specific, stating that there is pre-emption in animals, which is the narration of Yunus, Abdullah ibn Sinan, and al-Halabi. The interpretation of this narration is that we understand it to mean that there is no pre-emption in animals if there are more than two partners, as we said about other things.
[420] 9 - As for what Ali ibn Ibrahim narrated from his father, from al-Nawfali, from al-Sakuni, from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him), who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) said: "There is no pre-emption in a ship, nor in a river, nor in a road."

This does not contradict the narration of Mansur ibn Hazim, in which he said that pre-emption is established in a passage and a road if its owner wants to sell it, because the interpretation of this is that we understand it as a form of taqiyya (dissimulation), because that is the opinion of some of the common people.

text:
أبا جعفر عليه السلام عن قول علي عليه السلام في الرهن يترادان الفضل قال: كان علي عليه السلام يقول ذلك قلت كيف يترادان الفضل؟ قال: إن كان الرهن أفضل مما رهن به ثم عطب، رد المرتهن الفضل على صاحبه، وإن كان لا يسوى رد الراهن ما ينقص من حق المرتهن، قال وكذلك كان قول علي عليه السلام في الحيوان وغير ذلك.
فالوجه في هذين الخبرين أن نحملهما على أنه إذا هلك الرهن بتفريط من جهة المرتهن من تضييع وغير ذلك، فأما إذا هلك من قبل نفسه أو من جهة غيره لم يلزمه شئ وكان له الرجوع على صاحبه بما عليه، والذي يدل على ما قلناه:
[427] 7 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن الحسين بن محمد عن معلى بن محمد عن الوشا عن أبان عمن أخبره عن أبي عبد الله عيه السلام لأنه قال: في الرهن إذا ضاع من عند المرتهن من غير أن يستهلكه رجع في حقه على الراهن فأخذه وإن استهلكه ترادا الفضل.

Abu Ja’far (peace be upon him) reported regarding the statement of Ali (peace be upon him) concerning collateral: "They return the excess." He said: Ali (peace be upon him) used to say that. I asked: "How do they return the excess?" He said: "If the collateral is worth more than what it was pledged for, and then it perishes, the pledgee returns the excess to its owner. But if it is not worth enough, the pledgor returns what is lacking from the right of the pledgee." He said: "And that was the saying of Ali (peace be upon him) regarding animals and other things."

The interpretation of these two narrations is that we understand them to mean that if the collateral perishes due to negligence on the part of the pledgee, such as wastefulness and other similar issues, then he is responsible. However, if it perishes due to its own cause or from another source, he is not liable for anything, and he has the right to recourse to its owner for what is owed. What indicates what we have said is:
[427] 7 - What Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated from al-Husayn ibn Muhammad from Mu'alla ibn Muhammad from al-Washa from Aban from someone who informed him from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) because he said: Regarding the collateral, if it is lost while with the pledgee without him consuming it, he may claim his right from the pledgor and take it. But if he consumes it, they return the excess.
[428] 8 - Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Mahbub from Banan ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Aban ibn Uthman from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) said: Regarding the collateral, if it is lost while with the pledgee without him consuming it, he may claim his right from the pledgor and take it. But if he consumes it, they return the excess between them.
[429] 9 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr from Hammad ibn Uthman from Ishaq ibn Ammar said: I asked Abu Ibrahim (peace be upon him) about a man who pledges collateral for one hundred dirhams, and it is worth three hundred dirhams, then it perishes. عبد الله عليه السلام عن متاع في يد رجلين يقول أحدهما استودعتكه والآخر يقول هو رهن قال فقال: القول فيه قول الذي يقول إنه رهن عندي إلا أن يأتي الذي ادعاه أنه أودعه بشهود.
[437] 2 - الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة عن غير واحد عن أبان عن ابن أبي يعفور عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: إذا اختلفا في الرهن فقال أحدهما هو رهن وقال الآخر هو عنده وديعة كان على صاحب الوديعة البينة فإن لم يكن له حلف صاحب الرهن.
[438] 3 - فأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن العلا عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال في رجل رهن عند صاحبه رهنا فقال الذي عنده الرهن ارتهنته بكذا وكذا وقال الآخر إنما هو عندك وديعة فقال: البينة على الذي عنده الرهن أنه بكذا فإن لم يكن له بينة فعلى الذي له الرهن اليمين.
فلا ينافي الاخبار الأولة لأنه إنما قال عليه البينة في مقدار ما على الرهن دون أن يجب عليه البينة على أنه رهن وهو مطابق لما رويناه في الباب الأول وإنما يجب في هذا الباب البينة على صاحب الرهن بأنها وديعة ولو قال بدلا من ذلك أن عليه شيئا إلا أنه أقل مما يذكره المرتهن لكان عليه اليمين دون البينة حسب ما تضمنه الباب الأول.
[82 - باب وجوب رد الوديعة إلى كل أحد] [439] 1 - أحمد بن محمد عن البرقي عن القاسم بن محمد عن فضيل قال: سألت أبا الحسن عليه السلام عن رجل استودع رجلا من مواليك مالا له قيمة والرجل الذي عليه المال رجل من العرب يقدر على أنه لا يعطيه شيئا والمستودع رجل خبيث خارجي

‘Abd Allah (peace be upon him) regarding goods in the possession of two men, one of whom says, "I entrusted it to you," and the other says, "It is collateral." He said, "The statement is the statement of the one who says it is collateral with me, unless the one who claims he entrusted it brings witnesses."
[437] 2 - Al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama'ah from other than one, from Aban, from Ibn Abi Ya'fur, from Abi 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) who said: "If they dispute over collateral, and one of them says, 'It is collateral,' and the other says, 'It is a deposit with him,' then the owner of the deposit has the burden of proof. If he does not have it, the owner of the collateral swears."
[438] 3 - As for what Al-Husayn ibn Sa'id narrated from al-'Ala, from Muhammad ibn Muslim, from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him), who said regarding a man who pawned something with his companion, and the one who has the pawn says, "I pawned it for such and such," and the other says, "It is only a deposit with you," he said: "The proof is on the one who has the pawn that it is for such and such. If he has no proof, then the one who owns the pawn takes an oath."
This does not contradict the earlier reports, because he (peace be upon him) only said that the burden of proof is on him regarding the amount owed on the collateral, not that he must provide proof that it is collateral, which is consistent with what we narrated in the first chapter. Rather, in this chapter, the burden of proof is on the owner of the collateral that it is a deposit. And if he said instead of that that he owed something, but it was less than what the mortgagee mentioned, then he would have to swear an oath without providing proof, according to what the first chapter implied.

فلا ينافي الخبر الأول لان هذا الخبر يختص من يعلم أن عين ما أودعه اللص غصب فحينئذ يجوز أن يمنعه إياه ويرد على أصحابه على الشرائط المذكورة في الخبر فاما إذا لم يعرفه بعينه غصبا فلا يجوز حبسه عنه ويجب عليه رده على كل حال.
[83 - باب أن العارية غير مضمونة] [441] 1 - الحسين بن سعيد عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: ليس على مستعير عارية ضمان وصاحب العارية والوديعة مؤتمن.

سألته عن العارية يستعيرها الانسان فتهلك أو تسرق فقال: إذا كان أمينا فلا غرم عليه.
[443] 3 - عنه عن النضر عن ابن سنان قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن العارية

Should he return it to him?" He said, "He should not return it. If he can return it to its owner, he should do so. Otherwise, it is in his possession like a found item. He should announce it for a year, and if he finds its owner, he should return it to him. If not, he should give it in charity. If the owner comes after that, he has the choice between the reward and the compensation. If he chooses the reward, it is his, and if he chooses the compensation, he is compensated, and the reward is for the one who gave the charity.”
This does not contradict the first narration, because this narration specifies one who knows that what the thief was entrusted with was definitely taken by force. In that case, it is permissible to withhold it from him and return it to its owner according to the conditions mentioned in the narration. But if he does not know specifically that it was taken by force, it is not permissible to withhold it from him, and he must return it in any case.
[83 - Chapter: A Borrowed Item Is Not Guaranteed]

[442] 2 - From him, from Fadala from Aban from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Jaafar (peace be upon him) who said:

فقال: لا غرم على مستعير عارية إذا هلكت إذا كان مؤمونا.
[444] 4 - أحمد بن محمد بن يحيى عن هارون بن مسلم عن مسعدة بن زياد عن جعفر بن محمد عليه السلام قال: سمعته يقول: لا غرم على مستعير عارية إذا هلكت أو سرقت أو ضاعت إذا كان المستعير مأمونا.
[445] 5 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن جعفر عن أبيه عن وهب عن جعفر عن أبيه أن عليا عليه السلام قال: من استعار عبدا مملوكا لقوم فعيب فهو ضامن ومن استعار حرا صغيرا فعيب فهو ضامن.
فهذا الخبر يحتمل وجوها، أحدها: انه إنما تضمن إذا استعاره من غير مالكه، فاما إذا استعاره من مالكه فليس عليه الضمان، يدل على ذلك:
[446] 6 - ما رواه محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن علي بن السندي عن صفوان عن إسحاق ابن عمار عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام وأبي إبراهيم عليه السلام قال: إذا استعرت عارية بغير إذن صاحبها فهلكت فالمستعير ضامن.
والوجه الثاني: أن يكون فرط في حفظه أو تعدى حتى هلك، فإذا كان كذلك كان عليه أيضا الضمان، يدل على ذلك:
[447] 7 - ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن النضر عن عاصم عن محمد بن قيس عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: قضى أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام في رجل أعار عارية فهلكت من عنده ولم يبغها غائلة فقضى إلا يغرمها المعار ولا يغرم الرجل إذا استأجر الدابة ما لم يكرهها أو يبغها غائلة.
والوجه الثالث: أن يكون اشترط عليه الضمان فإنه يلزمه إذا كان الامر على ذلك

He said: "There is no liability on one who borrows something if it perishes, provided he is trustworthy."
[444] 4 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Yahya from Harun ibn Muslim from Mas'ada ibn Ziyad from Ja'far ibn Muhammad, peace be upon him, who said: "I heard him say: 'There is no liability on one who borrows something if it perishes, is stolen, or is lost, provided the borrower is trustworthy.'"
[445] 5 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Ja'far, from his father, from Wahb, from Ja'far, from his father, that Ali, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever borrows a slave ('abd mamluk) from people and it becomes defective, he is liable. And whoever borrows a free young boy (ḥurr ṣaghīr) and it becomes defective, he is liable."
This report (khabar) can be interpreted in several ways: One is that he is only liable if he borrowed it from someone other than its owner, but if he borrowed it from its owner, then he is not liable. This is indicated by:
[446] 6 - What Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Mahbub narrated from Ali ibn al-Sindi from Safwan from Ishaq ibn Ammar from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, and Abi Ibrahim, peace be upon him, who said: "If you borrow something without the permission of its owner and it perishes, then the borrower is liable."
The second interpretation is that he was negligent in protecting it or transgressed until it perished. If that is the case, then he is also liable. This is indicated by:
[447] 7 - What al-Hussein ibn Sa'id narrated from al-Nadr from Asim from Muhammad ibn Qais from Abi Ja'far, peace be upon him, who said: "The Commander of the Believers, peace be upon him, ruled concerning a man who lent something and it perished with him and he did not intend malice (lam yabghiha ghā’ilah), that the borrower is not liable. And the man is not liable if he rents an animal, unless he overloads it or intends malice (aw yabghiha ghā’ilah)."
The third interpretation is that he stipulated liability for him, in which case he is bound if that is the case.

السلام قال: قضى أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام في تاجر أتجر بمال واشترط نصف الربح فليس على المضارب ضمان، وقال أيضا من ضمن مضاربة فليس له إلا رأس المال وليس له من الربح شئ.

فلا ينافي الاخبار الأولة لان هذا الخبر محمول على أنه إذا كان المال بينهما شركة فإنه يكون الربح والنقصان بينهما، وإنما أطلق عليه لفظ المضاربة مجازا، أو لأنه كان المال كله من جهته وإن جعل بعضه دينا عليه لتصح الشركة والذي يكشف عما ذكرناه:
[455] 5 - ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن الحسن بن الجهم عن ثعلبة عن عبد الملك ابن عتبة قال: سألت بعض هؤلاء يعني أبا يوسف وأبا حنيفة فقلت إني لا أزال أدفع المال مضاربة إلى الرجل فيقول قد ضاع أو قد ذهب قال: فادفع إليه أكثره قرضا والباقي مضاربة فسألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن ذلك فقال: يجوز.

Al-Salam said: Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him) ruled regarding a merchant who traded with capital and stipulated half the profit, that the *muḍārib* (agent in a profit-sharing agreement) is not liable for any loss. And he also said: Whoever guarantees a *muḍāraba*, he is only entitled to the capital, and he is not entitled to any of the profit.
[454] 4 - As for what Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from al-Hasan ibn Mahbub al-Kahili, from Abi al-Hasan Musa (peace be upon him), concerning a man who gave another man capital for *muḍāraba*, allocating him a specific share of the profit, and the *muḍārib* bought goods that depreciated in value, he said: The *muḍārib* is responsible for the depreciation in proportion to the share of the profit allocated to him.
This does not contradict the previous reports, because this report is interpreted as meaning that if the capital is a partnership between them, then the profit and loss are shared between them. The term *muḍāraba* is only used metaphorically, or because the capital was entirely from him, and he made a portion of it a debt upon him to validate the partnership. What reveals what we have mentioned is:
[455] 5 - What Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from al-Hasan ibn al-Jahm, from Tha'laba, from Abd al-Malik ibn Utba, who said: I asked some of these, meaning Abu Yusuf and Abu Hanifa, and I said, "I still give capital as *muḍāraba* to a man, and he says it is lost or gone." He said, "Give him most of it as a loan and the rest as *muḍāraba*." So I asked Abu Abd Allah (peace be upon him) about that, and he said: "It is permissible."
[456] 6 - From him, from Ali ibn al-Hakam, from Abd al-Malik ibn Utba al-Hashimi, who said: I asked Abu al-Hasan Musa (peace be upon him), "Is it permissible for the owner of the capital, if he wants to secure himself, to make a portion of it a partnership so that he is more secure in his capital?" text:
استأجر من السلطان من أرض الخراج بدراهم مسماة أو بطعام مسمى ثم أجرها وشرط لمن يزرعها أن يقاسمه النصف أو أقل من ذلك أو أكثر، وله في الأرض بعد ذلك فضل أيصلح له ذلك؟ قال: نعم إذا حفر نهرا أو عمل لهم عملا يعينهم بذلك فله ذلك.
والثاني أنه يجوز مثلا إذا استأجرها بالثلث أو الربع أن يواجرها بالنصف لان الفضل إنما يحرم إذا كان استأجرها بدراهم وأجرها بأكثر منها وأما على هذا الوجه فلا بأس به، يدل على ذلك:
[466] 5 - ما رواه أحمد بن محمد عن علي بن الحكم عن عبد الكريم عن الحلبي قال:
قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام أتقبل الأرض بالثلث أو الربع فأقبلها بالنصف قال:
لا بأس به قلت فأتقبلها بألف درهم وأقبلها بألفين؟ قال: لا يجوز، قلت كيف جاز الأول ولم يجز الثاني؟ قال: لان هذا مضمون وذلك غير مضمون.

ومنها: انه إنما أجاز ذلك إذا أحدث فيها حدثا فأما قبل ذلك فلا ينبغي وهو الأحوط يدل على ذلك:
[468] 7 - ما رواه محمد بن يحيى عن عبد الله بن محمد عن علي بن الحكم عن أبان عن إسماعيل ابن الفضل الهاشمي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن رجل استأجر أرضا من أرض الخراج بدراهم مسماة أو بطعام معلوم فيؤاجرها قطعة قطعة أو جريبا جريبا

If someone rents land subject to kharaj (land tax) from the Sultan for a specified sum of dirhams or a specified amount of food, then leases it out and stipulates that whoever cultivates it shares half, less than that, or more of the produce with him, and he has some contribution to the land after that, is this permissible for him? He said: Yes, if he digs a river or does something for them that helps them with that, then that is permissible for him.
The second is that it is permissible, for example, if he rents it for a third or a quarter, to lease it for half, because the increase is only forbidden if he rented it for dirhams and leased it for more than that, but in this case, there is nothing wrong with it. This is indicated by:
[466] 5 - What Ahmad ibn Muhammad narrated from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Abd al-Karim from al-Halabi, who said:
I said to Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him): I accept land for a third or a quarter, then I lease it for half. He said:
There is nothing wrong with it. I said: I accept it for a thousand dirhams and lease it for two thousand? He said: It is not permissible. I said: How is the first permissible and the second not permissible? He said: Because this is guaranteed, and that is not guaranteed.
[467] 6 - Muhammad ibn Yahya from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Safwan from Ishaq ibn Ammar from Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him), who said: If you accept land for gold or silver, do not lease it for more than you accepted it for, but if you accept it for half or a third, then you can lease it for more than you accepted it for, because gold and silver are guaranteed.
And from it: that he only permitted that if he introduced something new to it, but before that, it is not appropriate, and it is more cautious. This is indicated by:
[468] 7 - What Muhammad ibn Yahya narrated from Abdullah ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Aban from Ismail ibn al-Fadl al-Hashimi from Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him), who said: I asked him about a man who rented land from kharaj land for a specified sum of dirhams or a known amount of food, and then leases it out piece by piece or area by area.

text: [483] 2 - أحمد بن محمد عن ابن محبوب عن أبي ولاد قال: اكتريت بغلا إلى قصر ابن هبيرة ذاهبا وجائيا بكذا وكذا وخرجت في طلب غريم لي فلما صرت قرب قنطرة الكوفة خبرت أن صاحبي توجه إلى النيل فتوجهت نحو النيل فلما أتيت النيل خبرت انه توجه إلى بغداد فاتبعته وظفرت به وفرغت فيما بيني وبينه ورجعت إلى الكوفة وكان ذهابي ومجيئي خمسة عشر يوما وأخبرت صاحب البغل بعذري وأردت أن أتحلل منه مما صنعت وأرضيه فبذلت له خمسة عشر درهما فأبى أن يقبل فتراضينا بأبي حنيفة فأخبرته بالقصة وأخبره الرجل فقال لي: ما صنعت بالبغل؟ فقلت قد رجعته سليما قال: نعم بعد خمسة عشر يوما قال: ما تريد من الرجل؟ قال أريد كراء بغلي فقد حبسه علي خمسة عشر يوما فقال إني ما أرى لك حقا لأنه اكتراه إلى قصر ابن هبيرة فخالف وركبه إلى النيل وإلى بغداد فضمن قيمة البغل وسقط الكراء فلما رد البغل سليما وقبضته لم يلزمه الكراء، قال فخرجنا من عنده وجعل صاحب البغل يسترجع فرحمته مما أفتى به أبو حنيفة وأعطيته شيئا وتحللت منه وحججت تلك السنة فأخبرت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام بما أفتى به أبو حنيفة فقال: في مثل هذا القضاء وشبهه تحبس السماء ماءها وتمنع الأرض بركاتها قال فقلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام فما ترى أنت؟ قال: أرى له عليك مثل كراء البغل ذاهبا من الكوفة إلى النيل ومثل كراء البغل من النيل إلى بغداد ومثل كراء بغل من بغداد إلى الكوفة توفيه إياه قال: قلت له جعلت فداك فقد علفته بدراهم فلي عليه علفه؟ قال: لا لأنك غاصب، فقلت أرأيت لو عطب البغل أو نفق أليس كان يلزمني؟ قال: نعم قيمة بغل يوم خالفته، قلت: فإن أصاب البغل كسر أو دبر أو عقر قال: عليك قيمة ما بين الصحة والعيب يوم ترده عليه، قلت فمن يعرف ذلك؟

[483] 2 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ibn Mahbub from Abi Wallad who said: "I rented a mule to go to the palace of Ibn Hubayra and back for such and such amount. I went out in search of a debtor of mine. When I got near the bridge of Kufa, I was informed that my companion had gone to al-Nil (the Nile). So, I headed towards al-Nil (the Nile). When I reached al-Nil (the Nile), I was informed that he had gone to Baghdad. I followed him, caught up with him, settled my affairs with him, and returned to Kufa. My going and coming took fifteen days. I informed the owner of the mule of my excuse, and I wanted to absolve myself of what I had done and satisfy him. I offered him fifteen dirhams, but he refused to accept. We agreed to go to Abu Hanifa. I told him the story, and the man told him as well. He (Abu Hanifa) said to me, 'What did you do with the mule?' I said, 'I returned it safe and sound.' He said, 'Yes, after fifteen days.' He said, 'What do you want from the man?' He said, 'I want the rental of my mule, for he kept it for fifteen days.' He (Abu Hanifa) said, 'I do not see that you have a right, because he rented it to go to the palace of Ibn Hubayra, but he مخالف (violated) this agreement and rode it to al-Nil (the Nile) and to Baghdad, so he is liable for the value of the mule, and the rental is dropped. But when he returned the mule safe and sound, and you took possession of it, he is not obligated to pay the rental.' He said, 'We left him, and the owner of the mule began to say istirja' (to say "inna lillahi wa inna ilayhi raji'un", meaning "Indeed, to Allah we belong and to Him we shall return") I felt sorry for him because of what Abu Hanifa had decreed. I gave him something and absolved myself from him. I performed Hajj that year and informed Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, of what Abu Hanifa had decreed. He said, 'Because of such judgments and the like, the sky withholds its water, and the earth withholds its blessings.' He said, 'I said to Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, 'What do you think?' He said, 'I think you owe him the rental of the mule for going from Kufa to al-Nil (the Nile), the rental of the mule from al-Nil (the Nile) to Baghdad, and the rental of a mule from Baghdad to Kufa. You should pay him that.' He said, 'I said to him, may I be made your ransom, I fed it with dirhams. Do I have a claim on him for its feed?' He said, 'No, because you are a usurper.' I said, 'What if the mule had perished or died, would I not have been liable?' He said, 'Yes, for the value of the mule on the day you مخالفته (violated) the agreement.' I said, 'What if the mule had suffered a break, a sore, or a limp?' He said, 'You are liable for the difference in value between its healthy state and its defective state on the day you return it to him.' I said, 'Who knows that?'"

قال: أنت وهو إما أن يحلف هو على القيمة ويلزمك فإن رد اليمين عليك فحلفت على القيمة لزمه، أو يأتي صاحب البغل بشهود يشهدون أن قيمة البغل حين اكتري كذا وكذا فيلزمك، قلت إني أعطيته دراهم ورضي بها وحللني قال: إنما رضي وأحلك حين قضى عليه أبو حنيفة بالظلم والجور ولكن أرجع إليه وأخبره بما أفتيتك به فإن جعلك في حل بعد معرفته فلا شئ عليك بعد ذلك، قال أبو ولاد فلما انصرفت من وجهي ذلك لقيت المكاري فأخبرته بما أفتاني به أبو عبد الله عليه السلام وقلت له قل ما شئت حتى أعطيكه فقال: قد حببت إلي جعفر بن محمد عليه السلام ووقع في قلبي له التفضيل وأنت في حل وإن أردت أن أرد عليك الذي أخذت منك فعلت.
[484] 3 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أبي جعفر عن أبي الجوزا عن الحسين ابن علوان عن عمرو بن خالد عن زيد بن علي عن آبائه علهم السلام أنه أتاه رجل تكارى دابة فهلكت فأقر أنه جاز بها الوقت فضمنه الثمن ولم يجعل عليه كراء.
فالوجه في هذه الرواية ضرب من التقية لأنها موافقة لمذهب كثير من العامة.
[كتاب النكاح] [أبواب تحليل الرجل جاريته لغيره] [89 - باب أنه يجوز أن يحل الرجل جاريته لأخيه المؤمن] [485] 1 - أخبرني أحمد بن عبدون عن أبي الحسن علي بن محمد بن الزبير القرشي عن علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن محمد بن عبد الله بن زرارة عن الحسن بن علي عن

He said: "Either he swears regarding the value, and you are bound by it, or if he refers the oath back to you, and you swear regarding the value, he is bound by it. Or, the owner of the mule brings witnesses who testify that the value of the mule when it was rented was such and such, and you are bound by it." I said, "I gave him dirhams and he was satisfied with it and absolved me." He said: "He was only satisfied and absolved you when Abu Hanifa ruled against him with injustice and oppression, but go back to him and inform him of what I have advised you. Abu Walad said, "When I left from that place, I met the muleteer and informed him of what Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, had advised me, and I said to him, 'Say whatever you want until I give it to you.' The justification for this narration is a form of taqiyya (dissimulation), because it is in agreement with the opinion of many of the common people.

text:
العلا بن رزين عن محمد بن مسلم عن أحدهما عليهما السلام قال: سألته عن رجل يحل لأخيه فرج جاريته فقال: هي له حلال ما أحل منها.
[486] 2 - عنه عن أخويه عن أبيهما عن عبد الله بن بكير عن ضريس بن عبد الملك قال:
لا بأس بأن يحل الرجل جاريته لأخيه.
[487] 3 - عنه عن جعفر بن محمد بن حكيم عن كرام بن عمرو عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال قلت له الرجل يحل لأخيه فرج جاريته قال: نعم لا بأس به له ما أحل له منها.
[488] 4 - عنه عن محمد بن عبد الله عن ابن أبي عمير عن هشام بن سالم عن محمد بن مضارب قال قال لي أبو عبد الله عليه: يا محمد خذ هذه الجارية تخدمك وتصيب منها فإذا خرجت فارددها إلينا.
[489] 5 - محمد بن يعقوب عن عدة من أصحابنا عن سهل بن زياد ومحمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد وعلي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه جميعا عن ابن محبوب عن ابن رئاب عن أبي بصير قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن امرأة أحلت لابنها فرج جاريتها قال: هو له حلال قلت أفيحل له ثمنها؟ قال: لا إنما يحل له ما أحلت له.
[490] 6 - عنه عن عدة من أصحابنا عن سهل بن زياد عن أحمد بن محمد بن أبي نصر عن عبد الكريم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال قلت له الرجل يحل لأخيه فرج جاريته قال: نعم له ما أحل له منها.
[491] 7 - عنه عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن محمد بن إسماعيل بن بزيع قال:
سألت أبا الحسن عليه السلام عن امرأة أحلت لي فرج جاريتها فقال: ذلك لك قلت:
فإنها كانت تمزح فقال: كيف لك بما في قلبها فإن علمت أنها تمزح فلا.

Al-ʿAla’ ibn Razīn from Muḥammad ibn Muslim, from one of the two of them (peace be upon them), who said: I asked him about a man who allows his brother access to the private parts of his female slave, and he said: "She is lawful for him in whatever he has allowed of her."
[486] 2 - From him, from his two brothers, from their father, from ʿAbd Allāh ibn Bukayr, from Ḍurays ibn ʿAbd al-Malik, who said: "There is nothing wrong with a man allowing his brother access to his female slave."
[487] 3 - From him, from Jaʿfar ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥakīm, from Kirām ibn ʿAmr, from Muḥammad ibn Muslim, from Abī Jaʿfar (peace be upon him), who said: I said to him, "A man allows his brother access to the private parts of his female slave?" He said: "Yes, there is nothing wrong with it; he has whatever he has allowed him of her."
[488] 4 - From him, from Muḥammad ibn ʿAbd Allāh, from Ibn Abī ʿUmayr, from Hishām ibn Sālim, from Muḥammad ibn Muḍārib, who said: Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) said to me: "O Muḥammad, take this female slave to serve you and have relations with her, and when you leave, return her to us."
[489] 5 - Muḥammad ibn Yaʿqūb, from a number of our companions, from Sahl ibn Ziyād and Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyā, from Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad and ʿAlī ibn Ibrāhīm, all from his father, from Ibn Maḥbūb, from Ibn Ri’āb, from Abū Baṣīr, who said: I asked Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) about a woman who allowed her son access to the private parts of her female slave, and he said: "She is lawful for him." I said, "Is it permissible for him to have her price?" He said: "No, only what she has allowed him is permissible for him."
[490] 6 - From him, from a number of our companions, from Sahl ibn Ziyād, from Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Abī Naṣr, from ʿAbd al-Karīm, from Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him), who said: I said to him, "A man allows his brother access to the private parts of his female slave?" He said: "Yes, he has whatever he has allowed him of her."
[491] 7 - From him, from Muḥammad ibn Yaḥyā, from Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad, from Muḥammad ibn Ismāʿīl ibn Buzayʿ, who said: I asked Abū al-Ḥasan (peace be upon him) about a woman who allowed me access to the private parts of her female slave, and he said: "That is for you." I said: "But she was joking." He said: "How can you be sure of what is in her heart? If you know that she is joking, then no."

[492] 8 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن الحسن بن علي بن يقطين عن أخيه الحسين عن علي بن يقطين قال: سألته عن الرجل يحل فرج جاريته قال: لا أحب ذلك.
فليس فيه ما يقتضي تحريم ما ذكرناه لأنه ورد مورد الكراهية وقد صرح عليه السلام بذلك في قوله: " لا أحب ذلك "، فالوجه في كراهية ذلك أن هذا مما ليس يوافقنا عليه أحد من العامة ومما يشنعون به علينا، فالتنزه عما هذا سبيله أفضل وإن لم يكن حراما، ويجوز أن يكون إنما كره ذلك إذا لم يشترط حرية الولد، فإذا اشترط ذلك (فقد) زالت هذه الكراهية، يدل على ذلك:
[493] 9 - ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن صفوان بن يحيى عن إسحاق بن عمار قال:
سألت أبا إبراهيم عليه عن المرأة تحل فرج جاريتها لزوجها قال: إني أكره هذا كيف تصنع إن هي حملت؟ قلت تقول ان هي حملت منك فهو لك قال: لا بأس بهذا قلت فالرجل يصنع هذا بأخيه؟ قال: لا بأس.
[494] 10 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن الحسن عن عمرو بن سعيد عن مصدق بن صدقة عن عمار عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في المرأة تقول لزوجها جاريتي لك قال: لا يحل له فرجها إلا أن تبيعه أو تهب له.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على أنه إذا قالت: إنها لك ما دون الفرج من خدمتها، لان من المعلوم من عادة النساء أن لا يجعلن أزواجهن من وطئ إمائهن في حل، وإذا كان الامر على ما قلناه لم يحل له فرجها على حال.
[495] 11 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن الحسن بن علي ابن يقطين عن أخيه الحسين عن أبيه علي بن يقطين عن أبي الحسن الماضي عليه السلام

[492] 8 - As for what Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Yaqtin from his brother al-Husayn from Ali ibn Yaqtin who said: I asked him about a man who makes the vulva of his female slave permissible [to another man], he said: I do not like that.

There is nothing in this that necessitates the prohibition of what we mentioned, because it was stated in the context of dislike, and peace be upon him explicitly stated that in his saying: "I do not like that." The reason for disliking that is that this is something that none of the common people agree with us on, and it is something that they denounce us for. So, abstaining from what is like this is better, even if it is not forbidden. It is also possible that he only disliked that if he did not stipulate the freedom of the child. If he stipulated that, then this dislike is removed. This is indicated by:
[493] 9 - What al-Husayn ibn Sa'id narrated from Safwan ibn Yahya from Ishaq ibn Ammar who said:
I asked Abu Ibrahim (peace be upon him) about a woman who makes the vulva of her female slave permissible for her husband, he said: I dislike this, what will she do if she becomes pregnant? I said: She says, if she becomes pregnant from you, then it is yours. He said: There is nothing wrong with this. I said: Can a man do this to his brother? He said: There is nothing wrong with it.
[494] 10 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Ahmad ibn al-Hasan from Amr ibn Sa'id from Musaddiq ibn Sadaqah from Ammar from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him) about a woman who says to her husband, "My female slave is for you," he said: Her vulva is not permissible for him unless she sells her or gives her to him as a gift.

The interpretation of this report is that we understand it to mean that when she says, "She is yours," she means everything but the vulva, such as her services, because it is known from the custom of women that they do not make their husbands permitted to have intercourse with their female slaves. And if the matter is as we have said, then her vulva is not permissible for him in any case.
[495] 11 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Yaqtin from his brother al-Husayn from his father Ali ibn Yaqtin from Abi al-Hasan al-Madi (peace be upon him)

text:
أنه سئل عن المملوك أيحل له أن يطأ الأمة من غير تزويج إذا أحل له مولاه؟ قال:
لا يحل له.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نخصه بالمماليك دون الحرائر، والوجه في كراهية ذلك أن هذا النوع من التحليل هو كالتمليك للغير فرج الجارية، فهو في الحقيقة يستبيح وطأها بالملك فإذا كان العبد لا يصح أن يملك لم يتأت هذا فيه، ويجوز أن يكون المراد بالخبر إذا أحل له جارية في الجملة غير معينة فإنها لا تحل له بل ينبغي أن يعين على الجارية التي يريد تحليلها له، يدل على ذلك:
[496] 12 - ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن محمد بن أبي عمير عن فضيل مولى راشد قال قلت: لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام لمولاي في يدي مال فسألته أن يحل لي ما أشتري من الجواري فقال: إن كان يحل لي أن أحل لك فهو لك حلال، فسألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن ذلك فقال: إن أحل لك جارية بعينها فهي لك حلال وإن قال اشتر منهن ما شئت فلا تطأ منهن شيئا إلا من يأمرك، إلا جارية يراها فيقول هي لك حلال، وإن كان لك أنت مال فاشتر من مالك ما بدا لك.
[90 - باب حكم ولد الجارية المحللة] [497] 1 - علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن محمد بن علي عن الحسن بن محبوب عن أبان بن عثمان عن ضريس بن عبد الملك قال قلت: لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام الرجل يحل لأخيه فرج جاريته قال: هو له حلال قلت: فإن جاءت بولد منه فقال: هو لمولى الجارية إلا أن يكون اشترط على مولى الجارية حين أحلها له إن جاءت بولد فهو حر.

He was asked about a slave: Is it permissible for him to have intercourse with a slave girl without marriage if his master permits him to do so? He said:

It is not permissible for him.

The interpretation of this report is that we specify it to male slaves, excluding free women. The reason for disliking that is that this type of permission is like giving ownership of the slave girl’s private parts to another. In reality, he is making intercourse with her permissible through ownership, but since the slave cannot own, this does not apply to him. It is also possible that what is meant by the report is if he permits him a slave girl in general, without specifying a particular one, then she is not permissible for him; rather, he should specify the slave girl he wants to permit to him. The narrations that we presented in detail state that whenever a condition is stipulated, it is binding, and whenever it is not stipulated, the offspring is enslaved. We must interpret these narrations in light of those detailed ones. His saying that he permitted him, while not being secure from a hindrance, does not preclude it being conditional, that if there were a child, it would be affiliated with him. He only did not permit him to have intercourse with her in a way that would result in a child most of the time, but rather ordered him to be cautious. Even if it was stipulated that if a child were born, it would be considered free, as we presented. If we act upon these narrations and their apparent meaning, that the child is affiliated with freedom in all cases, we would need to delete the earlier narrations that include mentioning the condition, and that is not permissible. Rather, we should follow a path that reconciles the narrations. Another interpretation of these narrations is to understand his saying, peace be upon him: "His child is added to him," to mean with a price, because it is not permissible for his child to be subjected to enslavement. Rather, his father must be given the value. This is indicated by:
[503] 7 - What Al-Hussein bin Saeed narrated from Al-Hassan bin Mahbub from Jamil bin Salih from Dhurays bin Abdul-Malik from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, about a man who allows his brother to have intercourse with his female slave while she goes out for his needs, he said: "She is lawful for him." I said: "What do you think if she has a child, what should be done with him?" He said: "He belongs to the master of the female slave, unless he stipulated when he allowed him to have intercourse with her that if she has a child, then he is free. If he did that, then he is free." I said: "Does he own his child?" He said: "If he has wealth, he buys him for the value."
[504] 8 - Muhammad bin Al-Hassan Al-Saffar from Ibrahim bin Hisham from Abdul-Rahman bin Hammad from Ibrahim bin Abdul-Hamid from Abi Al-Hassan, peace be upon him, about a woman who said to a man, "My female slave's private parts are lawful for you," and he had intercourse with her and she gave birth to a child. The child shall be valued for him.
[91 - Chapter that the wording of *taḥlīl* (making lawful) is considered in that matter, not *ʿāriyah* (borrowing)]

'Uthman from Abi Maryam from Abi 'Abdillah (peace be upon him) who said: "The Qur'an revealed Mut'a (temporary marriage), and the Sunnah from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) was practiced accordingly."
[510] 4 - From him, from 'Ali ibn Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Mahbub, from 'Ali al-Siba'i who said:
I said to Abi al-Hasan (peace be upon him), "May I be made your ransom, I used to marry Mut'a, but I disliked it and became pessimistic about it, so I made a covenant with Allah between the Rukn and the Maqam, and made a vow and fasting upon myself not to marry it. Then that became difficult for me, and I regretted my oath, but I do not have the strength to marry in public." He said to me: "Did you covenant with Allah not to obey Him? By Allah, if you do not obey Him, you will disobey Him."
[511] 5 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Abi al-Jawza from al-Hussein ibn 'Alwan from 'Amr ibn Khalid from Zaid ibn 'Ali from his forefathers from 'Ali (peace be upon them) who said: "The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) forbade the meat of domestic donkeys and Mut'a marriage."
The interpretation of this narration is that we should understand it as taqiyya (dissimulation), because it is in agreement with the doctrines of the common people. The earlier reports are in agreement with the apparent meaning of the Book and the consensus of the rightly guided group on its basis, so it is obligatory to act upon them rather than this anomalous narration. [93 - Chapter on it not being appropriate to practice Mut'a except with a believing, knowledgeable, chaste woman, not with a dissenting, immoral one] [512] 1 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub from Muhammad ibn Yahya from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-'Abbas ibn Musa from Ishaq ibn 'Ammar from Abi Sarah who said: I asked Abu 'Abdillah (peace be upon him) about it, meaning Mut'a, and he said to me: "It is halal (lawful), and do not marry except a chaste woman, for Allah the Almighty says: (And they who guard their private parts) so do not place your private part where you do not trust your dirham."
[513] 2 - From him, from 'Ali ibn Ibrahim, from Muhammad ibn 'Isa, from Yunus, from Muhammad ibn al-Fudail

text:
نساء أهل المدينة قال: فواسق قلت فأتزوج منهن؟ قال: نعم.
فالوجه هذين الخبرين وما جرى مجراهما أن نحملهما على الجواز والاخبار الأولة على الفضل والاستحباب، وكذلك:
[518] 7 - ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن الحسن بن علي بن فضال عن بعض أصحابنا عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: لا بأس أن يتمتع الرجل باليهودية والنصرانية وعنده حرة.
[519] 8 - عنه عن محمد بن سنان عن أبان بن عثمان عن زرارة قال: سمعته يقول لا بأس أن يتزوج اليهودية والنصرانية متعة وعنده امرأة.
[520] 9 - عنه عن إسماعيل بن سعد الأشعري قال: سألته عن الرجل يتمتع من اليهودية والنصرانية قال: لا أرى بذلك بأسا قال قلت: فالمجوسية؟ قال:
أما المجوسية فلا.
قوله عليه السلام: " أما المجوسية فلا " محمول على ضرب من الكراهية وعند التمكن من غيرها فأما مع عدم غيرها فلا بأس به، يدل على ذلك:
[521] 10 - ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن محمد بن سنان عن الرضا عليه السلام قال:
سألته عن نكاح اليهودية والنصرانية فقال: لا بأس به فقلت المجوسية فقال: لا بأس به يعني المتعة.
[522] 11 - عنه عن أبي عبد الله البرقي عن ابن سنان عن منصور الصيقل عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: لا بأس بالرجل أن يتمتع بالمجوسية.
[523] 12 - عنه عن البرقي عن فضل بن عبد ربه عن حماد بن عيسى عن بعض أصحابنا عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام مثله.
فالوجه في هذه الأخبار الجواز ورفع الحظر وإن كان الأفضل التمتع بالمؤمنات العفيفات حسب ما قدمناه، ويزيد ذلك بيانا:
translation:

"...women of the people of Medina," he said, "they are immoral." I said, "So should I marry from among them?" He said, "Yes."
The way to reconcile these two reports and others like them is to interpret them as permissible, while the earlier reports indicate preference and recommendation. Similarly:
[518] 7 - What Ahmad b. Muḥammad b. ʿĪsā narrated from al-Ḥasan b. ʿAlī b. Faḍḍāl, from some of our companions, from Abī ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him), who said: "There is no harm in a man engaging in temporary marriage (mut'a) with a Jewish or Christian woman while he has a free (Muslim) woman."
[519] 8 - From him, from Muḥammad b. Sinān, from Abān b. ʿUthmān, from Zurāra, who said: "I heard him (the Imam) say: 'There is no harm in marrying a Jewish or Christian woman in temporary marriage while he has a wife.'"
[520] 9 - From him, from Ismāʿīl b. Saʿd al-Ashʿarī, who said: "I asked him about a man engaging in temporary marriage with a Jewish or Christian woman, and he said: 'I see no harm in that.' I said: 'What about a Magian woman?' He said:
'As for a Magian woman, no.'"
His saying (peace be upon him): "As for a Magian woman, no" is interpreted as a form of disapproval when other options are available. But if no other option exists, then there is no harm in it. This is supported by:
[521] 10 - What Ahmad b. Muḥammad b. ʿĪsā narrated from Muḥammad b. Sinān, from al-Riḍā (peace be upon him), who said:
"I asked him about marrying a Jewish or Christian woman, and he said: 'There is no harm in it.' So I said, 'A Magian woman?' He said: 'There is no harm in it,' meaning in temporary marriage (mut'a)."
[522] 11 - From him, from Abū ʿAbd Allāh al-Barqī, from Ibn Sinān, from Manṣūr al-Ṣayqal, from Abī ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him), who said: "There is no harm in a man engaging in temporary marriage with a Magian woman."
[523] 12 - From him, from al-Barqī, from Faḍl b. ʿAbd Rabbih, from Ḥammād b. ʿĪsā, from some of our companions, from Abī ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him), similar to it.
The way to understand these reports is as permission and lifting of prohibition, even though it is preferable to engage in temporary marriage with chaste believing women, as we have stated previously. This is further clarified by:

[524] 13 - ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن معاوية بن حكيم عن إبراهيم بن عقبة عن الحسن التفليسي قال: سألت الرضا عليه السلام أيتمتع من اليهودية والنصرانية فقال: يتمتع من الحرة المؤمنة أحب إلي وهي أعظم حرمة منهما.
[94 - باب التمتع بالابكار] [525] 1 - محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن موسى بن عمر بن يزيد عن محمد بن سنان عن أبي سعيد القماط قال: سئل أبو عبد الله عليه السلام عن التمتع من الابكار اللواتي بين الأبوين فقال: لا بأس ولا أقول كما يقول هؤلاء الاقشاب (1).
[526] 2 - أبو سعيد عن الحلبي قال: سألته عن التمتع من البكر إذا كانت بين أبويها بلا إذن أبويها قال: لا بأس ما لم يفتض ما هناك لتعف بذلك.
[527] 3 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد عن محمد بن إسماعيل عن أبي الحسن ظريف عن أبان عن أبي مريم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: العذراء التي لها أب لا تتزوج متعة إلا بإذن أبيها.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أحد أشياء، أحدها: أن تكون البكر صبية لم تبلغ فإنه لا يجوز التمتع بها إلا بإذن أبيها، يدل على ذلك:
[528] 4 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن محمد بن عبد الجبار عن صفوان بن يحيى عن إبراهيم بن محمد الأشعري عن إبراهيم بن محرز الخثعمي عن محمد بن مسلم قال:
سألته عن الجارية يتمتع منها الرجل؟ قال: نعم إلا أن تكون صبية تخدع قال قلت:
أصلحك الله فكم الحد الذي إذا بلغته لم تخدع؟ قال: بنت عشر سنين.
ومنها: أن يكون الخبر خرج مخرج التقية، يدل على ذلك:

[524] 13 - What Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from Mu'awiyah ibn Hakim from Ibrahim ibn Uqba from al-Hasan al- التفليسي (al-Tiflisi), who said: I asked al-Ridha (peace be upon him), "Is temporary marriage permissible with a Jewish or Christian woman?" He said: "Temporary marriage with a free, believing woman is more pleasing to me, and she has a greater sanctity than them."
[94 - Chapter on Temporary Marriage with Virgins] [525] 1 - Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya from Musa ibn Umar ibn Yazid from Muhammad ibn Sinan from Abu Sa'id al-Qammat, who said: Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) was asked about temporary marriage with virgins who are between their parents, and he said: "There is no harm in it, and I do not say as these al-Aqshab (1) say."
[526] 2 - Abu Sa'id from al-Halabi, who said: I asked him about temporary marriage with a virgin if she is between her parents without her parents' permission. He said: "There is no harm as long as there is no defloration, so she can remain chaste."
[527] 3 - As for what Ahmad ibn Muhammad narrated from Muhammad ibn Ismail from Abu al-Hasan Zarif from Aban from Abu Maryam from Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him), who said: "A virgin who has a father cannot be married temporarily except with her father's permission."
The explanation of this narration is one of several things: One of them is that the virgin is a young girl who has not reached puberty, as it is not permissible to have temporary marriage with her except with her father's permission. This is indicated by:
[528] 4 - What Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Muhammad ibn Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan ibn Yahya from Ibrahim ibn Muhammad al-Ash'ari from Ibrahim ibn Muhriz al-Khath'ami from Muhammad ibn Muslim, who said:
I asked him about a girl, is it permissible for a man to have temporary marriage with her? He said: "Yes, unless she is a young girl who can be deceived." I said: "May Allah set you right, what is the limit that, if she reaches it, she cannot be deceived?" He said: "A girl of ten years."
And among them: that the narration came out as taqiyya (dissimulation), which indicates that:

ومنها: أن يكون الخبر ورد مورد الكراهية دون الحظر، يدل على ذلك:
[530] 6 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن يعقوب بن يزيد عن ابن أبي عمير عن حفص بن البختري عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في الرجل يتزوج البكر متعة قال:
يكره للعيب على أهلها.
[95 - باب جواز التمتع بالإماء] [531] 1 - أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن أحمد بن محمد بن أبي نصر قال: سألت الرضا عليه السلام أيتمتع بالأمة بإذن أهلها؟ قال: نعم إن الله تعالى يقول: (فانكحوهن بإذن أهلهن).
[532] 2 - عنه عن أحمد بن محمد قال: سألت الرضا عليه السلام عن الرجل يتمتع بأمة رجل بإذنه قال: نعم.
[533] 3 - عنه عن محمد بن إسماعيل بن بزيع قال: سألت الرضا عليه السلام هل يجوز للرجل أن يتمتع من المملوكة بإذن أهلها وله امرأة حرة؟ قال: نعم إذا كان بإذن أهلها إذا رضيت الحرة قلت: فإن أذنت له الحرة يتمتع منها؟ قال: نعم.
[534] 4 - فأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن يعقوب بن يقطين قال: سألت أبا الحسن عليه السلام عن الرجل يتزوج الأمة على الحرة متعة قال: لا.

فالوجه فيه أن نحمله على أنه لا يجوز له أن يتزوجها إلا بإذن الحرة حسب ما بيناه في خبر محمد بن إسماعيل بن بزيع دون أن يكون ذلك محظورا على كل حال.
[96 - باب انه يجوز الجمع بين أكثر من أربع في المتعة] [535] 1 - محمد بن يعقوب عن الحسين بن محمد عن أحمد بن إسحاق الأشعري عن بكر بن محمد الأزدي قال: سألت أبا الحسن عليه السلام عن المتعة أهي من الأربع؟ قال: لا.
[536] 2 - عنه عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن ابن محبوب عن ابن رئاب عن زرارة بن أعين قال: قلت ما يحل من المتعة؟ قال: كم شئت.
[537] 3 - وعنه عن الحسين بن محمد عن معلى بن محمد عن الحسن بن علي عن حماد ابن عثمان عن أبي بصير قال: سئل أبو عبد الله عليه السلام عن المتعة أهي من الأربع؟
قال: لا ولا من السبعين.
[538] 4 - عنه عن الحسين بن محمد عن أحمد بن إسحاق عن سعدان بن مسلم عن عبيد بن زرارة عن أبيه عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: ذكر له المتعة أهي من الأربع؟ قال: تزوج منهن ألفا فإنهن مستأجرات.
[539] 5 - محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن العباس بن معروف عن القاسم بن عروة عن عبد الحميد الطائي عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام في المتعة قال: ليست من الأربع لأنها لا تطلق ولا ترث ولا تورث وإنما هي مستأجرة وقال: عدتها خمس وأربعون ليلة.
[540] 6 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن الحسن الصفار عن معاوية بن حكيم عن علي بن الحسن ابن رباط عن عبد الله بن مسكان عن عمار الساباطي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام عن المتعة قال: هي أحد الأربع.

[536] 2 - From him, from Muhammad ibn Yahya from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ibn Mahbub from Ibn Ri'ab from Zurarah ibn A'yan who said: I said: What is permissible from Mut'ah? He said: As much as you want.
[537] 3 - And from him, from al-Husayn ibn Muhammad from Mu'alla ibn Muhammad from al-Hasan ibn Ali from Hammad ibn Uthman from Abu Basir who said: Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) was asked about Mut'ah, is it from the four?

text:
[541] 7 - وما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن أبي نصر عن أبي الحسن عليه السلام قال: سألته عن الرجل يكون عنده المرأة أيحل له أن يتزوج بأختها متعة قال: لا قلت: حكى زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه لسلام إنما هي مثل الإماء يتزوج ما شاء قال: لا هي من الأربع.
فالوجه في هذين الخبرين أن نحملهما على ضرب من الاحتياط والفضل، والاخبار الأولة على الجواز ورفع الحظر، يدل على ذلك:
[542] 8 - ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن أبي نصر عن أبي الحسن الرضا عليه السلام قال:
قال أبو جعفر عليه السلام: اجعلوهن من الأربع فقال له صفوان بن يحيى: أعلى الاحتياط؟ قال: نعم.
[97 - باب جواز العقد على المرأة متعة بغير شهود] [543] 1 - الحسين بن سعيد عن القاسم بن عروة عن ابن بكير عن زرارة قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل تزوج متعة بغير شهود قال: لا بأس بالتزويج البتة بغير شهود فيما بينه وبين الله عز وجل وإنما جعل الشهود في تزويج البتة من أجل الولد ولولا ذلك لم يكن به بأس.
[544] 2 - فأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن صفوان عن ابن مسكان عن المعلى بن خنيس قال قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام ما يجزي في المتعة من الشهود؟ فقال:
رجل وامرأتان يشهدهما قلت: أرأيت ان لم يجدوا أحدا قال: انهم لا يعوزهم قلت:
أرأيت أن اشفقوا أن يعلم بهم أحد أيجزيهم رجل واحد؟ قال: نعم قال قلت: جعلت فداك كان المسلمون على عهد النبي صلى الله عليه وآله يتزوجون بغير بينة؟ قال: لا.
فلا ينافي الخبر الأول لأنه ليس في الخبر المنع من جواز نكاح المتعة بغير بينة وإنما يتضمن ما كان في عهد رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله انهم ما تزوجوا إلا ببينة

[541] 7 - And what was narrated by Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr from Abi al-Hasan (peace be upon him), who said: I asked him about a man who has a wife, is it permissible for him to marry her sister in *mut'ah*? He said: "No." I said: Zurarah narrated from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) that it is only like slave girls, he marries as he wills. He said: "No, she is from the four."
The interpretation of these two narrations is that we should understand them as a form of precaution and virtue, and the earlier narrations indicate permissibility and lifting of the prohibition, as indicated by:
[542] 8 - What was narrated by Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr from Abi al-Hasan al-Ridha (peace be upon him), who said:
Abu Ja'far (peace be upon him) said: "Include them among the four." Safwan ibn Yahya said to him: "Is this for precaution?" He said: "Yes."
[97 - Chapter on the permissibility of contracting *mut'ah* marriage with a woman without witnesses]
[543] 1 - Al-Hussein ibn Saeed from al-Qasim ibn Urwa from Ibn Bukair from Zurarah, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a man who married in *mut'ah* without witnesses. He said: "There is no problem with a confirmed marriage without witnesses between him and Allah Almighty, and witnesses were only made for confirmed marriages for the sake of the child, and if it were not for that, there would be no problem with it."
[544] 2 - As for what al-Hussein ibn Saeed narrated from Safwan from Ibn Miskan from al-Mu'alla ibn Khunais, who said: I said to Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him): What suffices for witnesses in *mut'ah*? He said:
"A man and two women witness it." I said: What if they do not find anyone? He said: "They will not lack them." I said:
What if they fear that someone will know about them, is one man sufficient for them? He said: "Yes." I said: May I be made your ransom, were the Muslims during the time of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) marrying without proof? He said: "No."
This does not contradict the first narration because the narration does not contain a prohibition against the permissibility of *mut'ah* marriage without proof, but only implies what was during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family), that they only married with proof.

text:
وذلك هو الأفضل، وليس إذا كان ذلك غير واقع في ذلك العصر دل على أنه محظور كما انا نعلم أن ها هنا أشياء كثيرة من المباحات وغيرها لم تكن تستعمل في ذلك الوقت ولم يدل ذلك على حظره، على أنه يمكن أن يكون الخبر ورد مورد الاحتياط دون الايجاب لئلا تعتقد المرأة أن ذلك فجور إذا لم تكن من أهل المعرفة، والذي يكشف عما ذكرناه:
[545] 3 - ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن الحسن بن محبوب عن محمد بن الفضيل عن الحرث بن المغيرة قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام ما يجوز في المتعة من الشهود؟
فقال: رجل وامرأتان قلت: فإن كره الشهود؟ قال: يجزيه رجل وإنما ذلك لمكان المرأة لئلا تقول في نفسها هذا فجور.
[98 - باب أنه إذا شرط ثبوت الميراث في المتعة كان ذلك جائزا وواجبا] [546] 1 - محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن أحمد بن محمد بن أبي نصر عن أبي الحسن الرضا عليه السلام قال: تزويج المتعة نكاح بميراث ونكاح بغير ميراث إن اشترطت الميراث كان وإن لم تشترط لم يكن.
[547] 2 - الحسين بن سعيد عن النضر عن عاصم بن حميد عن محمد بن مسلم قال سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام كم المهر؟ يعني في المتعة فقال: ما تراضيا عليه إلى ما شاءا من الاجل قلت: أرأيت ان حملت؟ قال: هو ولده، فإن أراد أن يستقبل أمرا جديدا فعل، وليس عليها العدة منه وعليها من غيره خمس وأربعون ليلة، وإن اشترطا الميراث فهما على شرطهما.
[548] 3 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن البرقي عن الحسن

That is the best. Just because something was not practiced in that era does not indicate that it is prohibited. We know that there are many permissible things and others that were not used at that time, but that does not indicate their prohibition. However, it is possible that the report was narrated as a precaution, not as an obligation, so that a woman would not think it is immoral if she is not knowledgeable. What reveals what we have mentioned is:
[545] 3 - What al-Hussein bin Saeed narrated from al-Hasan bin Mahbub from Muhammad bin al-Fudail from al-Harith bin al-Mughira who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him), "What is permissible in Mut'ah regarding witnesses?"
He said: "A man and two women." I said: "What if the witnesses are disliked?" He said: "A man is sufficient for him, and that is only for the sake of the woman, lest she say to herself, 'This is immoral.'"
[98 - Chapter: If Stipulating Inheritance in Mut'ah is Permitted and Obligatory]
[546] 1 - Muhammad bin Yaqub from Ali bin Ibrahim from his father from Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Abi Nasr from Abi al-Hasan al-Ridha (peace be upon him) who said: "The Mut'ah marriage is a marriage with inheritance and a marriage without inheritance. If you stipulate inheritance, it exists, and if you do not stipulate it, it does not exist."
[547] 2 - Al-Hussein bin Saeed from al-Nadr from Asim bin Hamid from Muhammad bin Muslim who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him), "How much is the dowry?" Meaning in Mut'ah. He said: "Whatever they both agree upon, for whatever period they wish." I said: "What if she becomes pregnant?" He said: "It is his child. If he wants to start a new matter, he can. And she does not have an 'iddah (waiting period) from him, but from others, she has forty-five nights. And if they stipulate inheritance, they are bound by their condition."
[548] 3 - As for what Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Yahya narrated from Ahmad bin Muhammad from al-Barqi from al-Hasan

text:
ابن جهم عن الحسن بن موسى عن سعيد بن يسار عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال:
سألته عن الرجل يتزوج المرأة متعة ولم يشترط الميراث؟ قال: ليس بينهما ميراث اشترط أو لم يشترط.
فلا ينافي الخبرين الأولين لان الوجه فيه انه لا ميراث بينهما سواء اشترط نفي الميراث أو لم يشترط لان من الأحكام اللازمة في المتعة نفي التوارث، وإنما يحتاج ثبوت الموارثة إلى شرط، والذي يدل على ما ذكرناه:
[549] 4 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن محمد بن الحسين عن جعفر بن بشير عن حماد بن عثمان عن جميل بن صالح عن عبد الله بن عمرو قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن المتعة؟ فقال: حلال من الله ورسوله قلت: فما حدها؟ قال: من حدودها ألا ترثها ولا ترثك، قال فقلت كم عدتها؟ قال: خمسة وأربعون يوما أو حيضة مستقيمة.
[550] 5 - واما ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن ابن فضال عن محمد بن مسلم قال: سمعت أبا جعفر عليه السلام يقول في الرجل يتزوج المرأة متعة إنهما يتوارثان إذا لم يشترطا وإنما الشرط بعد النكاح.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على أنه إذا لم يشترط الاجل فإنهما يتوارثان، والذي يدل على ذلك:
[551] 6 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن عمرو بن عثمان عن إبراهيم بن الفضل عن أبان بن تغلب قال قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام: كيف أقول لها إذا خلوت بها؟ قال: تقول أتزوجك متعة على كتاب الله وسنة نبيه صلى الله عليه وآله لا وارثة ولا موروثة كذا وكذا يوما وإن شئت كذا وكذا سنة بكذا
footnote: - ٥٤٩ - التهذيب ج ٢ ص ١٩٠. - ٥٥٠ - التهذيب ج ٢ ص ١٩٠ الكافي ج ٢ ص ٤٧ - ٥٥١ - التهذيب ج ٢ ص ١٩٠ الكافي ج ٢ ص ٤٤.

Ibn Jahm from al-Hasan bin Musa from Sa'id bin Yasar from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said:
I asked him about a man who marries a woman in mut'a (temporary marriage) and does not stipulate inheritance? He said: There is no inheritance between them, whether he stipulates or does not stipulate.

This does not contradict the first two narrations, because the point is that there is no inheritance between them, whether he stipulates the negation of inheritance or does not stipulate, because it is one of the necessary rulings in mut'a to negate inheritance. Rather, the establishment of inheritance requires a condition, and what indicates what we mentioned is:

[549] 4 - What Muhammad bin Ahmed bin Yahya narrated from Muhammad bin al-Hussein from Jaafar bin Bashir from Hammad bin Uthman from Jamil bin Salih from Abdullah bin Amr who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about mut'a? He said: It is lawful from Allah and His Messenger. I said: What are its limits? He said: One of its limits is that she does not inherit from you and you do not inherit from her. He said: So I said, how long is her iddah (waiting period)? He said: Forty-five days or a straight menstruation.
[550] 5 - As for what Muhammad bin Yaqub narrated from Muhammad bin Yahya from Ahmed bin Muhammad from Ibn Faddal from Muhammad bin Muslim who said: I heard Abu Jaafar (peace be upon him) say about a man who marries a woman in mut'a that they inherit from each other if they do not stipulate, and the condition is only after the marriage.

The point in this narration is that we interpret it as meaning that if he does not stipulate the term, then they inherit from each other, and what indicates that is:

[551] 6 - What Muhammad bin Yaqub narrated from Ali bin Ibrahim from his father from Amr bin Uthman from Ibrahim bin al-Fadl from Aban bin Taghlib who said: I said to Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him): What do I say to her when I am alone with her? He said: You say, I marry you in mut'a according to the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of His Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family), with no inheriting and no being inherited, for such and such a number of days, or if you wish, such and such a number of years, for such and such

text:
وكذا درهما وتسمي الاجل ما تراضيا عليه قليلا كان أو كثيرا فإذا قالت: نعم فقد رضيت وهي امرأتك وأنت أولى الناس بها قلت: فإني استحي ان أذكر شرط الأيام قال: هو أضر عليك قلت وكيف؟ قال: إنك إن لم تشترط كان تزويج مقام لزمتك النفقة في العدة وكانت وارثة ولم تقدر على أن تطلقها إلا طلاق السنة.
[99 - باب مقدار ما يجزي من ذكر الاجل في المتعة] [552] 1 - محمد بن يعقوب عن عدة من أصحابنا عن سهل بن زياد عن ابن محبوب عن علي بن رئاب عن عمر بن حنظلة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: يشارطها ما شاء من الأيام.
[553] 2 - عنه عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن محمد بن إسماعيل عن أبي الحسن الرضا عليه السلام قال: قلت له الرجل يتزوج متعة سنة وأقل وأكثر قال:
إذا كان بشئ معلوم إلى أجل معلوم قال: قلت وتبين بغير طلاق؟ قال: نعم.
[554] 3 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن ابن فضال عن ابن بكير عن زرارة قال قلت: له هل يجوز أن يتمتع الرجل من المرأة ساعة أو ساعتين؟ فقال: الساعة والساعتين لا يوقف على حدهما ولكن العرد (1) والعردين واليوم واليومين وأشباه ذلك.
[555] 4 - عنه عن عدة من أصحابنا عن سهل بن زياد عن ابن فضال عن القاسم ابن محمد عن رجل سماه قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن الرجل يتزوج المرأة على عرد واحد فقال: لا بأس ولكن إذا فرغ فليحول وجهه ولا ينظر.

Likewise, a dirham. And he names the term whatever they agree upon, be it little or much. So if she says, "Yes, I am satisfied," then she is your wife, and you are the most entitled to her. I said: But I am shy to mention the condition of the days. He said: It is more harmful to you. I said: How? He said: If you do not stipulate, it will be a marriage of residence, and you will be obligated to provide maintenance during the waiting period ('iddah), and she will be an heir, and you will not be able to divorce her except with a divorce according to the Sunnah.
[99 - Chapter on the extent to which mentioning the term in Mut'ah is sufficient]
[552] 1 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub, from several of our companions, from Sahl ibn Ziyad, from Ibn Mahbub, from Ali ibn Ri'ab, from 'Umar ibn Hanzala, from Abi 'Abd Allah, peace be upon him, who said: He can stipulate with her whatever he wants of days.
[553] 2 - From him, from Muhammad ibn Yahya, from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Muhammad ibn Ismail, from Abi al-Hasan al-Ridha, peace be upon him, who said: I said to him: A man marries in Mut'ah for a year, or less, or more? He said:
If it is for a known thing, for a known term. He said: I said: And does it become void without divorce? He said: Yes.
[554] 3 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated, from Muhammad ibn Yahya, from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Ibn Faddal, from Ibn Bukayr, from Zurara, who said: I said to him: Is it permissible for a man to enjoy a woman for an hour or two? He said: An hour or two are not defined, but *al-'ird* (1), and *al-'irdain*, and a day, and two days, and things like that.
[555] 4 - From him, from several of our companions, from Sahl ibn Ziyad, from Ibn Faddal, from al-Qasim ibn Muhammad, from a man he named, who said: I asked Abu 'Abd Allah, peace be upon him, about a man marrying a woman for one *'ird*. He said: There is nothing wrong with it, but when he is finished, he should turn his face away and not look.

text:
فالوجه في هذين الخبرين ضرب من الرخصة والأحوط ما تضمنته الاخبار الأولة أن يكون ذكر الاجل أياما معلومة أو شهورا معينة فأما الساعة والساعتين والدفعة والدفعتين فمما لا يمكن تحصيله على التحقيق والأولى أن يكون المراد بالدفعة والدفعتين في الخبرين إنما يجوز مضافا إلى يوم بعينه أو بأيام بأعيانها فأما إذا ذكر الدفعة مبهمة ولم يضفها إلى يوم بعينه كان ذلك عقدا دائما لا ينحل إلا بالطلاق، يدل على ذلك:
[556] 5 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن محمد بن الحسين عن موسى بن سعدان عن عبد الله بن القاسم عن هشام الجواليقي قال قلت: لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام أتزوج المرأة متعة مرة مبهمة قال فقال: ذاك أشد عليك ترثها وترثك فلا يجوز لك أن تطلقها إلا على طهر وشاهدين، قلت أصلحك الله فكيف أتزوجها؟ قال:
أياما معدودة بشئ مسمى بمقدار ما تراضيتم به فإذا مضت أيامها كان طلاقها في شرطها ولا نفقة لها عليك قلت: ما نقول لها؟ قال: تقول لها أتزوجك على كتاب الله وسنة نبيه صلى الله عليه وآله والله وليي ووليك كذا وكذا شهرا بكذا وكذا درهما على أن لي الله عليك كفيلا لتفين لي ولا أقسم لك ولا أطلب ولدك ولا عدة لك علي فإذا مضى شرطك فلا تتزوجي حتى يمضي لك خمسة وأربعون يوما وإن حدث بك ولد فأعلميني.
[100 - باب أن ولد المتعة لاحق بأبيه] [557] 1 - أحمد بن محمد بن أبي نصر عن عاصم بن حميد عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال قلت له: أرأيت إن حبلت؟ قال: هو ولده.
[558] 2 - محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن ابن أبي عمير وغيره قال: الماء ماء الرجل يضعه حيث شاء إلا أنه إن جاء بولد لم ينكره وشدد في إنكار الولد.

The interpretation of these two narrations is a form of leniency (rukhsah), but the more cautious approach is what the earlier narrations included, which is that the duration be mentioned as known days or specific months. As for an hour or two, or a "duf'ah" (one instance) or two "duf'atayn" (two instances), it is impossible to accurately determine. It is better to interpret "duf'ah" and "duf'atayn" in the two narrations as permissible only when attributed to a specific day or specific days. However, if "duf'ah" is mentioned vaguely and not attributed to a specific day, it is a permanent contract that cannot be dissolved except by divorce. This is indicated by:

[556] 5 - What Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Musa ibn Sa'dan from Abdullah ibn al-Qasim from Hisham al-Juwaliqi who said: I said to Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him): I marry a woman in mut'ah (temporary marriage) with a vague duration (murrah mubhamah). He said: That is more severe for you; she inherits from you and you inherit from her. You are not allowed to divorce her except in a state of purity (tuhr) and with two witnesses. I said, "May Allah make you righteous, how do I marry her?" He said:

"For a limited number of days (ayyaman ma'dudah) for a specified amount (shay'in musamma) according to what you both agree upon. When her days are over, her divorce is in her stipulation (shart), and she has no maintenance from you." I said, "What do we say to her?" He said: "You say to her: I marry you according to the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of His Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family), and Allah is my guardian and your guardian, for such and such months, for such and such dirhams, on the condition that you have Allah as a guarantor for me to fulfill my promise to you. I will not cohabit with you (la uqsim laki), nor will I seek your child, and you have no waiting period (iddah) upon me. When your condition is over, do not marry until forty-five days have passed for you, and if a child is born to you, inform me.”
[100 - Chapter: The Child of Mut'ah is Legitimate to His Father]

[557] 1 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr from Asim ibn Hamid from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: I said to him: What do you think if she becomes pregnant? He said: It is his child.

[558] 2 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub from Ali ibn Ibrahim from Ibn Abi Umayr and others who said: The water is the man's water, he places it where he wills, except that if a child comes, he should not deny him, and he was strict about denying the child.
