[559] 3 - From him, from Ali ibn Ibrahim, from al-Mukhtar ibn Muhammad and Muhammad ibn al-Husayn, from Abdullah ibn al-Husayn all together, from al-Fath ibn Yazid who said: I asked Abu al-Hasan al-Rida (peace be upon him) about the conditions in Mut'ah (temporary marriage), and he said: "The conditions in it are such and such." If she says, "Yes," then that is permissible. I do not say as it has reached me that the people of Iraq say, "The water is mine, and the land is yours, and I will not water your land, and if something grows there, it belongs to the owner of the land." If they stipulate two conditions within one condition, then it is a corrupt condition. And if you are granted a child, you accept him, and the matter is clear. Whoever wants to confuse himself, let him confuse himself.
[560] 4 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Issa, from Muhammad ibn Ismail ibn Buzi', who said: A man asked al-Rida (peace be upon him), and I was listening, about a man who marries a woman in Mut'ah and stipulates that he will not seek her child, then she comes afterwards with a child, can he deny the child? He (Imam al-Rida) was stern about that and said: "He denies? And how can he deny?" Exaggerating the matter. The man said: "But I suspect her." He said: "It is not fitting for you to marry except a trustworthy woman. Verily, Allah the Exalted says: (The adulterer does not marry except an adulteress or a polytheist, and the adulteress - none marries her except an adulterer or a polytheist. And that has been made unlawful to the believers)."
[561] 5 - As for what al-Husayn ibn Sa'id narrated, from Safwan, from Ibn Muskan, from Umar ibn Hanzala who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about the conditions of Mut'ah, and he said: "He stipulates with her whatever he wants of gifts, and he stipulates the child if he wants, and there is no inheritance between them."
The explanation regarding his saying "and he stipulates the child if he wants" is that we interpret it as meaning abandoning *al-'azl* (coitus interruptus) and having intercourse with her in a way that a child would result, according to the norm, because he has the option to stipulate *al-'azl* and he has the option to stipulate *al-ifda'* (unrestricted intercourse), and he has a choice in that. So the Imam (peace be upon him) expressed what is a cause, or like a cause, for the child, as the child, in a form of metaphor. And the report did not address the choice of accepting or rejecting the child in any case.

لأبيه قال: الحد في ذلك المباشرة ظاهرة أو باطنة مما يشبه مس الفرجين.
فلا ينافي الخبرين الأولين لان هذا الخبر مخالف لكتاب الله والخبران الأولان مطابقان له قال الله تعالى: (ولا تنكحوا ما نكح آباؤكم من النساء) وقال عز وجل:
(وحلائل أبنائكم من أصلابكم) ولم يقيد بالدخول فينبغي أن يتعلق الحظر بنفس العقد، على أن هذا الخبر مرسل منقطع وطريقه محمد بن عيسى بن عبيد عن يونس وهو ضعيف، وقد استثناه أبو جعفر محمد بن علي بن الحسين بن بابويه رحمه الله من جملة الرجال الذين روى عنهم صاحب نوادر الحكمة وقال: ما يختص بروايته لا أرويه ومن هذه صورته في الضعف لا يعترض بحديثه، ويحتمل مع سلامته من ذلك شيئين، أحدهما: أن يكون المراد بذلك إذا كان من الأب أو الابن المباشرة ظاهرة أو باطنة مما يشبه مس الفرج من غير عقد فإن ذلك أدنى ما يحرم المرأة على الأب والابن على ما نبينه فيما بعد في أن من زنى بامرأة لا يحل لأبيه ولا لابنه العقد عليها، والوجه الثاني: أن يكون المراد بذكر المرأة في الخبر الجارية لان الجارية لا تحرم بنفس الملك كما أن المرأة تحرم بنفس العقد بل إنما يحرم الوطي أو ما جرى مجراه من القبلة والتجريد والنظر إلى ما لا يحل لغير مالكها النظر إليه على ما نبينه فيما بعد إن شاء الله.
[103 - باب أنه إذا عقد الرجل على امرأة حرمت عليه أمها وإن لم يدخل بها] [569] 1 - محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن الحسين بن موسى الخشاب عن غياث بن كلوب عن إسحاق بن عمار عن جعفر عن أبيه عليهما السلام أن عليا عليه السلام كان يقول:
الربائب عليكم حرام مع الأمهات اللاتي قد دخلتم بهن، هن في الحجور وغير الحجور سواء، والأمهات مبهمات دخل بالبنات أو لم يدخل بهن فحرموا وأبهموا ما أبهم الله.

This does not contradict the first two narrations, because this narration contradicts the Book of Allah, while the first two narrations are in accordance with it. Allah the Almighty said: "And do not marry those [women] whom your fathers married," and He, the Mighty and Sublime, said: "And the wives of your sons from your own loins," and He did not restrict it to consummation. Therefore, the prohibition should be related to the contract itself, given that this narration is *mursal* (disconnected) *munqati‘* (broken chain) and its route is Muhammad ibn Isa ibn Ubayd from Yunus, and he is *da'īf* (weak). Abu Ja'far Muhammad ibn Ali ibn al-Hussein ibn Babawayh, may Allah have mercy on him, has excluded him from the group of men from whom the author of *Nawadir al-Hikmah* narrated, and said: "I do not narrate what is specific to his narration," and one whose condition is like this in weakness, his hadith should not be contested. It can also be interpreted in two ways, even if it is free from that. The first: that what is meant by that is if there is direct contact from the father or the son, whether apparent or hidden, resembling the touching of the private parts without a contract, then that is the least that makes the woman forbidden to the father and the son, as we will explain later, that whoever commits *zina* (unlawful sexual intercourse) with a woman, it is not permissible for his father or his son to marry her. The second aspect: that what is meant by mentioning the woman in the narration is a slave girl, because the slave girl is not forbidden by the ownership itself, just as the woman is forbidden by the contract itself, but rather what is forbidden is intercourse or what takes its place of kissing, undressing, and looking at what is not permissible for anyone other than her owner to look at, as we will explain later, God willing.
[103 - Chapter on if a man makes a marriage contract with a woman, her mother becomes forbidden to him even if he has not consummated the marriage] [569] 1 - Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya from al-Hussein ibn Musa al-Khashab from Ghiyath ibn Kallub from Ishaq ibn Ammar from Ja'far from his father, peace be upon them, that Ali, peace be upon him, used to say:
Stepdaughters are forbidden to you along with the mothers with whom you have consummated marriage. They are the same whether they are in your care or not. The mothers are generally forbidden whether there has been consummation with the daughters or not, so forbid them and make ambiguous what Allah has made ambiguous.

text:
فقال له علي عليه السلام: من أين أخذتها؟ فقال: من قول الله تعالى: (وربائبكم اللاتي في حجوركم من نسائكم اللاتي دخلتم بهن فإن لم تكونوا دخلتم بهن فلا جناح عليكم) فقال علي عليه السلام: إن هذه مستثناة وهذه مرسلة وأمهات نسائكم، فقال أبو عبد الله عليه السلام للرجل: أما تسمع ما يروى هذا عن علي عليه السلام فلما قمت ندمت وقلت أي شئ صنعت يقول هو قد فعله رجل منا فلم نر به بأسا وأقول أنا قضى علي عليه السلام فيها فلقيته بعد ذلك فقلت: جعلت فداك إن مسألة الرجل إنما كان الذي كنت تقول كان زلة مني فما تقول فيها؟ فقال: يا شيخ تخبرني إن عليا عليه السلام قضى فيها وتسألني ما تقول فيها.
فهذان الخبران شاذان مخالفان لظاهر كتاب الله تعالى قال الله تعالى: (وأمهات نسائكم) ولم يشترط الدخول بالبنت كما اشترط في الام الدخول لتحريم الربيبة فينبغي أن تكون الآية على إطلاقها ولا يلتفت إلى ما يخالفه ويضاده لما روي عنهم عليهم السلام ما أتاك عنا فاعرضوه على كتاب الله فما وافق كتاب الله فخذوا به وما خالفه فاطرحوه، ويمكن أن يكون الخبران وردا على ضرب من التقية لان ذلك مذهب بعض العامة.
[574] 6 - واما ما رواه محمد بن الحسن الصفار عن محمد بن عبد الجبار عن العباس بن معروف عن صفوان بن يحيى عن محمد بن إسحاق بن عمار قال قلت له: رجل تزوج امرأة ودخل بها ثم ماتت أيحل له أن يتزوج أمها؟ قال: سبحان الله كيف تحل له أمها وقد دخل بها، قال قلت له: فرجل تزوج امرأة فهلكت قبل أن يدخل بها أتحل له أمها؟ قال: وما الذي يحرم عليه منها ولم يدخل بها.

'Ali (peace be upon him) said to him: "From where did you derive this?" He said: "From the saying of God Almighty: '…your stepdaughters under your guardianship, born of your wives with whom you have consummated marriage—but if you have not consummated marriage with them, then there is no blame upon you' (Quran 4:23)." 'Ali (peace be upon him) said: "This is an exception, and this is unrestricted: '…and [forbidden to you are] the mothers of your wives…'" Abu 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) said to the man: "Do you not hear what is narrated about this from 'Ali (peace be upon him)?" When I stood up, I regretted it and said: "What have I done? He says that one of our men did it and we saw no harm in it, and I say that 'Ali (peace be upon him) ruled on it." Then I met him after that and said: "May I be made your ransom, the man's question, what you were saying, was a slip of mine. What do you say about it?" He said: "O Sheikh, you inform me that 'Ali (peace be upon him) ruled on it, and you ask me what I say about it?"

These two narrations are anomalous, contradicting the apparent meaning of the Book of God Almighty. God Almighty said: "…and [forbidden to you are] the mothers of your wives…" and did not stipulate consummation with the daughter, as He stipulated for the mother’s consummation to prohibit the stepdaughter. So the verse should be taken in its unrestricted sense, and no attention should be paid to what contradicts and opposes it, because it is narrated from them (peace be upon them): "Whatever comes to you from us, present it to the Book of God. Whatever agrees with the Book of God, take it, and whatever contradicts it, discard it." It is possible that the two narrations were based on a form of taqiyya (dissimulation), because that is the view of some of the common people.
[574] 6 - As for what Muhammad ibn al-Hasan al-Saffar narrated from Muhammad ibn 'Abd al-Jabbar from al-'Abbas ibn Ma'ruf from Safwan ibn Yahya from Muhammad ibn Ishaq ibn 'Ammar, he said: I said to him: "A man married a woman and consummated the marriage with her, then she died. Is it permissible for him to marry her mother?" He said: "Glory be to God! How is it permissible for him to marry her mother when he consummated the marriage with her?" He said: I said to him: "A man married a woman and she died before he consummated the marriage with her. Is it permissible for him to marry her mother?" He said: "What is prohibited to him from her when he did not consummate the marriage with her?"

فالوجه في هذا الخبر أيضا ما قلناه في الخبرين الأولين سواء على أن محمد بن إسحاق ابن عمار الراوي لهذا الحديث قال قلت له: ولم يذكر من وهو ويحتمل أن يكون الذي سأله غير الامام الذي يجب المصير إلى قوله، فإذا احتمل ذلك سقطت المعارضة به.

[576] 2 - البزوفري عن حميد بن زياد عن الحسن بن محمد عن محمد بن زياد عن عمار ابن مروان عن أبي بصير عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال قلت له: الرجل يكون عنده المملوكة وابنتها فيطأ إحديهما فتموت وتبقى الأخرى أيصلح له أن يطأها؟ قال: لا.
[577] 3 - الحسين بن سعيد قال: كتبت إلى أبي الحسن عليه السلام رجل كانت له أمة يطأها فماتت أو باعها ثم أصاب بعد ذلك أمها هل له أن ينكحها؟ فكتب: لا تحل له.

Allah only forbade that with free women, but as for female slaves, there is no problem with it.”
The first thing about it is that this report is odd and rare; no one narrated it except Razin, the seller of carpets, even if it is repeated in books. Matters like this in their oddity cannot be used to contradict the numerous reports and the apparent meaning of the Quran. Moreover, this same narrator has narrated something that contradicts this narration and corresponds to the previous narrations. If that is the case, then what he alone narrated should be rejected, and what he narrated in agreement with the narration of others should be accepted.
[586] 8 - Abu Abdullah Al-Bazufari narrated from Ahmad bin Idris from Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Isa from Al-Qasim bin Muhammad from Aban bin Uthman from Razin, the seller of carpets, from Abu Jaafar, peace be upon him, concerning a man who had a female slave and had sexual relations with her, then he bought her mother and her daughter. He said: “She is not lawful for him. The mother and the daughter are the same.”
[587] 9 - As for what Al-Saffar narrated from Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Isa from Muhammad bin Sinan from Hammad bin Isa and Khalaf bin Rub'i from Al-Fudayl, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, about

text:
رجل كانت له مملوكة يطأها فماتت ثم يصيب بعد ابنتها قال: لا بأس ليست بمنزلة الحرة.
فهذا الخبر ليس فيه ذكر الوطئ وإنما تضمن أن له أن يصيبها ويجوز أن يصيبها فيما بعد بأن يملكها ويستخدمها وإنما يحرم عليه وطؤها على ما تقدم القول في غيرها، والذي يدل أيضا على أن حكم الأمة والحرة في هذا سواء.
[588] 10 - ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن صفوان عن العلا بن رزين عن محمد بن مسلم قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل كانت له جارية فعتقت وتزوجت فولدت، لمولاها الأول أن يتزوج ابنتها؟ قال: هي عليه حرام وهي ابنته، المملوكة والحرة في هذا سواء ثم قرأ: (وربائبكم اللاتي في حجوركم من نسائكم).
[106 - باب حد الدخول الذي يحرم معه نكاح الربيبة] [589] 1 - أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن ابن أبي نجران عن صفوان بن يحيى عن عيص ابن القاسم قال سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل باشر امرأة وقبل غير أنه لم يفض إليها ثم تزوج ابنتها قال: إن لم يكن أفضى إلى الام فلا بأس وإن كان أفضى فلا يتزوج.
[590] 2 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن علي ابن الحكم عن علا بن رزين عن محمد بن مسلم عن أحدهما عليهما السلام قال:
سألته عن رجل تزوج امرأة فنظر إلى رأسها وإلى بعض جسدها أيتزوج ابنتها؟
قال: لا إذا رأى منها ما يحرم على غيره فليس له أن يتزوج ابنتها.
[591] 3 - عنه عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن ابن محبوب عن خالد بن جرير

A man had a female slave with whom he had intercourse, and she died. Then he had intercourse with her daughter. He said: There is no problem, she is not like a free woman.

This report does not mention intercourse, but it implies that he is allowed to have intercourse with her, and it is permissible for him to have intercourse with her later by owning her and using her. It is only forbidden for him to have intercourse with her as previously stated regarding others. What also indicates that the ruling on a slave woman and a free woman is the same in this regard is:

[588] 10 - What Al-Husayn bin Saeed narrated from Safwan from Al-Ala bin Razin from Muhammad bin Muslim who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a man who had a slave girl, and she was freed and married and gave birth. Is it permissible for her former master to marry her daughter? He said: She is forbidden to him, she is his daughter. The slave woman and the free woman are the same in this regard. Then he recited: "And your stepdaughters under your guardianship, born of your wives..." (Quran 4:23).

[106 - Chapter on the degree of consummation that prohibits marriage to the stepdaughter]
[589] 1 - Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Issa from Ibn Abi Najran from Safwan bin Yahya from Eis bin Al-Qasim who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a man who touched a woman and kissed her, but did not penetrate her, then married her daughter. He said: If he did not penetrate the mother, there is no problem, but if he did penetrate her, then he cannot marry (the daughter).

[590] 2 - As for what Muhammad bin Yaqub narrated from Muhammad bin Yahya from Ahmad bin Muhammad from Ali bin Al-Hakam from Ala bin Razin from Muhammad bin Muslim from one of them (peace be upon them) who said:
I asked him about a man who married a woman and looked at her head and some of her body, can he marry her daughter?
He said: No, if he saw from her what is forbidden to others, then he is not allowed to marry her daughter.

[591] 3 - From him, from Muhammad bin Yahya, from Ahmad bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahbub, from Khalid bin Jarir

text:
عن أبي الربيع قال سئل أبو عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل تزوج امرأة فمكث معها أياما لا يستطيعها غير أنه قد رأى منها ما يحرم على غيره ثم طلقها أيصلح له أن يتزوج ابنتها؟ فقال: أيصلح له وقد رأى من أمها ما رأى.
[592] 4 - الحسين بن سعيد عن فضالة عن أبان عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام مثله.
فالوجه في هذه الروايات ضرب من الكراهية دون الحظر لان الذي يقتضي التحريم الرواية الأولى لأنها مطابقة لظاهر الكتاب قال الله تعالى: (وربائبكم اللاتي في حجوركم من نسائكم اللاتي دخلتم بهن فإن لم تكونوا دخلتم بهن فلا جناح عليكم) فعلق التحريم بالدخول حسب ما تضمنه الخبر الأول.
[107 - باب الرجل يزني بالمرأة هل يحل لأبيه أو لابنه أن يتزوجها أم لا أو يملك الجارية فيطأها الابن قبل أن يطأها الأب هل تحرم على الأب أم لا] [593] 1 - محمد بن الحسن الصفار عن أحمد بن محمد عن أبيه محمد بن عيسى بن عبد الله الأشعري عن محمد بن أبي عمير عن أبي بصير قال: سألته عن الرجل يفجر بالمرأة أتحل لابنه؟ أو يفجر بها الابن أتحل لأبيه؟ قال: إن كان الأب أو الابن مسها وأخذ منها فلا تحل.
[594] 2 - محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن بنان بن محمد عن موسى بن القاسم عن علي بن جعفر عن أخيه موسى بن جعفر عليه السلام قال: سألته عن رجل زنى بامرأة هل يحل لابنه أن يتزوجها؟ قال: لا.
[595] 3 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن محمد بن أبي عمير عن هاشم بن المثنى

From Abi al-Rabee’, who said: Abu ‘Abdillah (peace be upon him) was asked about a man who married a woman and stayed with her for days without being able to have intercourse, but he saw from her what is forbidden for others to see. Then he divorced her. Is it permissible for him to marry her daughter? He said: Is it permissible for him when he has seen from her mother what he has seen?
[592] 4 - Al-Husayn bin Sa’eed from Fadalah from Aban from Muhammad bin Muslim from Abi Ja’far (peace be upon him) similarly.
The interpretation of these narrations is a form of disapproval, not prohibition, because what necessitates prohibition is the first narration, as it conforms to the apparent meaning of the Book of Allah, the Exalted: "…your stepdaughters under your guardianship, born of your wives with whom you have consummated marriage. But if you have not consummated marriage with them, then there is no blame upon you" (Quran 4:23). Thus, the prohibition is tied to consummation of the marriage, according to what the first report implies.
[107 - Chapter on a Man Who Commits Adultery with a Woman: Is it Permissible for His Father or Son to Marry Her, or Does He Possess a Slave Girl and the Son Has Intercourse with Her Before the Father, Is She Forbidden to the Father or Not?]
[593] 1 - Muhammad bin al-Hasan al-Saffar from Ahmad bin Muhammad from his father Muhammad bin ‘Isa bin ‘Abdillah al-Ash’ari from Muhammad bin Abi ‘Umayr from Abi Baseer, who said: I asked him about a man who commits adultery with a woman, is she permissible for his son? Or if the son commits adultery with her, is she permissible for his father? He said: If the father or the son touched her and took from her, then she is not permissible.
[594] 2 - Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Yahya from Banan bin Muhammad from Musa bin al-Qasim from Ali bin Ja’far from his brother Musa bin Ja’far (peace be upon him), who said: I asked him about a man who committed adultery with a woman, is it permissible for his son to marry her? He said: No.
[595] 3 - As for what Ahmad bin Muhammad bin ‘Isa narrated from Muhammad bin Abi ‘Umayr from Hashim bin al-Muthanna

text:
عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام أنه قال: إن الحرام لا يفسد الحلال.
[596] 4 - عنه عن الحسن عن صفوان عن حنان بن سدير عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام أنه قال: ان الحرام لا يفسد الحلال.
فالوجه في هذين الخبرين أن نخصهما بأنه إذا كان الرجل عنده امرأة دخل بها فزنى بها أبوه أو ابنه فإن ذلك لا يحرم المرأة عليه وكذلك لا يمنعه من وطئ الجارية إذا كان وطؤها بعد الملك ومتى لم يكن قد عقد عليها وزنا بها وملكها فوطئها ثم زنا بها الابن فإن ذلك يمنعه من العقد عليها واستباحة وطئها بالملك، يدل على هذا التفصيل:
[597] 5 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن عدة من أصحابنا عن سهل بن زياد عن موسى بن جعفر عن عمرو بن سعيد عن مصدق بن صدقة عن عمار عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في الرجل تكون له الجارية فيقع عليها ابن ابنه قبل أن يطأها الجد أو الرجل يزني بالمرأة هل يحل لابنه أن يتزوجها؟ قال: لا إنما ذلك إذا تزوجها فوطئها ثم زنى بها ابنه لم يضره لان الحرام لا يفسد الحلال وكذلك الجارية.
[598] 6 - وأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن أبي نصر عن حماد بن عثمان عن مرازم قال:
سمعت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام وسئل عن امرأة أمرت ابنها أن يقع على جارية لأبيه فقال: أثمت واثم ابنها، وقد سألني بعض هؤلاء عن هذه المسألة فقلت: له أمسكها فإن الحلال لا يفسده الحرام.
فلا ينافي الخبر الأول لأنه ليس في هذا الخبر انها أمرت ابنها بمواقعتها قبل وطئ الأب أو بعده وإذا لم يكن في ظاهره واحتمل المعنيين معا حملناه على ما قدمناه لان الخبر مفصل وهذا الخبر مجمل والحكم بالمفصل أولى منه بالمجمل.

translation:

From Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: "Indeed, the unlawful does not invalidate the lawful."
[596] 4 - From him, from al-Hassan, from Safwan, from Hanan bin Sudair, from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: "Indeed, the unlawful does not invalidate the lawful."
The interpretation of these two narrations is that we specify them to when a man has a wife with whom he has consummated the marriage, and then his father or his son commits adultery with her, then that does not make the woman unlawful for him. Likewise, it does not prevent him from having intercourse with a slave girl if he has intercourse with her after owning her. But if he has not yet made a contract with her and commits adultery with her, and then owns her and has intercourse with her, then the son commits adultery with her, then that prevents him from contracting with her and making her intercourse permissible through ownership. This detail is indicated by:
[597] 5 - What Muhammad bin Ya'qub narrated from several of our companions, from Sahl bin Ziyad, from Musa bin Jaafar, from Amr bin Saeed, from Musaddiq bin Sadaqa, from Ammar, from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, regarding a man who has a slave girl with whom his grandson has intercourse before the grandfather has intercourse with her, or a man who commits adultery with a woman, is it permissible for his son to marry her? He said: "No. That is only if he marries her and has intercourse with her, then his son commits adultery with her, it does not harm him because the unlawful does not invalidate the lawful, and likewise with the slave girl."
[598] 6 - As for what Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Abi Nasr narrated from Hammad bin Uthman from Murazim, who said:
I heard Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, and he was asked about a woman who ordered her son to have intercourse with a slave girl belonging to her father, and he said: "She has sinned, and her son has sinned." And some of these people asked me about this matter, and I said to him: "Keep her, for the lawful is not invalidated by the unlawful."
This does not contradict the first narration because it is not in this narration that she ordered her son to have intercourse with her before or after the father had intercourse with her. And if it is not apparent in it and it bears both meanings, we carry it on what we have presented, because the narration is detailed and this narration is general, and judging by the detailed is more appropriate than judging by the general.

عن أحدهما عليهما السلام أنه سئل عن الرجل يفجر بالمرأة أيتزوج ابنتها؟ قال: لا ولكن إن كانت عنده امرأة ثم فجر بأمها أو أختها لم تحرم عليه التي عنده.
[604] 5 - عنه عن محمد بن الفضيل عن أبي الصباح الكناني عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: إذا فجر الرجل بالمرأة لم تحل له ابنتها أبدا، وإن كان قد تزوج ابنتها قبل ذلك ولم يدخل بها فقد بطل تزويجه، وإن هو تزوج ابنتها ودخل بها ثم فجر بأمها بعد ما دخل بابنتها فليس يفسد فجوره بأمها نكاح ابنتها إذا هو دخل بها وهو قوله لا يفسد الحرام الحلال إذا كان هكذا.
[605] 6 - فأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن عثمان بن عيسى وعلي بن نعمان عن سعيد بن يسار قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل فجر بامرأة يتزوج ابنتها؟ فقال:
نعم يا سعيد ان الحرام لا يفسد الحلال.
[606] 7 - أحمد بن محمد عن معاوية بن حكيم عن علي بن الحسن بن رباط عمن رواه عن زرارة قال: قلت لأبي جعفر عليه السلام رجل فجر بامرأة هل يجوز له أن يتزوج بابنتها؟ قال: ما حرم حرام حلالا قط.
فالوجه في هذين الخبرين وما جرى مجراهما يتضمن لفظ التزويج في المستقبل أو الحال هو إذا كان الفجور بالمرأة دون الوطئ والافضاء إليها، فأما مع الافضاء فلا يجوز على ما قدمناه، يدل على هذا التفصيل:

سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل باشر امرأة وقبل غير أنه لم يفض إليها ثم

text:
تزوج ابنتها فقال: إذا كان لم يكن أفضى إلى الام فلا بأس، وإن كان أفضى إليها فلا يتزوج ابنتها.
[608] 9 - عنه عن أبي علي الأشعري عن محمد بن عبد الجبار عن صفوان عن منصور ابن حازم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل كان بينه وبين امرأة فجور هل يتزوج ابنتها؟ قال: إن كان قبلة أو شبهها فليتزوج ابنتها، وإن كان جماعا فلا يتزوج ابنتها وليتزوجها هي إن شاء، والذي يدل على أن الوطئ بعد الدخول لا يحرم زائدا على ما قدمناه:
[609] 10 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل تزوج جارية ثم دخل بها ثم ابتلى بأمها ففجر بها أتحرم عليه امرأته؟ فقال: لا، انه لا يحرم الحلال الحرام.
[610] 11 - عنه عن علي بن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن ابن أذينة عن زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام أنه قال: في رجل زنى بأم امرأته أو بابنتها أو بأختها فقال: لا يحرم ذلك عليه امرأته ثم قال: ما حرم حرام قط حلالا.
والذي يدل على ما قلناه من أن ذلك يحرم ابتداء التزويج أنه قد حرم ذلك من جهة الرضاع فإذا كان من النسب فهو أولى بالتحريم روى ذلك:
[611] 12 - محمد بن يعقوب عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن علي بن الحكم عن العلا بن رزين عن محمد بن مسلم عن أحدهما عليهما السلام قال: سألته عن رجل فجر بامرأة أيتزوج أمها من الرضاعة أو ابنتها؟ قال: لا.
[612] 13 - عنه عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن ابن محبوب عن العلا بن رزين عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام في رجل فجر بامرأة أيتزوج أمها من الرضاعة أو ابنتها؟ قال: لا.

He married her daughter, so he said: If he did not have intercourse with the mother, then there is no problem, but if he did have intercourse with her, then he should not marry her daughter.
[608] 9 - From him, from Abu Ali al-Ash'ari, from Muhammad ibn Abd al-Jabbar, from Safwan, from Mansur Ibn Hazim, from Abi Abd Allah, peace be upon him, about a man who committed fornication with a woman, is it permissible for him to marry her daughter? [109 - باب كراهية العقد على الفاجرة] [613] 1 - أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن أبي المعزا عن الحلبي قال قال: أبو عبد الله عليه السلام لا تتزوج المرأة المعلنة بالزنا ولا تزوج الرجل المعلن بالزنا إلا أن يعرف منهما التوبة.
[614] 2 - وبالاسناد عن أبي المعزا عن أبي بصير قال: سألته عن رجل فجر بامرأة ثم أراد أن يتزوجها فقال: إذا تابت حل له نكاحها قلت له: كيف تعرف توبتها؟
قال: يدعوها إلى ما كانا عليه من الحرام فإن امتنعت واستغفرت ربها عرف توبتها.
[615] 3 - محمد بن يعقوب عن محمد بن يحيى عن محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن الحسن عن عمرو بن سعيد عن مصدق بن صدقة عن عمار بن موسى عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن الرجل يحل له أن يتزوج امرأة كان يفجر بها؟ فقال:
ان أنس منها رشدا فنعم وإلا فليراودها على الحرام فإن تابعته فهي عليه حرام وإن أبت فليتزوجها.
[616] 4 - فأما ما رواه علي بن الحسن عن علي بن الحكم عن موسى بن بكر عن زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال سئل عن رجل أعجبته امرأة فسأل عنها فإذا الثنا عليها شئ في الفجور فقال: لا بأس بأن يتزوجها ويحصنها.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أحد شيئين، أحدهما: أن يكون ذلك إخبارا عن صحة العقد وإن كان قد فعل محظورا، والثاني: أن يكون المراد بقوله: " لا بأس بأن يتزوجها

[109 - Chapter on the Dislikedness of Marrying an Immoral Woman] [613] 1 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa from Abi al-Mu'azza from al-Halabi who said: Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, said: "Do not marry a woman who openly commits adultery, nor marry a man who openly commits adultery, unless repentance is known from them."
[614] 2 - And with the Isnad (chain of narration) from Abi al-Mu'azza from Abi Basir who said: I asked him about a man who committed adultery with a woman and then wanted to marry her. He said: "If she repents, it is permissible for him to marry her." I said to him: "How do you know her repentance?"
He said: "He should invite her to what they used to do of the forbidden, and if she refuses and asks forgiveness from her Lord, her repentance is known."
[615] 3 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub from Muhammad ibn Yahya from Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya from Ahmad ibn al-Hasan from Amr ibn Sa'id from Musaddiq ibn Sadaqa from Ammar ibn Musa from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: I asked him about a man, is it permissible for him to marry a woman with whom he used to commit adultery? He said:
"If he perceives rectitude from her, then yes. Otherwise, he should entice her to the forbidden. If she complies, then she is forbidden to him, and if she refuses, then he may marry her."
[616] 4 - As for what Ali ibn al-Hasan narrated from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Musa ibn Bakr from Zurara from Abi Jaafar, peace be upon him, who said: He was asked about a man who admired a woman, so he asked about her, and the praise for her was something related to immorality. He said: "There is no harm in marrying her and protecting her."
The interpretation of this report is one of two things, one of them: that it is informing about the validity of the marriage contract even if a forbidden act has been committed, and the second: that what is meant by his saying: "There is no harm in marrying her.

ويحصنها " إذا تابت وليس في الخبر أنه لا بأس بذلك مع إصرارها على القبيح.
[110 - باب الرجل يعقد على امرأة ثم يعقد على أختها وهو لا يعلم] [617] 1 - محمد بن يعقوب عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن الحسن بن محبوب عن ابن بكير عن علي بن رئاب عن زرارة بن أعين قال: سألت أبا جعفر عليه السلام عن رجل تزوج امرأة بالعراق ثم خرج إلى الشام فتزوج امرأة أخرى فإذا هي أخت امرأته التي بالعراق قال: يفرق بينه وبين التي تزوجها بالشام ولا يقرب المرأة حتى تنقضي عدة الشامية، قلت: فإن تزوج امرأة ثم تزوج أمها وهو لا يعلم أنها أمها قال: قد وضع الله تعالى عنه جهالته بذلك ثم قال إذا علم أنها أمها فلا يقربها ولا يقرب البنت حتى تنقضي عدة الام منه فإذا أنقضت عدة الام حل له نكاح البنت، قلت: فإن جاءت الام بولد قال: هو ولده ويكون ابنه وأخا امرأته.
[618] 2 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن أبي علي الأشعري عن محمد بن عبد الجبار عن صفوان بن يحيى عن ابن مسكان عن أبي بكر الحضرمي قال: قلت لأبي جعفر عليه السلام رجل نكح امرأة ثم أتى أرضا فنكح أختها وهو لا يعلم قال: يمسك أيتهما شاء ويخلي سبيل الأخرى.
فلا ينافي ما تقدم من الاخبار لان قوله: " يمسك أيتهما شاء " محمول على أنه إذا أراد إمساك الأولة فليمسكها بالعقد الأول الثابت المستقر وإن أراد إمساك الثانية فليطلق الأولى وليمسك الثانية بعقد مستأنف ولا تنافي بينهما على هذا الوجه.
[111 - باب أنه إذا طلق الرجل امرأته تطليقة باينة جاز له العقد على أختها في الحال] [619] 1 - محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد

And it fortifies her "if she repents," and there is nothing in the report indicating that there is nothing wrong with that if she insists on the reprehensible.
[110 - Chapter on a Man Marrying a Woman and Then Marrying Her Sister Without Knowing] [617] 1 - Muhammad bin Ya'qub from Muhammad bin Yahya from Ahmad bin Muhammad from al-Hasan bin Mahbub from Ibn Bukair from Ali bin Ri'ab from Zurarah bin A'yan who said: I asked Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him, about a man who married a woman in Iraq, then went to Syria and married another woman, and she turned out to be the sister of his wife who is in Iraq. He said: "He should be separated from the one he married in Syria, and he should not approach the woman until the waiting period of the Syrian woman expires." I said: "What if he marries a woman and then marries her mother, and he does not know that she is her mother?" He said: "Allah the Almighty has relieved him of his ignorance in that matter." Then he said: "If he knows that she is her mother, then he should not approach her, nor should he approach the daughter until the mother's waiting period expires. When the mother's waiting period expires, it is permissible for him to marry the daughter." I said: "If the mother has a child?" He said: "He is his child, and he will be his son and his wife's brother."
[618] 2 - As for what Muhammad bin Ya'qub narrated from Abi Ali al-Ash'ari from Muhammad bin Abdul Jabbar from Safwan bin Yahya from Ibn Miskan from Abi Bakr al-Hadhrami who said: I said to Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him: "A man married a woman, then came to a land and married her sister, and he did not know." He said: "He may keep whichever of them he wishes and release the other."
This does not contradict the preceding reports, because his statement: "He may keep whichever of them he wishes" is to be understood as meaning that if he wants to keep the first, then he should keep her with the first established and settled contract, and if he wants to keep the second, then he should divorce the first and keep the second with a new contract, and there is no contradiction between them in this way.
[111 - Chapter on If a Man Divorces His Wife with an Irrevocable Divorce, It Is Permissible for Him to Marry Her Sister Immediately] [619] 1 - Muhammad bin Ya'qub from Ali bin Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umair from Hammad

text:
عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل طلق امرأته أو اختلعت أو بارأت أله أن يتزوج بأختها؟ فقال: إذا أبرأ عصمتها ولم يكن له عليها رجعة فله أن يخطب أختها.
[620] 2 - عنه عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن محمد بن إسماعيل بن بزيع عن محمد بن الفضيل عن أبي الصباح الكناني عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال:
سألته عن رجل اختلعت منه امرأته أيحل له أن يخطب أختها قبل أن تنقضي عدتها؟
فقال: إذا برئت عصمتها ولم يكن له رجعة فقد حل له أن يخطب أختها.
[621] 3 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن الحسين بن محمد عن معلى بن محمد عن الحسن ابن علي الوشا عن ابان عن زرارة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل طلق امرأته وهي حبلى أيتزوج أختها قبل أن تضع؟ قال: لا يتزوجها حتى يخلوا أجلها.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على أنه إذا كان طلاقا يملك فيه رجعتها بدلالة ما قدمناه من الاخبار وانها تضمنت إذا طلقها طلاقا باينا جاز له العقد على أختها وإن لم تخرج من العدة وتلك الأخبار مفصلة والعمل بها أولى من العمل بهذا الخبر المجمل.
[622] 4 - واما ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن إسماعيل بن مرار عن يونس قال: قرأت في كتاب رجل إلى أبي الحسن الرضا عليه السلام، وروى الحسين بن سعيد أيضا قال: قرأت في كتاب رجل إلى أبي الحسن الرضا عليه السلام جعلت فداك الرجل يتزوج المرأة متعة إلى أجل مسمى فيقضى الاجل بينهما هل له أن ينكح أختها قبل أن تنقضي عدتها؟ فكتب: لا يحل أن يتزوجها حتى تنقضي عدتها.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أحد شيئين، أحدهما: أن يونس والحسين بن سعيد لم يرويا

From al-Halabi, from Abi ‘Abdillah (peace be upon him), regarding a man who divorces his wife, or she obtains khul‘ (divorce initiated by the wife), or they mutually agree to separate; is it permissible for him to marry her sister? He said: If she relinquishes her claim on him and he has no right to take her back, then it is permissible for him to propose to her sister.
[620] 2 - From him, from Muhammad ibn Yahya, from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa, from Muhammad ibn Isma‘il ibn Bazi‘, from Muhammad ibn al-Fudayl, from Abi al- Sabbah al-Kinani, from Abi ‘Abdillah (peace be upon him) who said:
I asked him about a man whose wife obtained khul‘ from him; is it permissible for him to propose to her sister before her waiting period (iddah) ends?
He said: If she relinquishes her claim on him and he has no right of return, then it is permissible for him to propose to her sister.
[621] 3 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ya‘qub narrated, from al-Husayn ibn Muhammad, from Mu‘alla ibn Muhammad, from al-Hasan ibn ‘Ali al-Washa, from Aban, from Zurarah, from Abi ‘Abdillah (peace be upon him) regarding a man who divorces his wife while she is pregnant; is he allowed to marry her sister before she gives birth? He said: He should not marry her until her term expires.
The interpretation of this report is that we should understand it to mean that it is a divorce in which he has the right to take her back, as indicated by the reports we presented earlier, which imply that if he divorces her with an irrevocable divorce, it is permissible for him to marry her sister even if she has not completed her waiting period. Those reports are detailed, and acting upon them is preferable to acting upon this concise report.
[622] 4 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ya‘qub narrated, from ‘Ali ibn Ibrahim, from his father, from Isma‘il ibn Marrar, from Yunus, who said: I read in a letter from a man to Abi al-Hasan al-Ridha (peace be upon him), and al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id also narrated, saying: I read in a letter from a man to Abi al-Hasan al-Ridha (peace be upon him), may I be your ransom, a man marries a woman in mut‘ah (temporary marriage) for a specified period, and the period between them ends; is it permissible for him to marry her sister before her waiting period ends? He wrote: It is not permissible for him to marry her until her waiting period ends.
The interpretation of this report is one of two things: either Yunus and al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id did not narrate

[623] 5 - وأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن القاسم عن علي عن أبي إبراهيم عليه السلام قال: سألته عن رجل طلق امرأته أيتزوج أختها؟ قال: لا حتى تنقضي عدتها.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أيضا ما قدمناه في الخبر المتقدم ذكره من حمله على طلاق رجعي دون بائن لأنا إنما جوزنا ذلك على الطلاق البائن لا غير.
[112 - باب تحريم الجمع بين الأختين في المتعة] ظاهر قوله تعالى: (وأن تجمعوا بين الأختين) عام في تحريم الجمع بينهما على كل حال سواء كان عقد دوام أو عقد متعة أو ملك يمين، والاخبار التي أوردناها في النهي عن الجمع بين الأختين في كتابنا الكبير أيضا تتناول المتعة ونكاح الدوام على حد سواء.
[624] 1 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن أبي عبد الله البرقي عن محمد بن سنان عن منصور الصيقل عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: لا بأس بالرجل يتمتع بأختين.
فلا ينافي ذلك لأنه ليس في ظاهر الخبر أن له أن يتمتع بهما على الجمع أو على الانفراد وإذا لم يكن ذلك في ظاهره حملناه على جواز ذلك في واحدة بعد أخرى دون الجمع بينهما.
[113 - باب النهي عن الجمع بين الأختين في الوطئ بملك اليمين] [625] 1 - الحسين بن سعيد عن النضر بن سويد عن عبد الله بن سنان قال: سمعت

from an infallible Imam, nor from someone who narrated it from an Imam. Rather, they said, "We found it in a man's book," and not everything found in books is correct. Even if we concede its validity, it would only allow us to restrict it to *mut'ah* (temporary marriage) and not permanent marriage.
[623] 5 - As for what Al-Husayn ibn Sa'id narrated from al-Qasim, from 'Ali, from Abi Ibrahim (peace be upon him), who said: "I asked him about a man who divorces his wife, can he marry her sister?" He said, "No, not until her waiting period (*'iddah*) is over."
The explanation for this report is also what we mentioned regarding the previous report, which is to interpret it as referring to a revocable divorce (*ṭalāq raj'ī*) rather than an irrevocable divorce (*ṭalāq bā'in*), because we only permitted it in the case of an irrevocable divorce and nothing else.
[112 - Chapter: Prohibition of Combining Two Sisters in *Mut'ah*] The apparent meaning of His saying, "And that you combine two sisters" is general in prohibiting combining them in any case, whether it is a permanent marriage, a *mut'ah* marriage, or ownership of a slave girl. The reports that we mentioned in the prohibition of combining two sisters in our *Kitāb al-Kabīr* (The Great Book) also apply equally to *mut'ah* and permanent marriage.

أبا عبد الله عليه السلام يقول: إذا كانت عند الرجل الأختان المملو كتان فنكح أحدهما ثم بدا له في الثانية فنكحها فليس ينبغي له أن ينكح الأخرى حتى تخرج الأولى من ملكه يهبها أو يبيعها وإن وهبها لولده يجزيه.
[626] 2 - أبو عبد الله البزوفري عن حميد بن زياد عن الحسن عن محمد بن زياد عن معاوية بن عمار قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام) عن رجل كانت عنده جاريتان أختان فوطئ إحداهما ثم بدا له في الأخرى؟ قال: يعتزل هذه ويطأ الأخرى، قال قلت: فإنه تنبعث نفسه إلى الأولى قال: لا يقربها حتى يخرج تلك من ملكه.
[627] 3 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن الحسن بن علي بن يقطين عن أخيه الحسين بن علي عن علي بن يقطين قال: سألت أبا إبراهيم عليه السلام عن أختين مملوكتين وجمعهما؟ قال: مستقيم ولا أحبه لك، قال: وسألته عن الام والبنت المملو كتين؟
قال: هو أشدهما ولا أحبه لك.
فلا ينافي ما تقدم من الاخبار لأنه ليس في ظاهره أن يستقيم الجمع بينهما في الوطئ وإذا لم يكن ذلك في ظاهره حملناه على أنه يستقيم الجمع بينهما في الملك، ويكون قوله عليه السلام: " ولا أحبه لك " كراهية للجمع بينهما في الملك، لان من ملكهما معا ربما تاقت نفسه ودعت شهوته إلى وطئهما فيفعل ذلك فيصير مأثوما.
[628] 4 - وأما ما رواه البزوفري عن حميد بن زياد عن الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة قال:
حدثني الحسين بن هاشم عن ابن مسكان عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال قال:
محمد بن علي عليهما السلام في أختين مملوكتين تكونان عند الرجل جميعا قال قال:
علي عليه السلام أحلتهما آية وحرمتهما آية أخرى وأنا أنهي عنهما نفسي وولدي.
فلا ينافي ما ذكرناه لان قوله عليه السلام: " أحلتهما آية " يعني به الملك دون الوطء

Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) said: "If a man has two slave sisters, and he marries one of them, then he desires the other and marries her, then he should not marry the other until the first one leaves his possession, either by gifting her or selling her. And if he gifts her to his child, it suffices him."
[626] 2 - Abu Abdullah al-Bazufari from Humaid bin Ziyad from al-Hasan from Muhammad bin Ziyad from Muawiyah bin Ammar who said: "I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a man who had two slave sisters and had intercourse with one of them, then he desired the other?" He said: "He should abstain from this one and have intercourse with the other." He said: "I said: 'But his soul inclines to the first one?'" He said: "He should not approach her until he removes that one from his possession."
[627] 3 - As for what Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Issa narrated from al-Hasan bin Ali bin Yaqtin from his brother al-Hussein bin Ali from Ali bin Yaqtin who said: "I asked Abu Ibrahim (peace be upon him) about two slave sisters and combining them?" He said: "It is permissible, but I do not like it for you." He said: "And I asked him about a slave mother and daughter?"
He said: "It is more severe, and I do not like it for you."
This does not contradict the preceding narrations because it is not apparent that combining them is permissible in intercourse. And if that is not apparent, we interpret it as that combining them is permissible in ownership, and his saying (peace be upon him): "But I do not like it for you" is a dislike for combining them in ownership, because whoever owns them both, his soul may long and his desire may call him to have intercourse with them, and he does that, so he becomes sinful.
[628] 4 - As for what al-Bazufari narrated from Humaid bin Ziyad from al-Hasan bin Muhammad bin Sama'a who said:
Al-Hussein bin Hashem narrated to me from Ibn Miskan from al-Halabi from Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: Muhammad bin Ali (peace be upon them) said regarding two slave sisters who are both with a man: Ali (peace be upon him) said: "One verse makes them lawful, and another verse makes them unlawful, and I forbid them for myself and my children."
This does not contradict what we mentioned, because his saying (peace be upon him): "One verse makes them lawful" means by it ownership, not intercourse.

And his saying: "And its prohibition is another verse" means in intercourse, not ownership. There is no contradiction between the two verses nor between the two statements. His saying: "And I forbid myself and my children from them" can be interpreted as referring to intercourse in terms of prohibition, or it can be interpreted as referring to ownership due to a type of dislike that we mentioned earlier. It is possible that his saying, peace be upon him, "A verse made them lawful," means the generality of the verse, so their apparent meaning implies that. Likewise, his saying: "And its prohibition is another verse" means the generality of the verse implies that, except that if the two generalities are juxtaposed in this manner, one of them should be specified by the other. Then, he clarified by saying: "I forbid myself and my children from them" what necessitates specifying one of the two verses and keeping the other in its generality. This view has been narrated from Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him. It was narrated by:
[629] 5 - Ali bin al-Hasan bin Faddal from Muhammad and Ahmad, the two sons of al-Hasan, from their father, from Tha'labah bin Maymun, from Mu'ammar bin Yahya bin Sam, who said: I asked Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him, about what people narrate from Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, about matters concerning private parts that he did not command or forbid except for himself and his children. I said: How can that be? He said: A verse made them lawful, and another verse made them unlawful. So we said: Is it that one of them abrogated the other, or are they both definitive, and one should act according to both? He said: He clarified it for them when he forbade himself and his children. We said: What prevented him from clarifying that to the people? He said: He feared that he would not be obeyed. If Amir al-Mu'minin's feet had been firm, he would have established the entire Book of Allah and the entire truth.

[635] 6 - What Muhammad ibn al-Hasan al-Saffar narrated from Yaqub ibn Yazid from Abi Humam Ismail ibn Humam, who said: Abu al-Hasan (peace be upon him) said: Muhammad ibn Ali (peace be upon him) said regarding a man who marries a woman and marries his son to her daughter, then divorces her, and another man marries her and she gives birth to a daughter from him: He disliked that any of his children marry her because she was his wife, and he divorced her, so she became like a father (to them), and she was previously a mother to them. This report explicitly mentions the dislike that we mentioned.
[636] 7 - As for what Muhammad ibn al-Hasan al-Saffar narrated from Muhammad ibn Isa, who said: I wrote to him: Khushf, the *umm walad* (mother of a child) of Isa ibn Ali ibn Yaqtin, in the year two hundred and thirty, asks about marrying her daughter to al-Husayn ibn Ubayd. I inform you, O my master and lord, that I have betrothed the daughter of your *mawla* (client/associate) Isa ibn Ali ibn Yaqtin to the son of Ubayd ibn Yaqtin. After I betrothed her, they mentioned that her grandmother, the mother of Isa ibn Ali ibn Yaqtin, belonged to Ubayd ibn Yaqtin, then she became the property of Ali ibn Yaqtin, and she bore Isa ibn Ali. They mentioned that the son of Ubayd has become her uncle from the side of her grandmother, the mother of her father, because she belonged to Ubayd ibn Yaqtin. So, what is your opinion, O my master and lord, that you bestow upon your *mawlat* (female client/associate) an explanation from you and inform me whether she is lawful for him? For your *mawlat*, O my master, is in grief, which Allah knows. So, it was written: In this place, between the lines, if he becomes an uncle, she is not lawful for him. The uncle is a father, and an uncle.
Muhammad ibn al-Hasan said: This report can be interpreted in two ways: The first: what is included in the *hadith* of Zayd ibn al-Jahm and al-Husayn ibn Khalid al-Sayrafi, that if a man has a *surriyya* (concubine) and has intercourse with her, then she becomes the property of another man and she bears children from the other man, it is not permissible for his children from the other woman to marry her children from the other man because of his intercourse with her. We have explained that this is interpreted as a form of dislike and that there is no difference between whether the child is before or after the intercourse in that it is not prohibited. The other aspect: is that he only became her uncle because her grandmother, when she belonged to Ubayd ibn Yaqtin, gave birth to al-Husayn ibn Ali from him.

Regarding what has preceded, adding further clarification:

[656] 10 - What Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from Muhammad ibn Sinan from Aban ibn Uthman from Zurara, who said: I heard him (the Imam) say: There is no harm in marrying a Jewish or Christian woman in *mut'a* (temporary marriage) while he has a wife.

As for the narrations that include rulings based on the validity of the contract, such as inheritance, divorce, *idda* (waiting period), and similar matters, they can encompass all that we have mentioned. They may also pertain specifically to someone who was Jewish or Christian and had a Jewish or Christian wife, and then he converts to Islam. In this case, the contract does not become void upon his conversion; rather, it remains valid, and these rulings apply to him according to what is stated in the narrations. What clarifies what we have mentioned is:

[657] 11 - What Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr from Ibn Sinan from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him) regarding a man who emigrated and left his wife among the polytheists, and then she joined him later. Does he keep her in marriage, or is their bond severed? He said: No, rather he keeps her, and she is his wife.

[118 - Chapter: If a Man and Woman are *dhimmis* (protected people) and the Woman Converts to Islam Before the Man]
[658] 1 - Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Mahbub from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn Hadid from Jamil ibn Darraj from some of our companions from one of them (peace be upon them) who said: If a Jewish, Christian, or Magian woman converts to Islam and her husband does not, he said: They remain in their marriage, and they are not separated, and she is not allowed to leave with him from the land of Islam to disbelief.

[659] 2 - As for what Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr, who said:
I asked al-Ridha (peace be upon him) about a man who has a Christian wife, and she converts to Islam. Is it permissible for her to stay with him? text:
فلا ينافي الخبر الأول لان الوجه فيه أن نحمله على من يكون قد أخل بشرائط الذمة فإنه إذا كان كذلك وأسلمت امرأته فإنه ينتظر به مدة انقضاء عدتها فإن أسلم كان أحق بها وإن هو لم يسلم فقد بانت منه، والذي يدل على ذلك من أنهم متى أخلوا بشرائط الذمة بطلت ذمتهم:
[660] 3 - ما رواه علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن عمرو بن عثمان عن الحسن بن محبوب عن علي بن رئاب عن زرارة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: إن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله قبل الجزية من أهل الذمة على أن لا يأكلوا الربا ولا يأكلوا لحم الخنزير ولا ينكحون الأخوات ولا بنات الأخ ولا بنات الأخت فمن فعل ذلك منهم فبرئت منه ذمة الله وذمة رسوله وليس لهم اليوم ذمة.
ويحتمل أن يكون الخبر مختصا بمن لم يكن له ذمة أصلا بأن يكون في دار الحرب فإنه إذا كان كذلك ينتظر بالمرأة انقضاء عدتها فإن أسلم قبل ذلك كان أحق بها، وإن انقضت عدتها ولم يسلم فقد ملكت نفسها، والذي يدل على ذلك:
[661] 4 - ما رواه محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن أحمد بن محمد البرقي عن النوفلي عن السكوني عن جعفر عن أبيه عن علي عليهم السلام أن امرأة مجوسية أسلمت قبل زوجها قال علي عليه السلام: أتسلم قال: لا ففرق بينهما ثم قال: إن أسلمت قبل انقضاء عدتها فهي امرأتك وإن انقضت عدتها قبل أن تسلم ثم أسلمت فأنت خاطب من الخطاب.
[662] 5 - عنه عن معاوية بن حكيم عن محمد بن خالد الطيالسي عن علي بن رئاب وأبان جميعا عن منصور بن حازم قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل مجوسي كانت تحته امرأة على دينه فأسلم أو أسلمت قال: ينتظر بذلك انقضاء عدتها فإن هو أسلم فهما على نكاحهما الأول وإن هو لم يسلم حتى تنقضي العدة فقد بانت منه

This does not contradict the first report because the rationale behind it is that we interpret it as applying to someone who has violated the conditions of the *dhimma* (covenant of protection). If that is the case, and his wife converts to Islam, he is waited for until the end of her waiting period (*ʿidda*). If he converts to Islam, he has more right to her. If he does not convert, she is separated from him. What indicates that their *dhimma* is nullified when they violate the conditions of the *dhimma* is:

[660] 3 - What Ali ibn al-Hasan ibn Faddal narrated from Amr ibn Uthman from al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Ali ibn Ri'ab from Zurara from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him), who said: "The Messenger of God (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) accepted the *jizya* (poll tax) from the *Ahl al-Dhimma* (protected people) on the condition that they do not consume usury, do not eat pork, do not marry sisters, nor the daughters of brothers, nor the daughters of sisters. Whoever among them does that, then the *dhimma* of God and the *dhimma* of His Messenger are void of him, and they have no *dhimma* today."

It is also possible that the report is specific to someone who has no *dhimma* at all, such as someone in *Dar al-Harb* (territory of war). If that is the case, the woman is waited for until the end of her waiting period. If he converts to Islam before that, he has more right to her. If her waiting period expires and he does not convert, then she owns herself. What indicates that is:

[661] 4 - What Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Mahbub narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad al-Barqi from al-Nawfali from al-Sakuni from Ja'far from his father from Ali (peace be upon them) that a Magian woman converted to Islam before her husband. Ali (peace be upon him) said: "Does he convert?" He said: "No." So he separated them. Then he said: "If she converts before the end of her waiting period, then she is your wife. If her waiting period expires before she converts, then you are a suitor among the suitors."

[662] 5 - From him, from Muawiya ibn Hakim from Muhammad ibn Khalid al-Tayalisi from Ali ibn Ri'ab and Aban, both from Mansur ibn Hazim, who said: "I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a Magian man who had a wife under him in his religion, and he converted to Islam, or she converted to Islam." He said: "He waits for that until the end of her waiting period. If he converts to Islam, then they remain in their first marriage. If he does not convert until the waiting period expires, then she is separated from him."

والذي يدل على أنه متى كان بشرائط الذمة لا تبين منه وإن انقضت عدتها:
[663] 6 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن بعض أصحابه عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: إن أهل الكتاب وجميع من له ذمة إذا أسلم أحد الزوجين فهما على نكاحهما وليس له أن يخرجها من دار الاسلام إلى غيرها ولا يبيت معها لكنه يأتيها بالنهار، وأما المشركون فمثل مشركي العرب وغيرهم فهم على نكاحهم إلى انقضاء العدة فإن أسلمت المرأة ثم أسلم الرجل قبل انقضاء عدتها فهي امرأته فإن لم يسلم إلا بعد انقضاء العدة فقد بانت منه ولا سبيل له عليها وكذلك جميع من لا ذمة له ولا ينبغي للمسلم أن يتزوج يهودية ولا نصرانية وهو يجد حرة أو أمة.

[665] 2 - الحسين بن سعيد عن النضر بن سويد عن عبد الله بن مسكان قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن الناصب الذي عرف نصبه وعداوته هل يزوجه المؤمن وهو قادر على رده وهو لا يعلم برده؟ قال: لا يتزوج المؤمن الناصبة ولا يتزوج الناصب مؤمنة ولا يتزوج المستضعف مؤمنة.

What indicates that when the conditions of the dhimma are met, the marriage does not dissolve even if her waiting period expires:
[663] 6 - What Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated from Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umayr from some of his companions from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) who said: "Indeed, the People of the Book and all those who have a dhimma, if one of the spouses converts to Islam, they remain in their marriage. He is not allowed to take her out of the abode of Islam to another place, nor to spend the night with her, but he can visit her during the day. ابن الحسين عليه السلام فقال: امرأتك الشيبانية خارجية تشتم عليا عليه السلام فإن سرك ان أسمعك ذلك منها أسمعتك فقال: نعم قال: فإذا كان غدا حين تريد أن تخرج كما كانت تخرج فعد وإكمن في جانب الدار قال: فلما كان من الغد كمن في جانب الدار وجاء الرجل فكلمها فتبين ذلك منها فخلى سبيلها وكانت تعجبه.
[667] 4 - علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن محمد بن علي عن أبي جميلة وعن سندي عن الفضيل بن يسار قال: سألت أبا جعفر عليه السلام عن المرأة العارفة هل أزوجها الناصب؟ فقال: لا لان الناصب كافر قال: فأزوجها الرجل غير الناصب ولا العارف فقال: غيره أحب إلي منه.
[668] 5 - عنه عن أحمد بن الحسن بن علي عن أبيه عن الحسن بن رباط عن ابن أذينة عن فضيل بن يسار عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: ذكر النصاب فقال: لا تناكحهم ولا تأكل ذبيحتهم ولا تسكن معهم.
[669] 6 - فأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن النضر بن سويد عن عبد الله بن سنان قال سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام بم يكون الرجل مسلما تحل مناكحته وموارثته؟ وبم يحرم دمه؟ فقال: يحرم دمه الاسلام إذا أظهر وتحل مناكحته وموارثته.
فليس بمناف لما قدمناه لان من أظهر العداوة والنصب لأهل بيت الرسول صلى الله عليه وآله لا يكون قد أظهر الاسلام الحقيقي بل يكون على غاية من إظهار الكفر والخبر إنما تضمن من أظهر الاسلام وهؤلاء خارجون منه.
[670] 7 - فأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن أحمد بن محمد عن عبد الكريم عن أبي بصير عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: تزوجوا في الشكاك ولا تزوجوهم لأن المرأة تأخذ من دين زوجها ويقهرها على دينه.

فليس بمناف أيضا لما قدمناه لأنه محمول على المستضعفة والبلهاء منهن دون المعلنات بعداوة من ذكرنا، يبين ما ذكرناه:

[675] 2 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن المرأة يموت زوجها فتضع وتتزوج قبل أن يمضي لها أربعة أشهر وعشرا فقال: إذا كان دخل بها فرق بينهما ثم لم تحل له أبدا واعتدت بما بقي عليها من الأول واستقبلت عدة أخرى من الآخر ثلاثة قروء وإن لم يكن دخل بها فرق بينهما واعتدت بما بقي عليها من الأول وهو خاطب من الخطاب.
قال محمد بن الحسن: قوله عليه السلام: " هو خاطب من الخطاب " محمول على من عقد عليها وهو لا يعلم أنها في عدة فحينئذ يجوز له العقد عليها بعد انقضاء عدتها، يدل على ذلك:
[676] 3 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن أبي علي الأشعري عن محمد بن عبد الجبار ومحمد ابن إسماعيل عن الفضل بن شاذان جميعا عن صفوان عن عبد الرحمن بن الحجاج عن أبي إبراهيم عليه السلام قال: سألته عن الرجل يتزوج المرأة في عدتها بجهالة أهي ممن لا تحل له أبدا؟ فقال: لا، أما إذا كان بجهالة فليتزوجها بعد ما تنقضي عدتها وقد يعذر الناس في الجهالة بما هو أعظم من ذلك فقلت: بأي الجهالتين أعذر بجهالته أن يعلم أن ذلك محرم عليه. أم بجهالته انها في عدة؟ فقال: إحدى الجهالتين أهون من الأخرى الجهالة بأن الله تعالى حرم عليه ذلك وذلك أنه لا يقدر على الاحتياط معها فقلت: هو في الأخرى معذور؟ قال: نعم إذا انقضت عدتها فهو معذور في أن يتزوجها فقلت: وإن كان أحدهما متعمدا والآخر بجهالة؟ فقال: الذي تعمد لا يحل له أن يرجع إلى صاحبه أبدا.

If someone else marries her three times, and she marries three times [herself], she will never be permissible for him [the first husband]. And if a pilgrim marries knowing that it is forbidden for him, she will never be permissible for him.
[675] 2 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated from Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabi from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: I asked him about a woman whose husband dies and she delivers [her child] and marries before four months and ten days have passed for her, and he said: If he had consummated the marriage with her, they should be separated, and then she will never be permissible for him, and she should observe the 'iddah (waiting period) for what remains for her from the first [marriage], and begin another 'iddah from the second [marriage] of three quru' (menstrual cycles). And if he had not consummated the marriage with her, they should be separated, and she should observe the 'iddah for what remains for her from the first [marriage], and he is a suitor from among the suitors.
Muhammad ibn al-Hasan said: His saying, peace be upon him, "he is a suitor from among the suitors" is interpreted as applying to one who marries her while he does not know that she is in 'iddah. At that time, it is permissible for him to marry her after her 'iddah has ended. This is indicated by:
[676] 3 - What Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated from Abi Ali al-Ash'ari from Muhammad ibn Abd al-Jabbar and Muhammad ibn Ismail from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan all from Safwan from Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj from Abi Ibrahim, peace be upon him, who said: I asked him about a man who marries a woman during her 'iddah out of ignorance, is she among those who are never permissible for him? He said: No, but if it was out of ignorance, then let him marry her after her 'iddah has ended, and people may be excused for ignorance in matters greater than that. So I said: With which of the two ignorances is he more excused: his ignorance that it is forbidden for him, or his ignorance that she is in 'iddah? He said: One of the two ignorances is easier than the other, the ignorance that Allah the Exalted has forbidden that for him, and that is because he is not able to take precaution with it. So I said: Is he excused in the other? He said: Yes, if her 'iddah has ended, then he is excused in marrying her. So I said: What if one of them is deliberate and the other is ignorant? He said: The one who acted deliberately, it is never permissible for him to return to his companion.

[681] 2 - وأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن صفوان عن جميل عن زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام في امرأة تزوجت قبل أن تنقضي عدتها قال: يفرق بينهما وتعتد عدة واحدة منهما جميعا.
[682] 3 - ابن أبي عمير عن ابن بكير عن زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام في امرأة فقدت زوجها أو نعي إليها فتزوجت ثم قدم زوجها بعد ذلك فطلقها قال: تعتد منهما جميعا ثلاثة أشهر عدة واحدة وليس للأخير أن يتزوجها أبدا.
[683] 4 - سعد بن عبد الله عن محمد بن عيسى عن صفوان عن جميل عن ابن بكير أو عن أبي العباس عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في المرأة تزوج في عدتها قال: يفرق بينهما وتعتد عدة واحدة منهما جميعا.
فليست هذه الأخبار منافية لما تقدم من الاخبار لأنه ليس في ظاهر هذه الأخبار أن الثاني كان دخل بها ونحن إنما أوجبنا العدة الثانية إذا كان قد دخل بها، فأم ا إذا لم يدخل فتجزيها عدة واحدة ولا تنافي بين الاخبار.
[122 - باب الرجل يتزوج بامرأة ثم علم بعد ما دخل بها أن لها زوجا] [684] 1 - أحمد بن محمد عن محمد بن عيسى عن ابن أبي عمير عن عبد الرحمن بن الحجاج قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل تزوج امرأة ولها زوج وهو لا يعلم فطلقها الأول أو مات عنها ثم علم الأخير أيراجعها؟ قال: لا حتى تنقضي عدتها.
[685] 2 - فأما ما رواه الحسن بن محبوب عن عبد الرحمن قال: سألت أبا عبد الله

text:
عليه السلام عن رجل تزوج امرأة ثم استبان له بعد ما دخل بها أن لها زوجا غائبا فتركها ثم إن الزوج قدم فطلقها أو مات عنها أيتزوجها بعد هذا الذي كان تزوجها ولم يعلم أن لها زوجا؟ قال: فقال ما أحب له أن يتزوجها حتى تنكح زوجا غيره.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر ضرب من الكراهية ولأجل ذلك قال: ولا أحب له أن يتزوجها ولم يقل ولا يجوز والوجه في الخبرين عندي انه إنما كان يجوز له أن يتزوجها إذا لم تتعمد المرأة التزويج مع علمها بأن زوجها باق على ما كان عليه بل يكون قد غاب عنها فنعي إليها أو بلغها عنه طلاق، لأنها لو تعمدت ذلك كانت زانية وإذا كانت زانية لم يجز له العقد عليها أبدا لان من زنى بذات بعل لم تحل له أبدا على ما بيناه في كتابنا الكبير، والذي يدل على أنها متى تعمدت ذلك مع العلم بحال الزوج تكون زانية: [686] 3 - ما رواه الحسن بن محبوب عن يونس بن يعقوب عن أبي بصير عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: سئل عن امرأة كان لها زوج غائبا عنها فتزوجت زوجا آخر قال: فقال: إن رفعت إلى الامام ثم شهد عليها شهود أن لها زوجا غائبا عنها وأن مادته وخبره يأتيها منه وأنها تزوجت زوجا آخر كان على الامام أن يحدها ويفرق بينهما وبين الذي تزوجها، قيل له فالمهر الذي أخذته منه كيف يصنع به؟ قال: إن أصاب منه شيئا فليأخذه وإن لم يصب منه شيئا فإن كل ما أخذت منه حرام عليها مثل أجر الفاجرة.
[687] 4 - علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن أيوب بن نوح وسندي بن محمد عن صفوان بن يحيى عن شعيب العقرقوفي قال: سألت أبا الحسن عليه السلام عن رجل تزوج امرأة لها زوج ولم يعلم قال: يرجم المرأة وليس على الرجل شئ إذا لم يعلم قال: فذكرت ذلك لأبي بصير قال: فقال لي والله جعفر عليه السلام: ترجم المرأة ويجلد الرجل الحد وقال بيديه على صدره يحكه ما أظن أن صاحبنا تكامل علمه.

translation:
T Text:

...peace be upon him, regarding a man who married a woman, and it became clear to him after consummating the marriage that she had a husband who was absent, so he left her. Then the husband came back and divorced her or died. Can the first man who married her, not knowing she had a husband, marry her after this? He said: "I do not like for him to marry her until she marries another husband."

The interpretation of this narration is a form of disapproval, and for that reason, he said, "I do not like for him to marry her," and he did not say, "It is not permissible." The interpretation of the two narrations in my view is that it is only permissible for him to marry her if the woman did not intentionally marry knowing that her husband was still alive and in the same condition, rather he had been absent from her and his death was reported to her, or a divorce reached her from him. Because if she intentionally did that, she would be an adulteress, and if she was an adulteress, it would never be permissible for him to marry her, because whoever commits adultery with a married woman is never lawful for him, as we have explained in our major book. What indicates that when she intentionally did that, knowing the state of the husband, she would be an adulteress is: [686] 3 - What al-Ḥasan ibn Maḥbūb narrated from Yūnus ibn Yaʻqūb from Abū Baṣīr from Abū Jaʻfar, peace be upon him, who said: He was asked about a woman who had a husband absent from her, and she married another husband. He said: "If she is brought to the Imam, and witnesses testify against her that she has a husband absent from her, and that his sustenance and news come to her from him, and that she married another husband, then it is upon the Imam to punish her and separate between them and the one who married her." It was said to him, "What should be done with the dowry that she took from him?" He said: "If he has taken anything from it, then let him take it back, and if he has not taken anything from it, then everything she took from him is haram (forbidden) for her, like the wages of an adulteress."
[687] 4 - ʻAlī ibn al-Ḥasan ibn Faḍḍāl from Ayyūb ibn Nūḥ and Sindi ibn Muḥammad from Ṣafwān ibn Yaḥyá from Shuʻayb al-ʻAqraqūfī who said: I asked Abū al-Ḥasan, peace be upon him, about a man who married a woman who had a husband, and he did not know. He said: "The woman is stoned, and there is nothing upon the man if he did not know." He said: So I mentioned that to Abū Baṣīr, and he said to me: By Allah, Jaʻfar, peace be upon him, said: "The woman is stoned, and the man is flogged with the prescribed punishment." And he gestured with his hands on his chest, scratching it, "I do not think that our companion has perfected his knowledge."

text:
قال محمد بن الحسن: لا تنافي بين ما رواه شعيب عن أبي الحسن عليه السلام وبين ما سمعه أبو بصير من أبي عبد الله عليه السلام لان الذي سمعه أبو بصير يكون فيمن تزوج بها وهو يعلم أن لها زوجا وجب عليه هو أيضا لأنه زان ولا تنافي بين الخبرين ولا بين الفتيائين وإنما أشتبه الامر على أبي بصير فلم يميز إحدى المسألتين من الأخرى فظن أن بينهما تنافيا.
[688] 5 - فأما ما رواه علي عن الحسن بن فضال عن علي بن الحكم عن موسى بن بكر عن زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: إذا نعي رجل إلى أهله أو أخبروها انه قد طلقها فاعتدت ثم تزوجت فجاء زوجها فإن الأول أحق بها من هذا الآخر دخل بها أو لم يدخل وليس للأخير أن يتزوجها أبدا ولها المهر بما استحل من فرجها.
[689] 6 - عنه عن محمد بن خالد الأصم عن عبد الله بن بكير عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: إذا نعي رجل إلى أهله وأخبروها أنه قد طلقها فاعتدت ثم تزوجت فجاء زوجها بعد فإن الأول أحق بها من هذا الآخر دخل بها الأول أو لم يدخل بها وليس للآخر أن يتزوجها أبدا ولها المهر من الآخر بما استحل من فرجها.
فلا تنافي بين هذين الخبرين والاخبار الأولة التي قدمناها من أن له أن يتزوجها بعد انقضاء العدة إذا طلقها زوجها الأول لان الوجه في هذين الخبرين أن نحملهما على من علم أن لها زوجها باقيا وأقدم مع ذلك على التزويج فإنها لا تحل له أبدا وهو الذي قلناه فيما تقدم من أن من زنى بذات بعل لم تحل له أبدا ومن هذا حكمه فهو زان والحكم فيه ما قلناه.

Muhammad ibn al-Hasan said: There is no contradiction between what Shu'ayb narrated from Abi al-Hasan (peace be upon him) and what Abu Basir heard from Abi Abd Allah (peace be upon him), because what Abu Basir heard concerns one who marries her knowing that she has a husband, so he is also liable because he is an adulterer. There is no contradiction between the two reports or between the two legal opinions. The matter was confused for Abu Basir, so he did not distinguish one issue from the other and thought that there was a contradiction between them.
[688] 5 - As for what Ali narrated from al-Hasan ibn Faddal from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Musa ibn Bakr from Zurara from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) who said: If a man is reported dead to his family, or they are informed that he has divorced her, and she observes the waiting period (ʿiddah) and then marries, and then her husband comes back, then the first one has more right to her than this last one, whether he consummated the marriage with her or not. And the last one is not allowed to marry her ever, and she is entitled to the dower (mahr) for what he made permissible of her private parts.
[689] 6 - From him, from Muhammad ibn Khalid al-Asamm, from Abdullah ibn Bukayr, from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) who said: If a man is reported dead to his family, and they are informed that he has divorced her, and she observes the waiting period (ʿiddah) and then marries, and then her husband comes after that, then the first one has more right to her than this last one, whether the first one consummated the marriage with her or not. And the last one is not allowed to marry her ever, and she is entitled to the dower (mahr) from the last one for what he made permissible of her private parts.
There is no contradiction between these two reports and the first reports that we presented, that he is allowed to marry her after the waiting period (ʿiddah) if her first husband divorced her. Because the explanation for these two reports is that we interpret them as referring to one who knows that she has a husband still living and proceeds with the marriage despite that. Then she is not permissible for him ever, and this is what we said earlier, that whoever commits adultery with a married woman, she is never permissible for him. And one whose case is like this, he is an adulterer, and the ruling concerning him is what we have said.

[123 - باب تزويج المرأة في نفاسها] [690] 1 - محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن العباس بن معروف عن النوفلي عن اليعقوبي عن عيسى بن عبد الله الهاشمي عن أبيه عن جده قال: قال علي عليه السلام: لا بأس أن يتزوجها في نفاسها ولكن لا يجامعها حتى تطهر من دم النفاس.
[691] 2 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن بعض أصحابنا عن عبد الله بن القاسم عن عبد الله بن سنان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام: أن أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام ضرب رجلا تزوج امرأة في نفاسها الحد.
فلا ينافي الخبر الأول لأنه يحتمل أن يكون إنما أقام عليه الحد لأنه واقعها قبل خروجها من دم النفاس دون أن يكون أقام عليه الحد لأنه تزوج بها، والذي يدل على ذلك أن راوي هذا الحديث وهو عبد الله بن سنان روى مثل الخبر الأول:
[692] 3 - روى محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى بإسناده عن عبد الله بن سنان، وروى محمد بن الحسن الصفار عن محمد بن عيسى عن يونس بن عبد الرحمن عن ابن أذينة وابن سنان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في المرأة تضع أيحل لها أن تتزوج قبل أن تطهر؟ قال:
إذا وضعت تتزوج وليس لزوجها أن يدخل بها حتى تطهر.
ويحتمل أن يكون إنما أقام عليه الحد لأنها كانت بعد في عدة من زوجها الذي مات عنها لان من هذه صورتها تحتاج أن تعتد بأبعد الأجلين فإن وضعت قبل انقضاء العدة احتاجت أن تستوفي أربعة أشهر وعشرا وإن مضت لها أربعة أشهر وعشرا انتظرت وضعها بعد ذلك، يدل على ذلك:

Al-Fadl al-Hashimi from some of his Shaykhs (teachers) said: Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) said: Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him) made a judgment regarding a woman whose husband died while she was pregnant, and she gave birth before four months and ten days had passed, and she married before completing the four months and ten days. He said: I think that he (the new husband) should divorce her, then he should not propose to her until the end of the later of the two periods. If the woman's masters (wali) wish, they may marry her off, and if they wish, they may keep her and return his (the new husband’s) money to him.
[124 - Chapter on the Marriage of the Sick Person] [694] 1 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Ali from Zurara from one of the two of them (peace be upon them) said: It is not permissible for a sick person to divorce, but it is permissible for him to marry. If he marries and consummates the marriage, then it is permissible. But if he does not consummate the marriage until he dies in his illness, then his marriage is invalid, and she has no dower nor inheritance.
[695] 2 - As for what Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from Muhammad ibn Isa from Abi al-Muza from Sama'a from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: I asked him about a man who is near death and sends to his neighbor to marry his daughter to him for one thousand dirhams, is his marriage permissible?
He said: Yes.
This does not contradict the first narration, because the interpretation of this report is that we take it to mean that he consummated the marriage, because whenever that is the case, the contract is valid, as detailed in the first report, and whenever he did not consummate the marriage and died, the contract is invalid.

He said: 'What causes the flesh and blood to grow.' I said: 'And what causes the flesh and blood to grow?' He said: 'It used to be said ten nursings.' I said: 'So, is it forbidden with ten nursings?' Thus, it does not contradict the first report either, because he did not say that ten nursings forbid on his own authority, but rather attributed it to someone else, saying, "It used to be said." If it were correct, he would have said to him, "Yes," and would not have deviated from his answer to something else for some benefit.

الرضاع؟ قال: إذا رضع حتى يمتلئ بطنه فإن ذلك ينبت اللحم والدم وذلك الذي يحرم.
فلا تنافي بين هذين الخبرين والخبر الأول الذي اعتمدناه لان قوله عليه السلام:
" إذا رضع حتى يمتلئ بطنه " تفسير لكل رضعة لأنه المعتبر في هذا الباب دون أن يكون المراد بالرضعات المصات على ما يذهب إليه كثير من الناس فإن ذلك الذي ينبت اللحم والعظم.
[709] 14 - وأما ما رواه محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن محمد بن الحسين عن محمد بن سنان عن حريز عن الفضيل بن يسار عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: لا يحرم من الرضاع إلا المجبورة أو خادم أو ظئر ثم يرضع عشر رضعات يروي الصبي وينام.
فهذا الخبر أيضا لا ينافي ما قدمناه لأنه متروك الظاهر بالاجماع لأنه قد يحرم من الرضاع ما لا يكون مجبورا ولا خادما ولا ظئرا بأن يكون امرأة متبرعة برضاع صبي أو تكون سألت ذلك أو لغير ذلك من الأسباب الداعية إلى ذلك، ويحتمل أن يكون المراد بذلك نفي التحريم عمن أرضعه رضعة أو رضعتين يدل على ذلك:
[710] 15 - ما رواه علي بن الحسين عن أيوب بن نوح عن صفوان عن بن يحيى عن موسى بن بكر عن أبي الحسن عليه السلام قال قلت له: إن بعض مواليك تزوج إلى قوم فزعم النساء أن بينهما رضاعا قال: اما الرضعة والرضعتان فليس بشئ إلا أن تكون ظئرا مستأجرة مقيمة عليه.
فصرح عليه السلام في هذا الخبر ان المراد بذلك ما قلناه من الرضعة والرضعتين دون ما زاد على ذلك حتى يبلغ الحد الذي يحرم على ما بيناه.
[711] 16 - وأما ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن محمد بن عبد الجبار عن علي بن مهزيار عن

Regarding breastfeeding, he said: "If he nurses until his stomach is full, that causes flesh and blood to grow, and that is what creates the prohibition (of marriage)."

Thus, there is no contradiction between these two narrations and the first narration upon which we relied, because his saying (peace be upon him): "If he nurses until his stomach is full" is an explanation for each instance of nursing, as that is what matters in this regard, not merely the number of sucks, as many people believe, for it is that which causes flesh and bone to grow.

[709] 14 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Mahbub narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Muhammad ibn Sinan from Hurayz from al-Fudayl ibn Yasar from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) who said: "Nothing is prohibited from breastfeeding except by a wet nurse (mujbūra), a servant (khādim), or a wet nurse (ẓi'r) who then breastfeeds ten times, enough to satisfy the child and make him sleep."

This narration also does not contradict what we have presented, because its apparent meaning is rejected by consensus (ijmā') because breastfeeding can prohibit marriage even if it is not by a wet nurse (mujbūra), a servant (khādim), or a wet nurse (ẓi'r), such as if a woman volunteers to breastfeed a child, or is asked to do so, or for other reasons that lead to it. It is also possible that the intended meaning is to negate the prohibition for one who breastfeeds once or twice, as indicated by:

[710] 15 - What Ali ibn al-Husayn narrated from Ayyub ibn Nuh from Safwan from Ibn Yahya from Musa ibn Bakr from Abi al-Hasan (peace be upon him) who said: "I said to him: 'Some of your followers married into a family, and the women claimed that there was breastfeeding between them.' He said: 'One or two instances of breastfeeding are nothing unless she is a hired, resident wet nurse (ẓi'ran musta'jara muqīma 'alayhi).'"

Thus, he (peace be upon him) clarified in this narration that what is meant by that is what we said about one or two instances of breastfeeding, and not more than that, until it reaches the limit that prohibits marriage, as we have explained.

text:
أبي الحسن عليه السلام أنه كتب إليه يسأله عما يحرم من الرضاع فكتب: قليله وكثيره حرام.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على أن قليله وكثيره حرام بعدما يبلغا الحد الذي يحرم ويزيد عليه فإن الزيادة عليه قلت أو كثرت فإنها تحرم، ويجوز أن يكون الوجه في هذا الخبر ضربا من التقية لأنه مذهب بعض العامة.
[712] 17 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أبي جعفر عن أبي الجوزا عن الحسين بن علوان عن عمر بن خالد عن زيد بن علي عن آبائه عن علي عليه السلام أنه قال: الرضعة الواحدة كالمائة رضعة لا تحل أبدا.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر ما ذكرناه في الخبر الأول سواء.
[713] 18 - فأما ما رواه الحسن بن محمد بن سماعة عن الحسين بن حذيفة بن منصور عن عبيد بن زرارة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن الرضاع فقال: لا يحرم من الرضاع إلا ما ارتضعا من ثدي واحد حولين كاملين.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمل قوله حولين كاملين على أن يكون طرفا للرضاع لا أن يكون المراد به المدة المراعاة في التحريم فكأنه قال: لا يحرم من الرضاع إلا ما ارتضعا من ثدي واحد في حولين كاملين، وإنما قلنا لان الرضاع إذا كان بعد الحولين فإنه لا يحرم، يدل على ذلك:
[714] 19 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن أبي عبد الله عن علي بن أسباط قال: سألت ابن فضال ابن بكير عن المسجد فقال ما تقولون في امرأة أرضعت غلاما سنتين ثم أرضعت صبية لها أقل من سنتين حتى تمت السنتان أيفسد ذلك بينهما؟
فقال: لا يفسد ذلك بينهما لأنه رضاع بعد فطام وإنما قال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله

Abi al-Hasan (peace be upon him) that he wrote to him asking about what is forbidden by breastfeeding, so he wrote: A little or a lot of it is forbidden.
The interpretation of this report is that we should understand it as meaning that a little or a lot of it is forbidden after they reach the limit that makes it forbidden and exceeds it. For the increase upon it, whether it is little or much, makes it forbidden. And it is permissible that the interpretation of this report is a kind of taqiyya (dissimulation), because it is the opinion of some of the common people.
[712] 17 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Abi Ja'far from Abi al-Jawza from al-Husayn ibn 'Alwan from 'Umar ibn Khalid from Zayd ibn 'Ali from his forefathers from 'Ali (peace be upon him) that he said: One suck is like a hundred sucks, it is never permissible.
The interpretation of this report is the same as what we mentioned in the first report.
[713] 18 - As for what al-Hasan ibn Muhammad ibn Sama'a narrated from al-Husayn ibn Hudhayfa ibn Mansur from 'Ubayd ibn Zurara from Abi 'Abdillah (peace be upon him) who said: I asked him about breastfeeding, and he said: Nothing is forbidden by breastfeeding except what they suck from one breast for two complete years.
The interpretation of this report is that we should understand his saying "two complete years" to mean that it is a limit for breastfeeding, not that the intended meaning is the duration observed in prohibition. So it is as if he said: Nothing is forbidden by breastfeeding except what they suck from one breast in two complete years. And we only say this because if breastfeeding is after two years, then it does not forbid. This is indicated by:
[714] 19 - What Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated from Ahmad ibn Abi 'Abdillah from 'Ali ibn Asbat who said: I asked Ibn Faddal Ibn Bukayr about the mosque, and he said, what do you say about a woman who breastfed a boy for two years, then breastfed a girl of hers for less than two years until the two years were completed, does that invalidate the relationship between them?
He said: That does not invalidate the relationship between them, because it is breastfeeding after weaning. And the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) only said
