[835] 4 - As for what was narrated by Ali ibn al-Hasan ibn Faddal from Ayyub ibn Nuh from Safwan ibn Yahya from Mansur Buzarj from Abd Salih (peace be upon him), who said: I said to him: A man from your followers married a woman, then divorced her, and she became irrevocably divorced from him. Then he wanted to take her back, but she refused unless he made a covenant with Allah that he would not divorce her or marry another woman in addition to her. Then it occurred to him to marry after that, so what should he do?
He said: "What he did was bad. How could he know what might happen in his heart during the night and day? Tell him to fulfill the condition for the woman, for the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: “The believers are bound by their conditions.”"
The interpretation of this report is one of two things: The first is that it is to be understood as recommended (istiḥbāb), because whoever judges according to what the report contains is recommended to fulfill the condition that he uttered, even if it is not obligatory. The other interpretation is that it is to be understood as taqiyya (dissimulation), because those who oppose us make this condition obligatory and consider those who violate it to have broken their oath. What confirms the first narrations is:
[836] 5 - What was narrated by Ali ibn Ismail al-Maythami from Hammad from Abdullah ibn al-Mughira from Ibn Sinan from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a man who said to his wife: If I marry another woman in addition to you or take a concubine, then she is divorced. He said: "That is nothing, for the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: Whoever stipulates a condition other than the Book of Allah, the Mighty and Sublime, that is not permissible for him, nor against him."

عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: المرأة التي قد ملكت نفسها غير السفيهة ولا المولى عليها إن تزويجها بغير ولي جائز.
[838] 2 - عنه عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن الحسين بن سعيد عن فضالة بن أيوب عن عمر بن أبان الكلبي عن ميسرة قال قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام: ألقى المرأة بالفلاة التي ليس فيها أحد فأقول ألك زوج؟ فتقول: لا فأتزوجها قال: نعم هي المصدقة على نفسها.
[839] 3 - عنه عن علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه ومحمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد جميعا عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد بن عثمان عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام أنه قال: في المرأة الثيب تخطب إلى نفسها قال: هي أملك بنفسها تولي أمرها من شاءت إذا كان كفوا بعد أن تكون قد نكحت رجلا قبله.
[840] 4 - عنه عن أبي علي الأشعري عن محمد بن عبد الجبار عن صفوان بن يحيى عن ابن مسكان عن الحسن بن زياد قال قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام: المرأة الثيب تخطب إلى نفسها؟ قال: هي أملك بنفسها تولي أمرها من شاءت إذا كان لا بأس به بعد أن تكون نكحت زوجا قبل ذلك.
[841] 5 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن أحمد بن الحسن عن عمرو بن سعيد عن مصدق بن صدقة عن عمار الساباطي قال: سألت أبا الحسن عليه السلام عن المرأة تكون في أهل بيت فتكره أن يعلم بها أهل بيتها يحل لها أن توكل رجلا يريد أن يتزوجها تقول له: قد وكلتك فاشهد على تزويجي؟ قال: لا، قلت له جعلت فداك

From Abi Ja’far (peace be upon him) who said: A woman who has control over herself, who is neither foolish nor under guardianship, it is permissible for her to marry without a guardian.
[838] 2 - From him, from Muhammad ibn Yahya, from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from al-Hussein ibn Saeed, from Fadalah ibn Ayyub, from Omar ibn Aban al-Kalbi, from Maysarah who said: I said to Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him): I meet a woman in a deserted place where there is no one, and I say, "Do you have a husband?" and she says, "No," so I marry her. He said: "Yes, she is believed regarding herself."
[839] 3 - From him, from Ali ibn Ibrahim, from his father, and Muhammad ibn Yahya, from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, all from Ibn Abi Umayr, from Hammad ibn Uthman, from al-Halabi, from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) that he said: Regarding a previously married woman who is proposed to herself, he said: "She has more control over herself; she can entrust her affairs to whomever she wills, if he is a suitable match, after she has been married to a man before."
[840] 4 - From him, from Abi Ali al-Ash'ari, from Muhammad ibn Abd al-Jabbar, from Safwan ibn Yahya, from Ibn Muskan, from al-Hasan ibn Ziyad who said: I said to Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him): A previously married woman is proposed to herself? He said: "She has more control over herself; she can entrust her affairs to whomever she wills, if there is nothing wrong with him, after she has been married to a husband before that."
[841] 5 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Mahboub narrated, from Ahmad ibn al-Hasan, from Amr ibn Saeed, from Musaddiq ibn Sadaqah, from Ammar al-Sabbati who said: I asked Abu al-Hasan (peace be upon him) about a woman who is in a household and dislikes her family knowing about it. Is it permissible for her to appoint a man who wants to marry her, saying to him, "I have appointed you, so bear witness to my marriage?" He said: "No." I said to him, "May I be made your ransom..."

وإن كانت أيما؟ قال: وإن كانت أيما، قلت: وإن وكلت غيره بتزويجها أيزوجها منه؟ قال: نعم.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أنه إنما لم يجز ذلك لأنها وكلته بأن يزوجها من نفسه وذلك لا يصح لان الوكيل يقوم مقام موكله فيحتاج إلى من يعقد عليه ولا يصح أن يكون الانسان عاقدا على نفسه لأن العقد يقتضي إيجابا وقبولا وذلك لا يصح بين الانسان وبين نفسه، ولو أنها زوجته نفسها من غير أن توكله لكان ذلك جائزا حسب ما تضمنته الاخبار الأولة ولأجل ما قلناه قال له: السائل توكل غيره بأن يزوجها منه فقال: نعم لان ذلك يصح تقديره فيه وفي الأول لا يصح، ويزيد ما قدمناه وضوحا.
[842] 6 - ما رواه علي بن إسماعيل الميثمي عن فضالة بن أيوب عن موسى بن بكر عن زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: إذا كانت امرأة مالكة أمرها تبيع وتشتري وتعتق وتشهد وتعطي من مالها ما شاءت فإن أمرها جائز تزوج إن شاءت بغير إذن وليها وإن لم تكن كذلك فلا يجوز تزويجها إلا بإذن وليها.
[843] 7 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن عيسى عن سعد بن إسماعيل عن أبيه قال:
سألت الرضا عليه السلام عن رجل تزوج ببكر أو ثيب لا يعلم أبوها ولا أحد من قرابتها ولكن تجعل المرأة وكيلا فيزوجها من غير علمهم قال: لا يكون ذا.
قوله عليه السلام: " لا يكون ذا " محمول على أنه لا يكون ذا في البكر خاصة دون أن يكون متناولا للثيب، ولا يمتنع أن يسئل عن شيئين فيجيب عن واحد لضرب من المصلحة ويعول في الجواب عن الآخر على بيان ما تقدم منه أو من آبائه عليهم السلام، ويحتمل أيضا أن يكون خرج مخرج التقية لأنه موافق لمذهب أكثر العامة والذي يؤكده ما قدمناه:

And what if she is *ayyem* (a widow or divorcee)? He said: Even if she is *ayyem*. I said: And if she appoints someone else to marry her off, can he marry her to him? He said: Yes.

The explanation of this report is that it is not permissible because she appointed him to marry her off to himself, and that is not valid. This is because the agent stands in the place of his principal, and thus needs someone to contract with him, and it is not valid for a person to contract with himself, because the contract requires an offer and acceptance, and that is not valid between a person and himself. But if she married herself off without appointing him as an agent, that would be permissible, according to what the earlier reports implied. And for the reason we mentioned, the questioner said to him: Appoint someone else to marry her off to him, and he said: Yes, because that is valid to assume in this case, whereas it is not valid in the first case, and what we presented increases its clarity.

[842] 6 - What Ali ibn Ismail al-Mithami narrated from Fadala ibn Ayyub from Musa ibn Bakr from Zurara from Abi Jaafar (peace be upon him) who said: If a woman is in control of her affairs, she sells and buys, manumits and testifies, and gives from her wealth what she wills, then her command is permissible. She may marry if she wills without the permission of her guardian, but if she is not like that, then it is not permissible for her to marry except with the permission of her guardian.

[843] 7 - As for what Ahmad ibn Isa narrated from Saad ibn Ismail from his father who said:
I asked al-Ridha (peace be upon him) about a man who marries a virgin or a non-virgin without her father or any of her relatives knowing, but the woman appoints an agent to marry her off without their knowledge. He said: That cannot be.

His saying (peace be upon him): "That cannot be" is to be understood as applying specifically to a virgin, not including a non-virgin. It is not impossible to be asked about two things and answer about one for a certain benefit, relying in the answer about the other on an explanation that preceded it from him or from his forefathers (peace be upon them). It is also possible that it was said out of *taqiyya* (dissimulation), because it agrees with the opinion of most of the common people, and what confirms it is what we presented.

[844] 8 - ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن البرقي عن ابن فضال عن ابن بكير عن رجل عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: لا بأس أن تزوج المرأة نفسها إذا كانت ثيبا بغير إذن أبيها إذا كان لا بأس بما صنعت.
[144 - باب أنه لا تزوج البكر إلا بإذن أبيها] [845] 1 - محمد بن يعقوب عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن علي بن الحكم عن العلا بن رزين عن ابن أبي يعفور عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: لا تزوج ذوات الاباء من الابكار إلا بإذن آبائهن.
[846] 2 - علي بن الحسن بن فضال عن محمد بن علي عن الحسن بن محبوب عن علي ابن رئاب عن زرارة قال: سمعت أبا جعفر عليه السلام يقول: لا ينقض النكاح إلا الأب.
[847] 3 - عنه عن أحمد بن الحسن عن أبيه عن علي بن الحسن بن رباط عن شعيب الحداد عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: لا ينقض النكاح إلا الأب.
[848] 4 - أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن ابن فضال عن صفوان عن أبي المعزا عن إبراهيم بن ميمون عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: إذا كانت الجارية بين أبويها فليس لها مع أبويها أمر، وإذا كانت قد تزوجت لم يزوجها إلا برضا عنها.
[849] 5 - محمد بن يعقوب عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن علي بن الحكم عن العلا بن رزين عن محمد بن مسلم عن أحدهما عليهما السلام قال: لا تستأمر الجارية إذا كانت بين أبويها ليس لها مع الأب أمر، قال وقال: يستأمرها كل أحد ما عدا الأب.

فهذا الخبر يحتمل شيئين، أحدهما: أن يكون مخصوصا بنكاح المتعة على ما قدمناه من الرخصة في ذلك بالشرائط التي قدمناها، والآخر: أن يكون محمولا على أنها إذا كانت بالغا ولا يزوجها أبوها من كفؤ لها ويعضلها بذلك فيحنئذ يجوز لها العقد على نفسها.

[852] 2 - أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن محمد بن إسماعيل بن بزيع قال: سألت الرضا عليه السلام عن الصبية يزوجها أبوها ثم يموت وهي صغيرة ثم تكبر قبل أن يدخل بها زوجها أيجوز عليها التزويج أم الامر إليها؟ قال: يجوز عليها تزويج أبيها.

[850] 6 As for what Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Mahbub narrated from al-Abbas from Sa’dan ibn Muslim, who said: Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) said: There is nothing wrong with marrying a virgin if she consents, without her father’s permission.

This report can be interpreted in two ways: one, that it is specific to *nikah al-mut'ah* (temporary marriage), according to what we have presented of the dispensation in that regard, with the conditions we have presented; and the other, that it is to be understood as applying when she is of age and her father does not marry her off to a suitable match and prevents her from doing so; in that case, it is permissible for her to contract the marriage herself.
[145 - Chapter: If the Father Contracts Marriage for His Young Daughter Before She Reaches Puberty, She Does Not Have a Choice When She Reaches Puberty]
[851] 1 - Al-Hussein ibn Sa'id from Abdullah ibn al-Salt who said: I asked Abu al-Hasan (peace be upon him) about a young girl whose father marries her off; does she have a say when she reaches puberty? He said: No. And I asked him about a virgin who has reached the age of women; does she have a say with her father? He said: She has no say with her father as long as she has not *tuthayyib* (lost her virginity).
[852] 2 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Issa from Muhammad ibn Ismail ibn Bazi', who said: I asked al-Ridha (peace be upon him) about a young girl whose father marries her off, then he dies while she is young, then she grows up before her husband consummates the marriage with her. Is her father’s marriage valid for her, or is the matter up to her? He said: Her father’s marriage is valid for her.
[853] 3 - From him, from al-Hussein ibn Ali ibn Yaqtin, from his brother al-Hasan, from Ali ibn Yaqtin who said:
I asked Abu al-Hasan (peace be upon him): Should I marry off the girl when she is three years old, or should I marry off the boy when he is three years old? And what is the lowest limit at which they can be married off? And if the girl reaches puberty and is not satisfied with him, what is her situation? He said: There is nothing wrong with that if her father or guardian approves.

عن محمد بن مسلم قال: سألت أبا جعفر عليه السلام عن الصبي يزوج الصبية قال:
إن كان أبواهما اللذان زوجاهما فنعم جائز ولكن لهما الخيار إذا أدركا فإن رضيا بعد فإن المهر على الأب، قلت له: فهل يجوز طلاق الأب على ابنه في حال صغيرة؟ قال: لا.
فلا ينافي هذا الخبر الاخبار الأولة لان قوله عليه السلام: " لكن لهما الخيار إذا أدركا يجوز أن يكون المراد به أن لهما ذلك بفسخ العقد إما بالطلاق من جهة الزوج وما يجري مجراه أو مطالبة المرأة له بما يوجب الطلاق ويقتضي فسخه ولم يرد بالخيار ها هنا إمضاء العقد أو إبطاله وأن العقد موقوف على خيارهما، والذي يكشف عن ذلك قوله في الخبر: إن كان أبواهما اللذان زوجاهما فنعم جائز فلو كان العقد موقوفا على رضائهما لم يكن بين الأبوين وغيرهما فرق وكان ذلك جائزا لغير الأبوين وقد ثبت أنه فرق بين الموضعين فعلم أن المراد ما ذكرناه.
[855] 5 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن الحسن بن محبوب عن أبي أيوب الخزاز عن يزيد الكناسي قال قلت لأبي جعفر عليه السلام متى يجوز للأب أن يزوج ابنته ولا يستأمرها؟ قال: إذا جازت تسع سنين قلت: فإن زوجها أبوها ولم تبلغ تسع سنين فبلغها ذلك فسكتت ولم تأب ذلك أيجوز عليها؟ قال: لا ليس يجوز عليها رضا في نفسها ولا يجوز لها تأب ولا سخط في نفسها حتى تستكمل تسع سنين فإذا بلغت تسع سنين جاز لها القول في نفسها بالرضا والتأبي وجاز عليها بعد ذلك وإن لم تكن أدركت مدرك النساء، قلت أفيقام عليها الحد وتؤخذ بها وهي في تلك الحال وإنما لها تسع سنين ولم تدرك مدرك النساء في الحيض؟ قال: نعم إذا دخلت على زوجها ولها تسع سنين ذهب عنها اليتم ودفع إليها مالها وأقيمت الحدود التامة عليها ولها، قلت: فالغلام يجري مجرى الجارية في ذلك؟ فقال: يا أبا خالد إن الغلام إذا زوجه أبوه ولم يدرك كان له الخيار إذا أدرك أو بلغ خمس عشرة سنة أو يشعر في وجهه أو ينبت في عانته قبل

From Muhammad bin Muslim who said: I asked Abu Ja'far (peace be upon him) about a boy marrying a girl, he said:
If their parents are the ones who married them off, then yes, it is permissible. However, they have the choice when they reach puberty. If they both agree after that, then the dowry is upon the father. I said to him: Is it permissible for the father to divorce his son when he is young? He said: No.
This report does not contradict the earlier reports because his saying (peace be upon him): "However, they have the choice when they reach puberty," it is permissible that what is meant by it is that they have that by rescinding the contract, either by divorce from the husband's side and what takes its place, or the woman demanding from him what necessitates divorce and requires its rescission. The choice here does not mean ratifying the contract or nullifying it, and that the contract is contingent upon their choice. What reveals this is his saying in the report: If their parents are the ones who married them off, then yes, it is permissible. If the contract were contingent upon their consent, there would be no difference between the parents and others, and that would be permissible for others besides the parents. It has been established that there is a difference between the two situations, so it is known that what is meant is what we mentioned.
[855] 5 - As for what Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Isa narrated from Al-Hasan bin Mahbub from Abi Ayyub al-Khazzaz from Yazid al-Kinnasi who said: I said to Abu Ja'far (peace be upon him): When is it permissible for the father to marry off his daughter without consulting her? He said: When she passes nine years old. I said: If her father marries her off and she has not reached nine years old, and she reaches that age and remains silent and does not refuse, is that permissible for her? He said: No, her consent in herself is not permissible, nor is it permissible for her to refuse or be displeased in herself until she completes nine years. When she reaches nine years, it is permissible for her to speak in herself with consent and refusal, and it is permissible for her after that, even if she has not reached the signs of women. I said: Is the ḥadd (religious punishment) carried out on her and is she held accountable for it while she is in that state, and she is only nine years old and has not reached the signs of women in menstruation? He said: Yes, if she enters upon her husband and she is nine years old, her orphanhood goes away from her, and her wealth is handed over to her, and the complete ḥudūd (religious punishments) are carried out on her and for her. I said: Does the boy follow the same course as the girl in that? He said: O Abu Khalid, if the boy is married off by his father and has not reached puberty, he has the choice when he reaches puberty or reaches fifteen years of age, or shows hair on his face, or grows hair in his pubic area before

فلا ينافي ما تضمن صدر هذا الخبر ما قدمناه من الاخبار لأنه قال: إذا جازت لها تسع سنين يجوز للأب أن يزوجها ولا يستأمرها وهذا مما نقول به، ولا يدل على أن قبل ذلك ليس له إلا من جهة دليل الخطاب، وقد ينصرف عن دليل الخطاب بدليل، وقد قدمنا ما يدل على أن له أن يعقد عليها قبل أن تبلغ تسع سنين وفي حال كونها صبية، فأما قوله: فإذا جاز لها تسع سنين كان لها الرضا في نفسها والتأبي يجوز أن يكون هذا إخبارا عن حكمها مع غير الأب وليس في الخبران لها ذلك مع الأب أو مع غيره وتكون الفائدة في ذلك أن رضاها وسخطها قبل أن تبلغ تسع سنين لا حكم لها.
وتبين مما قلناه أنه ليس لها أن لا تمضي العقد قوله في الخبر حين ذكر حكم الابن أن للغلام إذا زوجه أبوه ولم يدرك كان له الخيار إذا أدرك فدل على أن حكم الجارية

That being said, I said: If he consummated the marriage with her before he reached puberty, and he stayed with her as long as Allah willed, then he reached puberty later and disliked her and she refused him, he said: If it was his father who married him off and he consummated the marriage with her and a child was born from her, and he stayed with her for a year, then he has no choice when he reaches puberty, and he should not reject what his father did, and it is not permissible for him to do that. I said to him: If his father married him off and he consummated the marriage with her while he was not of age, would the ḥudūd (fixed punishments) be carried out on him while he was in that state? He said: As for the complete ḥudūd (fixed punishments) for which a man is held accountable, no. However, he is lashed in all the ḥudūd (fixed punishments) according to the extent of his age, and he is held accountable for that between the ages of nine and fifteen, and Allah's ḥudūd (fixed punishments) are not invalidated among His creation, and the rights of the Muslims among themselves are not invalidated. I said to him, may I be made your ransom: If he divorces her in that state and has not reached puberty, is his divorce permissible? He said: If he has touched her in the private parts, then his divorce is permissible for her and against him. If he has not touched her in the private parts and has not enjoyed her, and she has not enjoyed him, then she is separated from him and returns to her family, and he does not see her or approach her until he reaches puberty and is asked, and it is said to him: You divorced your wife so-and-so. بخلافه وأنه ليس لها الخيار وإنما ذلك يختص الغلام، ويحتمل أن يكون المراد بهذا الخبر والذي قبله من ذكر الأب فيها الجد إذا كان أبو الجارية ميتا فإنه متى كان الامر على ذلك جرى مجرى غيره في أنه لا يعقد عليها إلا برضاها ومتى عقد عليها وهي صغيرة كان العقد موقوفا على رضاها عند البلوغ ونحن نبين فيما بعد أنه ليس للجد أن يعقد مع عدم الأب إلا برضاها إن شاء الله تعالى.
[146 - باب من يعقد على المرأة سوى أبيها] [856] 1 - محمد بن يعقوب عن عدة من أصحابنا عن سهل بن زياد عن أحمد بن محمد ابن أبي نصر عن داود بن سرحان عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل يريد أن يزوج أخته قال: يؤامرها فإن سكتت فهو إقرارها وإن أبت لم يزوجها وإن قالت:
زوجني فلانا فليزوجها ممن ترضى واليتيمة في حجر الرجل لا يزوجها إلا برضا منها.
[857] 2 - عنه عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن علي بن مهزيار عن محمد بن الحسن الأشعري قال: كتب بعض بني عمي إلى أبي جعفر عليه السلام ما تقول في صبية زوجها عمها فلما كبرت أبت التزويج؟ فكتب بخطه: لا تكره على ذلك والامر أمرها.
[858] 3 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن أبي علي الأشعري عن محمد بن عبد الجبار عن صفوان عن ابن مسكان عن وليد بياع الأسفاط قال: سئل أبو عبد الله عليه السلام وأنا عنده عن جارية كان لها أخوان زوجها الأكبر بالكوفة وزوجها الأصغر بأرض أخرى قال: الأول أولى بها إلا أن يكون الآخر قد دخل بها فهي امرأته ونكاحه جائز.

It is possible that what is meant by this report and the one before it mentioning the father, is the grandfather, if the girl's father is dead. [146 - Chapter on Who Can Marry Off a Woman Other Than Her Father] [856] 1 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub from several of our companions from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Nasr from Dawud ibn Sarhan from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, regarding a man who wants to marry off his sister, he said: "He should consult her. If she remains silent, that is her acknowledgement, and if she refuses, he should not marry her off. And if she says: 'Marry me to so-and-so,' then he should marry her off to whomever she approves of. And the orphan girl in a man's care should not be married off except with her consent."
[857] 2 - From him, from Muhammad ibn Yahya, from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Ali ibn Mahziyar, from Muhammad ibn al-Hasan al-Ash'ari, who said: "One of my cousins wrote to Abi Ja'far, peace be upon him: 'What do you say about a young girl whom her uncle married off, and when she grew up, she refused the marriage?' He wrote in his handwriting: 'She should not be forced into that, and the decision is hers.'"
[858] 3 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated from Abi Ali al-Ash'ari from Muhammad ibn Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan from Ibn Miskan from Walid Bayya' al-Asfat, who said: "Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, was asked while I was with him about a girl who had two brothers. فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على أنه إذا ردت الجارية أمرها إلى أخويها وعقدا جميعا في حالة واحدة كان العقد ما عقد عليه الأخ الأكبر ويبطل ما عقد الصغير اللهم إلا أن يكون دخل بها الذي عقد عليه الأخ الصغير فيكون مع الدخول هو أولى من الأول.
[859] 4 - فأما ما رواه علي بن إبراهيم عن أبيه عن ابن أبي نجران عن عاصم بن حميد عن محمد بن قيس عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: قضى أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام في امرأة أنكحها أخوها رجلا ثم أنكحتها أمها بعد ذلك وخالها وأخ لها صغير فدخل بها فحبلت فاختلفا (1) فيها فأقام الأول الشهود فألحقها بالأول وجعل لها الصداقين جميعا ومنعه زوجها الذي حقت له أن يدخل بها حتى تضع حملها ثم ألحق الولد بأبيه.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر ما قلناه في الخبر الأول من أنه تكون الجارية جعلت أمرها إلى أخويها ويكون سبق الأخ الأكبر بالعقد فإنه يكون عقده ماضيا ويبطل العقد الذي عقده الأخ الصغير على كل حال، وإن دخل بها الثاني كان لها الصداق بما استحل من فرجها ويلحق الولد بالرجل لأنه عقد عليها ولم يعلم أن أخاها الأكبر قد عقد لها على غيره قبل ذلك وكان عقد شبهة يلحق به الولد.
[860] 5 - فأما ما رواه علي بن إسماعيل الميثمي عن الحسن بن علي عن بعض أصحابه عن الرضا عليه السلام قال: الأخ الأكبر بمنزلة الأب.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر انه بمنزلة الأب في وجوب الاكرام له والانقياد لأوامره والرجوع إلى طاعته وليس المراد به أنه بمنزلة الأب في جواز العقد له على أخته الصغيرة بغير رضاها ولا استيمار من جهتها بدلالة ما قدمناه ولو كان صريحا بذلك لحملناه على التقية لأنه مذهب بعض العامة.

The interpretation of this report is that we understand it to mean that if the girl delegated her affairs to her two brothers, and they both contracted [marriage for her] simultaneously, the valid contract is the one made by the elder brother, and the contract made by the younger is void. Unless the one whom the younger brother contracted [marriage for her] with consummated the marriage, in which case, with the consummation, he has more right than the first.
[859] 4 - As for what Ali ibn Ibrahim narrated from his father, from Ibn Abi Najran, from Asim ibn Humaid, from Muhammad ibn Qais, from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him), who said: The Commander of the Believers (peace be upon him) judged in the case of a woman whose brother married her to a man, then her mother married her to another man after that, as well as her maternal uncle and a younger brother of hers, and the latter consummated the marriage and she became pregnant. They disputed (1) about her. The first one produced witnesses, so he assigned her to the first husband and granted her both dowries, preventing her husband, who had the right to her, from consummating the marriage until she gave birth. Then he attributed the child to its father.
The interpretation of this report is what we said about the first report, that the girl delegated her affairs to her two brothers, and the elder brother was the first to contract [marriage for her], so his contract is valid and the contract made by the younger brother is void in any case. Even if the second one consummated the marriage, she is entitled to a dowry for what he made lawful of her private parts, and the child is attributed to the man because he contracted marriage with her, and it was not known that her elder brother had contracted marriage for her to someone else before that. Thus, it was a contract of doubt (shubha), and the child is attributed to him.
[860] 5 - As for what Ali ibn Ismail al-Mithami narrated from al-Hasan ibn Ali, from some of his companions, from al-Ridha (peace be upon him), who said: The elder brother is in the position of the father.
The interpretation of this report is that he is in the position of the father in terms of the obligation to honor him, submit to his commands, and return to his obedience. It is not meant that he is in the position of the father in terms of the permissibility of contracting marriage for his younger sister without her consent or seeking permission from her, as indicated by what we presented earlier. Even if it were explicit in that regard, we would interpret it as taqiyya (dissimulation), because it is the opinion of some of the common people (al-'ammah).

[147 - باب تفضيل بعض النساء على بعض في النفقة والكسوة] [861] 1 - أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن علي بن الحكم عن عبد الملك بن عتبة الهاشمي قال: سألت أبا الحسن عليه السلام عن الرجل يكون له امرأتان يريد أن يؤثر إحداهما بالكسوة والعطية أيصلح ذلك؟ قال: لا بأس بذلك واجتهد في العدل بينهما.
[862] 2 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن معمر بن خلاد قال: سألت أبا الحسن عليه السلام هل يفضل الرجل نساءه بعضهن على بعض؟ قال: لا ولا بأس به في الإماء.
فالوجه في هذا الخبر أن نحمله على ضرب من الكراهية لان الأفضل التسوية بينهن على حد واحد.
[148 - باب القسمة بين الأزواج] [863] 1 - الحسين بن سعيد عن عثمان بن عيسى عن سماعة بن مهران قال: سألته عن رجل كانت له امرأة فيتزوج عليها هل يحل له أن يفضل واحدة على الأخرى؟
فقال: يفضل المحدثة حدثان عرسها ثلاثة أيام إذا كانت بكرا ثم يسوي بينهما بطيبة نفس إحداهما للأخرى.
[864] 2 - فأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن النضر بن سويد عن محمد بن أبي حمزة عن الحضرمي عن محمد بن مسلم قال قلت لأبي جعفر عليه السلام رجل تزوج امرأة وعنده امرأة فقال: إذا كانت بكرا فليبت عندها سبعا وإن كانت ثيبا فثلاثا.
فلا ينافي الخبر الأول لان الوجه أن نحمله على الجواز، والخبر الأول على الفضل لان الفضل ألا يفضل البكر بأكثر من ثلاث ليال حدثان عرسها، ويجوز تفضيلها

[147 - Chapter on Preferring Some Women Over Others in Spending and Clothing] [861] 1 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Abd al-Malik ibn Utbah al-Hashimi said: I asked Abu al-Hasan (peace be upon him) about a man who has two wives and wants to favor one of them with clothing and gifts. Is that permissible? He said: There is no harm in that, but strive for justice between them.
[862] 2 - As for what Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated from Muammar ibn Khallad, who said: I asked Abu al-Hasan (peace be upon him), "Can a man favor some of his wives over others?" He said: "No. But there is no harm in that with slave girls."
The explanation of this report is that we interpret it as a form of disapproval, because it is preferable to treat them equally.
[148 - Chapter on Dividing Time Among Wives] [863] 1 - Al-Husayn ibn Sa'id from Uthman ibn Isa from Sama'ah ibn Mihran said: I asked him about a man who has a wife and then marries another. Is it permissible for him to favor one over the other?
He said: He should favor the newly married one for three days after her wedding if she is a virgin, then treat them equally, unless one of them willingly gives up her right to the other.
[864] 2 - As for what al-Husayn ibn Sa'id narrated from al-Nadr ibn Suwaid from Muhammad ibn Abi Hamza from al-Hadrami from Muhammad ibn Muslim who said: I said to Abu Ja'far (peace be upon him): A man marries a woman while he already has a wife. He said: If she is a virgin, he should stay with her for seven nights, and if she is a non-virgin, then three nights.
This does not contradict the first report, because the explanation is that we interpret it as permissibility, and the first report as preference, because it is preferable not to favor the virgin with more than three nights after her wedding, and it is permissible to favor her.

There is nothing wrong with it if she consents. I said: So where is the saying of God Almighty: "(So come to them from where God has commanded you)"? He said:

[870] 4 - From him, from Ibn Faddal from Al-Hasan bin Al-Jahm from Hammad bin Uthman, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him), or he informed me of someone who asked him about a man who comes to a woman in that place, and there is a group in the house, and he said to me, raising his voice: The Messenger of God (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) said: Whoever burdens his slave with what he cannot bear, let him sell him. [871] 5 - From him, from Muawiyah bin Hakim from Ahmad bin Muhammad from Hammad bin Uthman from Abdullah bin Abi Ya'fur, who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a man who comes to a woman in her anus. He said: There is nothing wrong with it.

text:
عليه السلام أي شئ يقولون في إتيان النساء في أعجازهن؟ فقلت له: بلغني إن أهل المدينة لا يرون به بأسا، فقال: ان اليهود كانت تقول إذا أتى الرجل المرأة من خلفها خرج ولده أحول فأنزل الله تعالى: (نساؤكم حرث لكم فأتوا حرثكم أنى شئتم) من خلف وقدام مخالفا لقول اليهود ولم يعن في أدبارهن.
فلا ينافي ما قدمناه من الاخبار لان الذي تضمنه هذا الخبر تفسير الآية وسبب نزولها وما المراد بها وليس إذا لم يكن ما قلناه مرادا بالآية يجب أن يكون حراما بل لا يمتنع أن يدل دليل آخر على جواز ذلك وقد قدمناه من الاخبار ما يدل على ذلك.
[أبواب ما يرد منه النكاح] [150 - باب حكم المحدودة] [878] 1 - محمد بن يعقوب عن عدة من أصحابنا عن سهل بن زياد عن أحمد بن محمد عن رفاعة بن موسى قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن المحدود والمحدودة هل ترد من النكاح؟ قال: لا، قال رفاعة وسألته عن البرصاء فقال: قضى أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام في امرأة زوجها وليها وهي برصاء أن لها المهر بما استحل من فرجها وأن المهر على الذي زوجها وإنما صار المهر عليه لأنه دلسها، ولو أن رجلا تزوج امرأة أو زوجها رجلا لا يعرف دخيلة أمرها لم يكن عليه شئ وكان المهر يأخذه منها.

[885] 6 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub from a number of our companions, from Sahl ibn Ziyad and Muhammad ibn Yahya, from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from al-Hasan ibn Mahbub, from Ali ibn Ri'ab, from Abi Ubaidah, from Abi Ja'far, peace be upon him, concerning a man who married a woman from her guardian and found a defect in her after he had consummated the marriage. الخزاز عن غياث بن إبراهيم عن جعفر عن أبيه عن علي عليهم السلام في رجل تزوج امرأة فوجدها برصاء أو جذماء قال: إن كان لم يدخل بها ولم يبين فإن شاء طلق وإن شاء أمسك ولا صداق لها وإذا دخل بها فهي امرأته.
فلا ينافي الخبر الذي قدمناه من أن من هذه صورتها ترد من غير طلاق لان قوله عليه السلام إن شاء طلق محمول على أنه إن شاء خلاها لان ذلك مستفاد في أصل اللغة من لفظ الطلاق ولا يحمل على الطلاق الشرعي بدلالة الخبر الأول، فأما قوله فإذا دخل بها فهي امرأته فالوجه فيه أن نحمله على أنه دخل بها مع العلم بحالها فإنه يكون ذلك رضا بها، ومتى لم يعلم ذلك ودخل بها كان له ردها وكان لها الصداق بما استحل من فرجها حسب ما تضمنته الاخبار الأولة، ويؤكد ذلك أيضا:
[888] 9 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن حميد بن زياد عن الحسن بن محمد عن غير واحد عن أبان عن عبد الرحمن بن أبي عبد الله عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: قال في الرجل إذا تزوج المرأة ووجدها قرناء (1) وهو العفل أو برصاء أو جذماء إنه يردها ما لم يدخل بها.
[889] 10 - عنه عن أبي علي الأشعري عن محمد بن عبد الجبار عن صفوان بن يحيى عن عبد الرحمن بن أبي عبد الله عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: المرأة ترد من أربعة أشياء من البرص والجذام والجنون والقرن وهو العفل ما لم يقع عليها فإذا وقع عليها فلا.
فالوجه في هذين الخبرين أيضا ما قلناه من أنه متى دخل بها مع العلم بحالها لم يكن له ردها لان ذلك رضا منه يدل على ذلك:

Al-Khazzaz from Ghiyath ibn Ibrahim from Ja'far from his father from Ali, peace be upon them, regarding a man who marries a woman and finds her to have vitiligo or leprosy, he said: If he has not consummated the marriage with her and it was not made clear before, then if he wishes, he may divorce her, and if he wishes, he may keep her, and she has no dowry. But if he has consummated the marriage with her, then she is his wife.

This does not contradict the report we presented earlier, that one with this condition is returned without divorce, because his saying, peace be upon him, "If he wishes, he may divorce her" is to be understood as "If he wishes, he may release her," because that is derived in the original language from the word "divorce," and it is not to be understood as a legal divorce, as indicated by the first report. As for his saying, "But if he has consummated the marriage with her, then she is his wife," the explanation for this is that we understand it to mean that he consummated the marriage with her knowing her condition, for that would be acceptance of her. But if he did not know that and consummated the marriage with her, then he has the right to return her, and she has the dowry for what he has enjoyed of her private parts, according to what the first reports indicated. This is also confirmed by:

[888] 9 - What Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated from Humayd ibn Ziyad from al-Hasan ibn Muhammad from other than one person from Aban from Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Abd Allah from Abi Abd Allah, peace be upon him, who said: He said regarding a man who marries a woman and finds her to have a *qarna'* (1) which is *al-‘afl*, or vitiligo, or leprosy, that he should return her as long as he has not consummated the marriage with her.

[889] 10 - From him, from Abi Ali al-Ash'ari from Muhammad ibn Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan ibn Yahya from Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Abd Allah from Abi Abd Allah, peace be upon him, who said: A woman is returned for four things: vitiligo, leprosy, insanity, and *qarn*, which is *al-‘afl*, as long as he has not had intercourse with her, but if he has had intercourse with her, then no.

[890] 11 - What Muhammad bin Ya'qub narrated from Muhammad bin Yahya from Ahmad bin Muhammad from Ibn Mahbub from Abu Ayyub from Abu al- Sabbah who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a man who married a woman and found her to be *qarnā'* (having a physical impediment preventing intercourse). He said: "This woman will not conceive, and her husband will not be able to have intercourse with her, and she should be returned to her family in humiliation, and she is not entitled to a *mahr* (dowry)." I said: "What if he consummated the marriage?" He said: "If he knew about it before marrying her, meaning before intercourse, and then had intercourse with her, then he has accepted her. But if he did not know until after he had intercourse with her, then if he wishes, he may keep her, and if he wishes, he may divorce her."
[152 - Chapter on the Impotent Man and His Rulings]
[891] 1 - Al-Hussein bin Saeed from Safwan from al-'Ala from Muhammad bin Muslim from Abu Ja'far (peace be upon him) who said: "The impotent man is given a year's respite. Then, if his wife wishes, she may marry, and if she wishes, she may stay."
[892] 2 - From him from Muhammad bin al-Fudayl from Abu al-Sabbah al-Kinani who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a woman whose husband is afflicted and unable to have intercourse at all. Should she separate from him? He said: "Yes, if she wishes."
[893] 3 - From him from Muhammad bin al-Fudayl from Abu al-Sabbah who said: Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) said:
"If a man marries a woman and he is unable to have intercourse with women, he is given a year's respite to treat himself."
[894] 4 - Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Isa from Ali bin al-Hakam from Abu al-Bakhtari from Ja'far from his father (peace be upon them) that Ali (peace be upon him) used to say: "The impotent man is given a year's respite from the day his wife brings the case to him. If he is able to have intercourse with her, then (well and good), otherwise they are separated. If she is content to stay with him, then seeks the option (to leave) after that, then the option is forfeited, and she has no option."
Muhammad bin al-Hasan said: These narrations, even though they are general in that the impotent man is given a year's respite, are to be understood as applying to a case where he has not consummated the marriage at all. But if he has consummated the marriage, even once, and then this occurred to him

[896] 6 - أبو علي الأشعري عن محمد بن عبد الجبار عن صفوان بن يحيى عن أبان عن غياث الضبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: في العنين إذا علم أنه عنين يأتي النساء فرق بينهما، وإذا وقع عليها دفعة واحدة لم يفرق بينهما والرجل لا يرد من عيب.
[897] 7 - محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن الحسن بن موسى الخشاب عن غياث بن كلوب عن إسحاق بن عمار عن جعفر عن أبيه أن عليا عليه السلام كان يقول: إذا تزوج الرجل المرأة فوقع عليها مرة ثم أعرض عنها فليس لها الخيار لتصبر فقد أبتليت وليس لأمهات الأولاد ولا الإماء ما لم يسمها من الدهر إلا مرة واحدة خيار.

[153 - باب أن الرجل والمرأة إذا اختلفا في ادعاء العنة عليه] [899] 1 - الحسن بن محبوب عن علي بن رئاب عن أبي حمزة قال: سمعت أبا جعفر عليه السلام يقول: إذا تزوج الرجل المرأة الثيب التي قد تزوجت زوجا غيره فزعمت أنه لا يقربها منذ دخل بها فإن القول في ذلك قول الرجل وعليه ان يحلف بالله لقد جامعها لأنها المدعية، قال: فإن تزوجها وهي بكر فزعمت أنه لم يصل إليها فإن مثل هذا تعرف النساء فلينظر إليها من يوثق به منهن فإذا ذكرت أنها عذراء فعلى الامام أن يؤجله سنة واحدة فإن دخل إليها وإلا فرق بينهما وأعطيت نصف الصداق ولا عدة عليها.
[900] 2 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن عدة من أصحابنا عن أحمد بن محمد بن خالد عن عبد الله بن الفضل الهاشمي عن بعض مشيخته قال قالت امرأة لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام أو سأله رجل عن رجل تدعي عليه امرأته أنه عنين وينكر الرجل قال: تحشوها القابلة بالخلوق ولا يعلم الرجل فإن خرج وعلى ذكره الخلوق صدق وكذبت وإلا صدقت وكذب.
[901] 3 - عنه عن الحسين بن محمد عن حمدان القلانسي عن إسحاق بن بنان عن ابن بقاح عن غياث بن إبراهيم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: ادعت امرأة على زوجها على عهد أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام أنه لا يجامعها وادعى هو أنه يجامعها فأمرها أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام أن تستثفر بالزعفران ثم يغسل ذكره فإن خرج الماء أصفر صدقه وإلا أمره بطلاقها.
فالوجه في الجمع بين هذه الأخبار أن يكون الامام مخيرا في ذلك أن يحكم ما شاء

[153 - Chapter on a Man and Woman Disagreeing Regarding Her Claim of Impotence Against Him] [899] 1 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Ali ibn Ri'ab from Abi Hamza who said: I heard Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him, say: If a man marries a woman who is not a virgin, who has been married to another man, and she claims that he has not approached her since he entered upon her, then the statement is the man's, and he must swear by Allah that he has had intercourse with her because she is the claimant. He said: But if he marries her and she is a virgin, and she claims that he has not reached her, then such a thing is known by women, so let her be examined by those of them who are thiqa (trustworthy). If they mention that she is a virgin, then the Imam should give him a year's respite. If he does not reach her, then he should separate them, and she should be given half the dower, and there is no waiting period for her.
[900] 2 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated from several of our companions from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid from Abdullah ibn al-Fadl al-Hashimi from some of his sheikhs who said: A woman said to Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, or a man asked him about a man whose wife claimed that he was impotent and the man denied it, he said: The midwife should stuff her with khaluq, without the man knowing. If the khaluq comes out on his penis, she has told the truth and he has lied; otherwise, she has lied and he has told the truth.
[901] 3 - From him, from al-Husayn ibn Muhammad from Hamdan al-Qalanisi from Ishaq ibn Banan from Ibn Baqqah from Ghiyath ibn Ibrahim from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: A woman claimed against her husband in the time of Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, that he did not have intercourse with her, and he claimed that he did. Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, ordered her to wrap herself with saffron, then he should wash his penis. If the water came out yellow, she was truthful; otherwise, he ordered him to divorce her.
The way to reconcile these reports is that the Imam has the choice in that, to judge as he wishes.

[909] 6 - الحسين بن سعيد عن صفوان عن العلا عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن رجل آلى من امرأته حتى مضت أربعة أشهر قال: يوقف فإن عزم الطلاق اعتدت امرأته كما تعتد المطلقة فإن فاء فأمسك فلا بأس.
[910] 7 - عنه عن القاسم عن أبان عن منصور قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل آلى من امرأته فمرت به أربعة أشهر قال: يوقف فإن عزم الطلاق بانت منه وعليها عدة المطلقة وإلا كفر يمينه وأمسكها.
[911] 8 - عنه عن عثمان بن عيسى عن سماعة قال: سألته عن رجل آلى من امرأته فقال:
الايلاء أن يقول الرجل والله لا أجامعك كذا وكذا فإنه يتربص أربعة أشهر فإن فاء والايفاء أن يصالح أهله فإن الله غفور رحيم وإن لم يف بعد أربعة أشهر حتى يصالح أهله أو يطلق أجبر على ذلك ولا يقع طلاق فيما بينهما حتى يوقف وإن كان بعد الأربعة أشهر فإن أبى فرق بينهما الامام.
[912] 9 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد عن محمد بن سنان عن أبي الجارود أنه سمع أبا جعفر عليه السلام يقول في الايلاء يوقف بعد سنة؟ فقلت: بعد سنة؟ قال: نعم يوقفه بعد سنة.
فلا ينافي الاخبار الأولة لأنه قال: يوقف بعد سنة وليس فيه أنه إذا كان دون ذلك لا يوقف، وإنما يتعلق في ذلك بدليل الخطاب، وقد يترك ذلك لدليل وقد قدمنا ما يقتضي الانصراف عنه.

[908] 5 - Al-Husayn ibn Sa'eed from al-Nadr ibn Suwayd from 'Abd Allah ibn Sinan from Abi 'Abd Allah, peace be upon him, who said: I asked him about Īlā’ (vow of abstinence), and he said: "If four months pass and he is made to stop, then either he divorces or returns." I said: "If he divorces, does she observe the waiting period of a divorcee?" He said: "Yes."
[909] 6 - Al-Husayn ibn Sa'eed from Safwan from al-'Ala' from Muhammad ibn Muslim from Abi 'Abd Allah, peace be upon him, who said: I asked him about a man who made an Īlā’ from his wife until four months passed. He said: "He is made to stop. If he resolves to divorce, his wife observes the waiting period as a divorcee. If he returns and keeps her, there is no problem."
[910] 7 - From him from al-Qasim from Aban from Mansur who said: I asked Abu 'Abd Allah, peace be upon him, about a man who made an Īlā’ from his wife and four months passed. He said: "He is made to stop. If he resolves to divorce, she becomes separated from him, and she has the waiting period of a divorcee. Otherwise, he expiates his oath and keeps her."
[911] 8 - From him from 'Uthman ibn 'Isa from Sama'a who said: I asked him about a man who made an Īlā’ from his wife, and he said: "Īlā’ is when a man says, 'By Allah, I will not have intercourse with you such and such a time.' Then he is given a respite of four months. If he returns—and returning means reconciling with his family, for Allah is Forgiving, Merciful—and if he does not return after four months until he reconciles with his family or divorces, he is compelled to do so. No divorce occurs between them until he is made to stop, even if it is after the four months. If he refuses, the Imam separates them."
[912] 9 - As for what Ahmad ibn Muhammad narrated from Muhammad ibn Sinan from Abi al-Jarud, that he heard Abu Ja'far, peace be upon him, say regarding Īlā’: "He is made to stop after a year?" So I said: "After a year?" He said: "Yes, he stops him after a year."
This does not contradict the first reports because he said: "He is made to stop after a year," and it does not state that if it is less than that, he is not made to stop. Rather, this is related to dalīl al-khiṭāb (argument from implication), and that may be abandoned due to evidence, and we have already presented what necessitates turning away from it.

[913] 10 - وأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن يحيى عن بنان عن محسن بن أحمد عن يونس بن يعقوب عن أبي مريم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل آلى من امرأته قال: يوقف قبل الأربعة أشهر وبعدها.
فالوجه في قوله عليه السلام: " يوقف قبل أربعة أشهر " أن نحمله على أنه يوقف لالزام الحكم عليه في المدة المضروبة لذلك وهي الأربعة أشهر دون أن يلزم الطلاق أو الايفاء، وأما بعد الأربعة أشهر فإنه يلزم اما الطلاق أو الايفاء على ما بيناه، ويحتمل أن يكون المراد بالايلاء في هذا الخبر الظهار فإنه إذا كان كذلك كانت المدة فيه ثلاثة أشهر، يدل على ذلك:
[914] 11 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن محمد بن الحسين عن وهيب بن حفص عن أبي بصير قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل ظاهر من امرأته؟ قال:
إن أتاها فعليه عتق رقبة أو صيام شهرين متتابعين أو إطعام ستين مسكينا وإلا ترك ثلاثة أشهر فإن فاء وإلا وقف حتى يسئل ألك حاجة في امرأتك أو يطلقها فإن فاء فليس عليه شئ وهي امرأته وإن طلق واحدة فهو أملك برجعتها.

[913] 10 - As for what was narrated by Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Yahya from Banan from Muhsin ibn Ahmad from Yunus ibn Ya'qub from Abi Maryam from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him) concerning a man who swore to abstain from his wife, he said: He is stopped before the four months and after them.

The interpretation of his saying (peace be upon him): "He is stopped before four months" is that we understand it to mean that he is stopped to enforce the ruling upon him within the specified period, which is four months, without obligating divorce or fulfillment. As for after the four months, he is obligated to either divorce or fulfill the oath, as we have explained. It is also possible that what is meant by *ila'* in this report is *ẓihār*, for if that is the case, the period is three months. Indicating this is:
[914] 11 - What was narrated by Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Wuhaib ibn Hafs from Abi Basir, who said: I asked Abu Abdillah (peace be upon him) about a man who made *ẓihār* from his wife? He said: If he has intercourse with her, he must free a slave, or fast for two consecutive months, or feed sixty poor people. Otherwise, he is left for three months. If he returns (to her), then no penalty is upon him. If not he is stopped until he is asked, do you have a need for your wife or divorce her? If he returns, then nothing is upon him and she is his wife. And if he divorces her once, he has more right to take her back.
[156 - Chapter that the one who makes *ila'* if forced to divorce, it is a revocable divorce]
[915] 1 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub from Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umayr from Umar ibn Udhaynah from Burayd ibn Mu'awiyah who said: I heard Abu Abdillah (peace be upon him) saying regarding *ila'*: If a man swears not to approach his wife, nor touch her, nor that his head and her head be together, then he has leeway as long as the four months have not passed. [921] 2 - عنه عن الحسين بن محمد عن حمدان القلانسي عن إسحاق بن بنان عن ابن بقاح عن غياث بن إبراهيم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: كان أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام إذا أبى المولي أن يطلق جعل له حظيرة من قصب وأعطاه ربع قوته حتى يطلق.

If he divorces her after the four months, it is a revocable divorce. If he returns to her, meaning he takes her back, she remains with him with two divorces remaining. If he persists until the waiting period ('iddah) expires, it becomes an irrevocable divorce (bā'inah), and he cannot take her back except with a new contract and a specified dower.
[157 - Chapter on what is obligatory upon the one who takes an oath not to have sexual relations with his wife if he is compelled to divorce but refuses]
[920] 1 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub, from al-Husayn ibn Muhammad, from al-Mu'alla, from al-Hasan ibn Ali, from Hammad ibn Uthman, from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him), who said: Regarding the one who takes an oath not to have sexual relations with his wife and refuses to divorce, he said:
Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him) would make for him an enclosure of reeds and imprison him in it, and withhold food and drink from him until he divorces.
[921] 2 - From him, from al-Husayn ibn Muhammad, from Hamdan al-Qalanisi, from Ishaq ibn Bannan, from Ibn Buqah, from Ghiyath ibn Ibrahim, from Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him), who said: Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him), if the one who takes an oath refuses to divorce, would make for him an enclosure of reeds and give him a quarter of his sustenance until he divorces.
[922] 3 - As for what Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated, from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid, from Khalaf ibn Hammad, in a hadith that he traces back to Abi Abdillah (peace be upon him), regarding the one who takes an oath: either he returns (to his wife) or he divorces; if he does not, his neck will be struck.
This report is mursal (disconnected) and cannot be used to contradict the authenticated (musnad) reports. Even if it were authentic, it would be interpreted as referring to one who refuses to accept the ruling of the Imams, either divorce or returning, in opposition to them and the law (sharia) of Islam. For one who is like that is a kafir (disbeliever) and must be killed. But one who is not like that is not subject to more than imprisonment and pressure until he divorces or returns, as the first two reports indicate.

It is not obligatory except after violating the oath. If it were not that ẓihār (a pre-Islamic form of divorce where the husband declares his wife as unlawful to him as his mother's back) with an oath took effect, the expiation would not be obligatory, neither with the violation of the oath nor without it.
[927] 5 - Al-Ḥusayn ibn Saʿīd narrated that from Ibn Abī ʿUmayr from Muḥammad ibn Abī Ḥamzah from Ḥurayz from Muḥammad Muslim from Abī Jaʿfar (peace be upon him) who said: ẓihār (a pre-Islamic form of divorce where the husband declares his wife as unlawful to him as his mother's back) does not take effect except upon violation of the oath. If he violates it, he is not allowed to have intercourse with her until he offers expiation. If he is ignorant and does so, he has one expiation to offer.
[928] 6 - Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn ʿĪsā narrated from ʿAlī ibn Aḥmad ibn ʿAbd Allāh ibn Muḥammad who said:
I said to him: Some of your followers claim that if a man utters the words of ẓihār (a pre-Islamic form of divorce where the husband declares his wife as unlawful to him as his mother's back), expiation becomes obligatory upon him, whether he violates the oath or not, and they say that his violation is in the ẓihār (a pre-Islamic form of divorce where the husband declares his wife as unlawful to him as his mother's back) itself, and that the expiation was only made a punishment for his words. And some of them claim that expiation is not binding upon him until he violates the thing he swore upon, and if he violates it, then expiation becomes obligatory upon him, otherwise there is no expiation upon him. So he wrote (1): Expiation is not obligatory until violation is obligatory.
It is said that the meaning in these two narrations is not that he does the opposite of what he swore upon, but rather the meaning in them is that if the ẓihār (a pre-Islamic form of divorce where the husband declares his wife as unlawful to him as his mother's back) is conditional, then expiation is not obligatory until the condition is met, and whenever it is not met, expiation is not obligatory upon him. What indicates that is:
[929] 7 - What Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan ibn ʿĪsā narrated from ʿAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Abī Najrān from Ḥammād from Ḥurayz from Abī ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) who said: ẓihār (a pre-Islamic form of divorce where the husband declares his wife as unlawful to him as his mother's back) is of two kinds. One of them is that he says, "You are to me like my mother's back," then he is silent. That is the one who expiates before having intercourse. If he says, "You are to me like my mother's back if I do such and such," and then he does it and violates the oath, then he has to expiate when he violates the oath.

[930] 8 - عنه عن الحسين بن سعيد عن صفوان عن ابن أبي عمير عن عبد الرحمن ابن الحجاج عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: الظهار على ضربين، أحدهما:
الكفارة فيه قبل المواقعة، والآخر: بعد، فالذي يكفر قبل أن يواقع فهو الذي يقول أنت علي كظهر أمي ولا يقول إن فعلت بك كذا وكذا والذي يكفر بعد المواقعة هو الذي يقول أنت علي كظهر أمي إن قربتك.
[931] 9 - الحسين بن سعيد عن ابن أبي عمير عن عبد الرحمن بن الحجاج قال: الظهار على ضربين في أحدهما الكفارة إذا قال: أنت علي كظهر أمي ولا يقول أنت علي كظهر أمي إن قربتك.
ولا ينافي هذه الروايات:
[932] 10 - ما رواه محمد بن أحمد بن يحيى عن موسى بن عمر عن عبد الرحمن بن أبي نجران قال: سأل صفوان بن يحيى عبد الرحمن بن الحجاج وأنا حاضر عن الظهار قال: سمعت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام يقول: إذا قال: الرجل لامرأته أنت علي كظهر أمي لزمه الظهار قال لها دخلت أو لم تدخلي خرجت أو لم تخرجي أو لم يقل لها شيئا فقد لزمه الظهار.
لأن هذه الرواية إنما تضمنت أن التلفظ بالظهار موجب لحكمه وإن لم يعلقه بشرط وذلك صحيح وهو أحد أقسام الظهار على ما دلت عليه الأخبار الأولة ولم يقل إن الظهار لا يقع إلا بشرط فيكون ذلك اعتراضا عليه، فإن قيل كيف يقولون إن الظهار بشرط واقع وقد رويت أخبار أنه إذا كان مشروطا لا يقع روى ذلك:
[933] 11 - أحمد بن محمد بن يحيى عن أبي سعيد الآدمي عن القاسم بن محمد الزيات

[930] 8 - From him, from al-Husayn ibn Sa'id, from Safwan, from Ibn Abi 'Umayr, from 'Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj, from Abi 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) who said: Zihar (a form of divorce by likening the wife to one's mother) is of two types: one whose expiation is before intercourse, and the other after. The one who expiates before intercourse is the one who says, "You are to me as my mother's back," and does not say, "If I do such and such to you." And the one who expiates after intercourse is the one who says, "You are to me as my mother's back if I approach you."
[931] 9 - Al-Husayn ibn Sa'id, from Ibn Abi 'Umayr, from 'Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj who said: Zihar is of two types; in one of them, expiation is due when he says, "You are to me as my mother's back," and does not say, "You are to me as my mother's back if I approach you."
These narrations do not contradict:
[932] 10 - What Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Yahya narrated, from Musa ibn 'Umar, from 'Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Najran who said: Safwan ibn Yahya asked 'Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj, and I was present, about Zihar. He said: I heard Abu 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) say: If a man says to his wife, "You are to me as my mother's back," Zihar is binding upon him. He said, "Whether he had intercourse with her or not, whether she left or not, or he did not say anything to her, then Zihar is binding upon him."
Because this narration only implies that uttering the words of Zihar necessitates its ruling, even if he does not condition it on anything, and that is correct, and it is one of the types of Zihar as indicated by the earlier reports. It does not say that Zihar only occurs with a condition, so it would be an objection to it. If it is said, how do they say that Zihar with a condition is effective when there are reports narrated that if it is conditional it does not occur. That was narrated by:
[933] 11 - Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Yahya, from Abi Sa'id al-Adami, from al-Qasim ibn Muhammad al-Zayyat

text:
قال قلت: لأبي الحسن الرضا عليه السلام إني ظاهرت من امرأتي فقال: لي كيف قلت؟ قال قلت: أنت علي كظهر أمي إن فعلت كذا وكذا فقال: لي لا شئ عليك ولا تعد.
[934] 12 - وروى محمد بن يعقوب عن أحمد بن محمد عن ابن فضال عن ابن بكير عن رجل من أصحابنا عن رجل قال: قلت لأبي الحسن عليه السلام إني قلت لامرأتي أنت علي كظهر أمي إن خرجت من باب الحجرة فخرجت فقال: ليس عليك شئ فقلت: إني قوي على أن أكفر فقال: ليس عليك شئ فقلت: إني قوي على أن أكفر رقبة أو رقبتين فقال: ليس عليك شئ قويت أو لم تقو.
[935] 13 - روى ابن فضال عمن أخبره عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: لا يكون الظهار إلا على مثل موضع الطلاق.
قيل له أول ما في هذه الأخبار أن الخبرين منهما وهما الأخيران مرسلان والمراسيل لا يعترض بها على الاخبار المسندة لما بيناه في غير موضع، وأما الخبر الأول فراويه أبو سعيد الآدمي وهو ضعيف جدا عند نقاد الاخبار وقد استثناه أبو جعفر بن بابويه في رجال نوادر الحكمة مع أن الخبر الأخير عام ويجوز لنا أن نخصه بتلك الأخبار، فنقول إن الظهار يراعى فيه جميع ما يراعى في الطلاق من الشاهدين وكون المرأة طاهرا وأن يكون مريدا للظهار وغير ذلك من الشروط إلا أن يكون معلقا بشرط فإن هذا الحكم يختص الظهار دون الطلاق على أن قوله عليه السلام في الخبر الأول لا شئ عليك يحتمل أن يكون المراد به لا شئ عليك من العقاب ثم نهاه عن ذلك فيما بعد لان التلفظ بالظهار محظور لا يجوز ذكره لان الله تعالى قال: (وإنهم ليقولون منكرا من القول وزورا) ويحتمل أيضا أن يكون المراد لا شئ عليك قبل حصول الشرط

He said: I said to Abu al-Hasan al-Ridha, peace be upon him: "I performed *ẓihār* with my wife." He said to me: "How did you say it?" He said: I said: "You are to me as the back of my mother if I do such and such." He said to me: "There is nothing upon you, and do not repeat it."
[934] 12 - Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ibn Faddal from Ibn Bukayr from a man among our companions from a man who said: I said to Abu al-Hasan, peace be upon him: "I said to my wife, 'You are to me as the back of my mother if you leave the room,' and she left." He said: "There is nothing upon you." I said: "I am capable of expiation." He said: "There is nothing upon you." I said: "I am capable of expiating a slave or two." He said: "There is nothing upon you, whether you are capable or not."
[935] 13 - Ibn Faddal narrated from someone who informed him from Abi Abdillah, peace be upon him, who said: "*Ẓihār* is not valid except on something upon which divorce is valid."
It is said to him: The first thing in these narrations is that two of them, the last two, are *mursal* (missing a link in the chain of narration), and *marāsīl* (narrations with missing links) are not opposed to *musnad* (supported) narrations, as we have explained in more than one place. As for the first narration, its narrator is Abu Sa'id al-Adami, and he is *da'īf jiddan* (very weak) according to the critics of narrations, and Abu Ja'far ibn Babawayh has excluded him in *Rijal Nawadir al-Hikma*, even though the last narration is general, and it is permissible for us to specify it with those narrations. So we say that *ẓihār* takes into account everything that is taken into account in divorce, from the two witnesses and the woman being pure, and that one intends *ẓihār*, and other conditions, except that it is conditional on a condition, for this ruling applies specifically to *ẓihār* and not to divorce, given his saying, peace be upon him, in the first narration, "There is nothing upon you," it is possible that what is meant by it is that there is nothing upon you of punishment, then he forbade him from that afterwards because uttering *ẓihār* is prohibited and it is not permissible to mention it, because God Almighty said: "And indeed, they say an objectionable statement and a falsehood." (58:2) It is also possible that what is meant is that there is nothing upon you before the condition is met.

ثلاث مرات قال: يكفر ثلاث مرات قلت: فإن واقع قبل أن يكفر قال: يستغفر الله ويمسك حتى يكفر.
فلا ينافي الاخبار الأولة لأنه ليس في قوله فليمسك حتى يكفر أنه كفارة واحدة أو اثنتين وإذا لم يكن ذلك في ظاهره جاز أن لا يكون المراد به حتى يكفر الكفارتين.
[953] 5 - وأما ما رواه محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن محمد بن أحمد العلوي عن عبد الله بن الحسن عن جده عن علي بن جعفر عن أبيه عن آبائه عن علي عليه السلام قال: أتى رجل من الأنصار من بني النجار رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله فقال: إني ظاهرت من امرأتي فواقعتها قبل أن أكفر قال: وما حملك على ذلك؟ قال: رأيت بريق خلخالها وبياض ساقها في القمر فواقعتها فقال النبي صلى الله عليه وآله: لا تقربها حتى تكفر وأمره بكفارة الظهار.
فليس فيه أيضا ما ينافي ما قدمناه من وجوب الكفارتين بعد المواقعة لان الذي في الخبر أنه أمره بكفارة الظهار وليس فيه أن أمره بكفارة واحدة أو كفارتين فإذا احتمل ذلك فلا ينافي الاخبار الأولة، على أنه لو كان صريحا بأن عليه كفارة واحدة لكنا نحمله على من فعل ذلك جاهلا، لان من ذلك حكمه كان عليه كفارة واحدة، يدل على ذلك:
[954] 6 - ما رواه محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن محمد بن الحسن عن ابن أبي عمير عن محمد بن أبي حمزة عن حريز عن محمد بن مسلم عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: الظهار لا يقع إلا على الحنث فإذا حنث فليس له أن يواقعها حتى يكفر فإن جهل وفعل فإنما عليه كفارة واحدة.
[955] 7 - فأما ما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن صفوان بن يحيى عن موسى عن زرارة

Three times he said: "He expiates," three times. I said: "What if he has intercourse before expiating?" He said: "He asks forgiveness of Allah and refrains until he expiates."

This does not contradict the earlier reports, because his saying, "Let him refrain until he expiates," does not specify whether it is one expiation or two. Since this is not explicit, it is possible that it does not mean that he must perform both expiations.

[953] 5 - As for what Muhammad b. 'Ali b. Mahbub narrated from Muhammad b. Ahmad al-'Alawi from 'Abd Allah b. al-Hasan from his grandfather from 'Ali b. Ja'far from his father from his forefathers from 'Ali (peace be upon him), who said: "A man from the Ansar from Banu al-Najjar came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) and said: 'I made *ẓihār* of my wife, then I had intercourse with her before expiating.' He said: 'What made you do that?' He said: 'I saw the gleam of her anklet and the whiteness of her calf in the moonlight, so I had intercourse with her.' The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) said: 'Do not approach her until you expiate,' and he ordered him to perform the expiation for *ẓihār*."

This also does not contradict what we have stated regarding the obligation of two expiations after intercourse, because what is in the report is that he ordered him to perform the expiation for *ẓihār*, and it does not state that he ordered him to perform one expiation or two. If it allows for that possibility, then it does not contradict the earlier reports. Furthermore, even if it were explicit that he only had to perform one expiation, we would interpret it as applying to someone who did that out of ignorance, because the ruling for such a person is that he only has to perform one expiation. This is indicated by:

[954] 6 - What Muhammad b. 'Ali b. Mahbub narrated from Muhammad b. al-Hasan from Ibn Abi 'Umayr from Muhammad b. Abi Hamza from Hurayz from Muhammad b. Muslim from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him), who said: "*Ẓihār* does not occur except upon breaking an oath. If he breaks the oath, then he is not allowed to have intercourse with her until he expiates. If he is ignorant and does so, then he only has to perform one expiation."

From Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him): If a man performs ẓihār from his wife and then has intercourse with her before expiating, he only has one expiation, and he must abstain from her until he expiates.

This may also be interpreted as we mentioned earlier, that he had intercourse with her out of ignorance. It is also possible that this is specific to one whose ẓihār is conditional on intercourse, because for one who is like that, expiation is not required except after intercourse, as we have presented in the preceding report of 'Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj in detail, and also in the hadith of Hurayz.

[956] 8 - As for what Ali ibn Ismail narrated from Ibn Abi Umayr from Ibn Udhaynah from Zurarah, who said:
I said to Abi 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him): A man performed ẓihār and then had intercourse, should he expiate? He said to me: Is this not what the faqih (jurist) does?

The interpretation of this report is that we understand it to apply to one whose ẓihār is conditional on intercourse, for the expiation is not obligatory except after intercourse. If he were to expiate before intercourse, it would not suffice him for what is obligatory upon him after intercourse, and he would be obligated to another expiation at the time of intercourse. Therefore, he (peace be upon him) pointed out that intercourse for one to whom this ruling applies is from the actions of the faqih (jurist) who seeks to be free from the obligation of another expiation, and that is only through intercourse.

text:
حاضت وطهرت أشهد على طلاقها تطليقة واحدة ثم لا تحل له حتى تنكح زوجا غيره وأما طلاق العدة فإنه يدعها حتى تحيض وتطهر ثم يطلقها بشهادة شاهدين ثم يراجعها ويواقعها ثم ينتظر بها الطهر فإذا حاضت وطهرت اشهد شاهدين على تطليقة أخرى ثم يراجعها ويواقعها ثم ينتظر بها الطهر فإذا حاضت وطهرت أشهد الشاهدين على التطليقة الثالثة ثم لا تحل له حتى تنكح زوجا غيره وعليها أن تعتد ثلاثة قروء من يوم طلقها التطليقة الثالثة، فإن طلقها واحدة على طهر بشهود ثم انتظر بها حتى تحيض وتطهر ثم طلقها قبل أن يراجعها لم يكن طلاق الثانية طلاقا لأنه طلق طالقا لأنه إذا كانت المرأة مطلقة من زوجها كانت خارجة من ملكه حتى يراجعها فإذا راجعها صارت في ملكه ما لم يطلق التطليقة الثالثة، فإذا طلقها التطليقة الثالثة فقد خرج ملك الرجعة من يده فإن طلقها على طهر بشهود ثم راجعها وانتظر بها الطهر من غير مواقعة فحاضت وطهرت ثم طلقها قبل أن يدنسها بمواقعة بعد الرجعة لم يكن طلاقه لها طلاقا لأنه طلقها التطليقة الثانية في طهر الأولى فلا ينقضي الطهر إلا بمواقعة الرجعة، وكذلك لا تكون التطليقة الثالثة إلا بمراجعة ومواقعة بعد الرجعة ثم حيض وطهر بعد المحيض ثم طلاق بشهود حتى يكون لكل تطليقة طهر من تدنيس المواقعة بشهود.
قال محمد بن الحسن: الذي تضمن هذا الخبر من أنه إذا طلقها ثلاث تطليقات للسنة لا تحل حتى تنكح زوجا غيره وهو المعتمد عندي والمعول عليه لأنه موافق لظاهر الكتاب قال الله تعالى: (الطلاق مرتان فإمساك بمعروف أو تسريح بإحسان) إلى قوله: (فإن طلقها) يعني الثالثة: (فلا تحل له من بعد حتى تنكح زوجا غيره) ولم يفصل بين طلاق السنة وطلاق العدة فينبغي أن تكون الآية على عمومها ويكون الخبر مؤكدا لها، ويدل عليه أيضا:

She menstruated and became pure, and I bear witness to her divorce with one divorce. Then she is not permissible for him until she marries another husband. As for the divorce during the waiting period ('iddah), he should leave her until she menstruates and becomes pure. Then he divorces her with the testimony of two witnesses. Then he takes her back and has intercourse with her. Then he waits for her purity. If she menstruates and becomes pure, he has two witnesses testify to another divorce. Then he takes her back and has intercourse with her. Then he waits for her purity. If she menstruates and becomes pure, he has the two witnesses testify to the third divorce. Then she is not permissible for him until she marries another husband. And she must observe a waiting period of three menstrual cycles from the day he divorced her with the third divorce. If he divorces her once during purity with witnesses, then waits for her until she menstruates and becomes pure, then divorces her before taking her back, the second divorce is not a divorce, because he divorced a divorcee. For if a woman is divorced from her husband, she is out of his ownership until he takes her back. If he takes her back, she becomes his property as long as he does not issue the third divorce. If he issues the third divorce, the right of revocation is out of his hand. If he divorces her during purity with witnesses, then takes her back and waits for her purity without intercourse, and she menstruates and becomes pure, then he divorces her before he defiles her with intercourse after the revocation, his divorce of her is not a divorce, because he divorced her with the second divorce during the purity of the first, so the purity is not completed except with intercourse after the revocation. Likewise, the third divorce is not valid except with revocation and intercourse after the revocation, then menstruation and purity after menstruation, then divorce with witnesses, so that each divorce has purity from the defilement of intercourse with witnesses.
Muhammad ibn al-Hasan said: What this report includes, that if he divorces her with three divorces according to the Sunnah, she is not permissible for him until she marries another husband, is what I consider reliable and depend upon, because it agrees with the apparent meaning of the Book of Allah. Allah the Almighty said: "Divorce is twice; then either retain [her] according to acceptable terms or release [her] with good treatment" until His saying: "And if he has divorced her [for the third time]," meaning the third time, "then she is not lawful to him afterward until [after] she marries a husband other than him." And He did not differentiate between divorce according to the Sunnah and divorce during the 'iddah, so the verse should be taken in its generality and the report should confirm it. [960] 2 - What Al-Hussein bin Saeed narrated from Hammad bin Issa from Amr bin Uthaina from Zurara, Bukair the two sons of A'yun, Muhammad bin Muslim, Bureed bin Muawiya al-Ajali, al-Fudail bin Yasar, Ismail al-Azraq, and Muammar bin Yahya bin Salim, all of them heard it from Abi Jaafar (peace be upon him) and from his son after his father (peace be upon them both) in the manner of what they said, even if I do not remember its exact wording, but no general meaning is lost. That the divorce that God Almighty commanded in His Book and the Sunnah of His Prophet (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) is that if a woman menstruates and becomes pure from her menstruation, two just men should witness before he has intercourse with her, one divorce, then he is more entitled to take her back unless three periods pass. If he takes her back, she remains with him with two divorces. And if three periods pass before he takes her back, then she has more right over herself. If he wants to propose to her with the suitors, he can propose to her. If he marries her, she remains with him with two divorces. And anything other than this is not a divorce.
[961] 3 - From him, from Al-Nadr bin Suwaid, from Abdullah bin Sinan, from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him), who said: Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him) said: If a man wants a divorce, he should divorce her before (1) her waiting period, without intercourse. If he divorces her once and then leaves her until her term expires, if he wishes, he can propose with the suitors. If he takes her back before her term expires or after it, she remains with him with one divorce. If he divorces her a second time and wants to propose to her with the suitors, if he left her until her term expired, and if he wishes, he can take her back before her term expires. If he does so, she remains with him with two divorces. If he divorces her three times, then she is not lawful for him until she marries another husband. And she inherits and is inherited from as long as she was in the blood of the first two divorces.
[962] 4 - As for what Muhammad bin Yaqoub narrated from Ali bin Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umair from Abdullah bin al-Mughira from Shuaib al-Haddad from Mualla bin Khunais from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him), who said: I asked him about a man who divorced his wife and then did not take her back until she had three menstruations, then he married her.

[963] 5 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن حميد بن زياد عن الحسن بن سماعة عن محمد بن زياد وصفوان عن رفاعة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: سألته عن رجل طلق امرأته حتى بانت منه وانقضت عدتها ثم تزوجت زوجا آخر فطلقها أيضا ثم تزوجت زوجها الأول أيهدم ذلك الطلاق الأول؟ قال: نعم قال ابن سماعة وكان ابن بكير يقول المطلقة إذا طلقها زوجها ثم تركها حتى تبين ثم تزوجها فإنما هي عنده على طلاق مستأنف، قال: ابن سماعة وذكر الحسين بن هاشم أنه سأل ابن بكير عنها فأجابه بهذا الجواب فقال له: سمعت في هذا شيئا؟ فقال: رواية رفاعة فقال: إن رفاعة روى أنه إذا دخل بينهما زوج، فقال: زوج وغير زوج عندي سواء فقلت: سمعت في هذا شيئا فقال: لا هذا مما رزق الله من الرأي، قال ابن سماعة وليس نأخذ بقول ابن بكير فإن الرواية إذا كان بينهما زوج.
[964] 6 - وروى محمد بن أبي عبد الله عن معاوية بن حكيم عن عبد الله بن المغيرة قال:
سألت عبد الله بن بكير عن رجل طلق امرأته واحدة ثم تركها حتى بانت ثم تزوجها

Then he divorced her and left her until she had three menstrual cycles. Then he married her and divorced her again, leaving her until she had three menstrual cycles without him taking her back, meaning having intercourse with her. He said: He is allowed to marry her forever as long as he does not take her back and have intercourse with her.
This does not contradict the earlier reports, because his statement, "He is allowed to marry her forever as long as he does not take her back and have intercourse with her," may mean if she had married another husband who consummated the marriage with her, then he separated from her by death or divorce. Because whoever is like that, it is permissible for him to marry her forever, because the (second) husband nullifies the first divorce. And it is not in the report that it is permissible for him to marry her even if she did not marry someone else. And if that is not apparent, we interpret it as we said. What indicates that the consummation of the marriage by the (second) husband is considered in what we mentioned:
[963] 5 - What Muhammad ibn Ya'qub narrated from Humayd ibn Ziyad from al-Hasan ibn Sama'a from Muhammad ibn Ziyad and Safwan from Rifa'a from Abi 'Abdillah, peace be upon him, who said: I asked him about a man who divorced his wife until she was completely separated from him, and her waiting period expired. Then she married another husband who also divorced her. Then she married her first husband. Does that nullify the first divorce? He said: Yes. Ibn Sama'a said: Ibn Bukayr used to say: If a divorced woman is divorced by her husband, then he leaves her until she becomes clear (from her menses), then he marries her, then according to him, she is only subject to a new divorce. Ibn Sama'a said: And al-Husayn ibn Hashim mentioned that he asked Ibn Bukayr about it, and he answered him with this answer. So he said to him: Did you hear anything about this? He said: Rifa'a's narration. He said: Rifa'a narrated that if a husband entered between them. He said: A husband and not a husband are the same to me. So I said: Did you hear anything about this? He said: No, this is from what Allah has blessed me with in opinion. Ibn Sama'a said: And we do not take Ibn Bukayr's statement, for the narration is if there was a husband between them.

[968] 10 - As for what was narrated by Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa from Ibn Abi Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabi who said: I asked Abu Abdullah (peace be upon him) about a man who divorced his wife once, then left her until her waiting period (عدة, iddah) passed, and she married someone else. And whenever one of these conditions is not met, it is not permissible for her to return to the first.

[973] 15 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن حميد بن زياد عن ابن سماعة عن صفوان عن ابن مسكان عن أبي بصير قال قلت لأبي عبد الله عليه السلام المرأة التي لا تحل لزوجها حتى تنكح زوجا غيره قال: هي التي تطلق ثم تراجع ثم تطلق ثم تراجع ثم تطلق الثالثة فهي التي لا تحل لزوجها حتى تنكح زوجا غيره يذوق عسيلتها.
[974] 16 - صفوان عن ابن بكير عن زرارة عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام في الرجل يطلق امرأته تطليقة ثم يراجعها بعد انقضاء عدتها فإذا طلقها ثلاثة لم تحل له حتى تنكح زوجا غيره، فإذا تزوجها غيره ولم يدخل بها وطلقها أو مات عنها لم تحل لزوجها الأول حتى يذوق الآخر عسيلتها.
والذي يدل على أنه يراعى أن يكون الزوج بالغا والتزويج دائما:
[975] 17 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن عدة من أصحابنا عن سهل بن زياد عن علي بن أسباط عن علي بن الفضل الواسطي قال: كتبت إلى الرضا عليه السلام رجل طلق امرأته بالطلاق الذي لا تحل له حتى تنكح زوجا غيره فتزوجها غلام لم يحتلم قال:
لا حتى يبلغ، وكتبت إليه ما حد البلوغ؟ فقال: ما أوجب على المؤمن الحدود.
[976] 18 - وروى محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن أحمد بن الحسن عن عمرو بن سعيد عن مصدق بن صدقة عن عمار الساباطي قال: سألت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام عن رجل طلق امرأته تطليقتين للعدة ثم تزوجت متعة هل تحل لزوجها الأول بعد ذلك؟ قال:
لا حتى تتزوج بثان.

[982] 24 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن علي بن محبوب عن أحمد بن محمد بن الحسن بن محبوب عن عبد الله بن بكير عن زرارة بن أعين قال: سمعت أبا جعفر عليه السلام يقول الطلاق الذي يحبه الله تعالى والذي يطلق الفقيه وهو العدل بين المرأة والرجل أن يطلقها في استقبال الطهر بشهادة شاهدين وإرادة من القلب ثم يتركها حتى تمضي ثلاثة قروء فإذا رأت الدم في أول قطرة من الثالثة وهي آخر القروء لان الأقراء هي الأطهار فقد بانت منه وهي أملك بنفسها فإن شاءت تزوجته وحلت له فإن فعل هذا بها مائة مرة هدم ما قبله وحلت للأزواج فإن راجعها قبل أن تملك نفسها ثم طلقها ثلاث مرات يراجعها ويطلقها لم تحل له إلا بزوج.
فهذه الرواية أكد شبهة من جميع ما تقدم من الروايات في هذا الباب لأنها لا تحتمل شيئا مما قلناه لكونها خالية من وجوه الاحتمال مصرحة بعدم الزوج، إلا أن طريقها عبد الله بن بكير وقد قدمنا من الاخبار ما تضمن أنه قال حين سئل عن هذه المسألة هذا مما رزق الله من الرأي، ولو كان سمع ذلك من زرارة لكان يقول حين سأله الحسين بن هاشم وغيره عن ذلك وأنه هل عندك في ذلك شئ كان يقول نعم رواية زرارة ولا يقول نعم رواية رفاعة حتى قال له السائل إن رواية رفاعة تتضمن أنه إذا كان بينهما زوج فقال له هو عند ذلك هذا مما رزق الله من الرأي فعدل عن قوله في رواية رفاعة إلى أن قال الزوج وغير الزوج سواء عندي فلما ألح عليه السائل قال:
هذا مما رزق الله من الرأي ومن هذه صورته يجوز أن يكون أسند ذلك إلى زرارة نصرة لمذهبه الذي أفتى به وأنه لما رأى أن أصحابه لا يقبلون ما يقوله برأيه أسنده إلى من رواه عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام وليس عبد الله بن بكير معصوما لا يجوز هذا عليه بل وقع منه من العدول عن اعتقاد مذهب الحق إلى اعتقاد مذهب الفطحية ما هو
