Ibn Abi Nasr from al-Muthanna from Zurara who said: Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, was asked about the saying of God Almighty: "And those who accuse their wives [of adultery] and have no witnesses except themselves..." He said: "He is the accuser who accuses his wife. If he accuses her and then admits that he lied about her, he will be flogged with the prescribed punishment, and his wife will be returned to him. But if he refuses to retract and insists on proceeding, let him bear witness four times by God that he is of the truthful, and the fifth time let him invoke the curse of God upon himself if he is of the liars. And if she wants to ward off the punishment from herself—and the punishment is stoning—let her bear witness four times by God that he is of the liars, and the fifth time that the wrath of God be upon her if he is of the truthful. If she does not do that, she will be stoned, but if she does, she will have averted the prescribed punishment from herself, and then she will not be lawful for him until the Day of Resurrection." I said: "What if they are separated and she has a child who dies?" He said: "His mother inherits from him, and if his mother dies, his maternal uncles inherit from him. And whoever says that he is a child of fornication will be flogged with the prescribed punishment." I said: "Is the child returned to him if he acknowledges him?" He said: "No, nor any honor. And the father does not inherit from the son, but the son inherits from him."
[1322] 2 - Al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from Abd al-Rahman ibn al-Hajjaj who said: "I was present when Abbad al-Basri asked Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, 'How does a man perform *mula'ana* (mutual cursing) with a woman?'" Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, said: "A man from the Muslims came to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, and said: 'O Messenger of God, if a man entered his house and found a man having intercourse with his wife, what should he do?' He said: 'The Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, turned away from him.' The man left, and that man was the one who was afflicted with that concerning his wife. He said: 'Then the revelation came down from God with the ruling about it, and the Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, sent to that man and called him and said to him: "Are you the one who saw a man with your wife?"' He said: 'Yes.' He said to him: 'Go and bring me your wife, for God Almighty has revealed concerning you and her.' So her husband brought her, and the Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, made her stand, then said to the husband: 'Bear witness four times by God that you are of the truthful in what you accused her of.' He said: 'So he bore witness.' He said: 'Then he said: Fear

text:
الله فإن لعنة الله شديدة ثم قال له: اشهد الخامسة إن لعنة الله عليك إن كنت من الكاذبين قال: فشهد فأمر به فنحي، ثم قال للمرأة: اشهدي أربع شهادات بالله أن زوجك لمن الكاذبين فيما رماك به قال فشهدت ثم قال لها: أمسكي فوعظها ثم قال لها:
أتقي الله إن غضب الله شديد ثم قال لها: اشهدي الخامسة ان غضب الله عليك إن كان زوجك لمن الصادقين فيما رماك به قال: فشهدت، قال: ففرق بينهما وقال لهما: لا تجتمعا بنكاح أبدا بعد ما تلاعنتما.
[1323] 3 - فأما ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن محمد بن يحيى عن أحمد بن محمد عن علي بن حديد عن جميل بن دراج عن محمد بن مسلم عن أحدهما عليهما السلام قال: لا يكون لعان إلا بنفي ولد وقال: إذا قذف الرجل امرأته لاعنها.
[1324] 4 - وما رواه أحمد بن محمد بن أبي نصر البزنطي عن عبد الكريم بن عمرو عن أبي بصير عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: لا يقع اللعان حتى يدخل الرجل بامرأته ولا يكون اللعان إلا بنفي الولد.
فلا تنافي بين هذين الخبرين والخبرين الأولين لان الحديثين الأولين مطابقان لظاهر القرآن قال الله تعالى: (والذين يرمون أزواجهم ولم يكن لهم شهداء إلا أنفسهم) الآية ولم يشترط في ذلك نفي الولد فيجب أن يثبت في كل موضع حصل فيه الرمي والخبران الأولان يؤكدان أيضا ذلك، مع أن الحديث الأول من الحديثين الأخيرين لو كان المراد به بنفي اللعان بمجرد القذف على كل حال لكان متناقضا لأنه قال:
لا يكون اللعان إلا بنفي الولد ثم قال: وإذا قذف الرجل المرأة لاعنها فلو كان المراد به ما ذهب إليه قوم لكان متناقضا كما تراه.

[217 - Chapter on Li'an being established between a free man and a female slave, and a free woman and a male slave]
[1329] 1 - Ali ibn Ibrahim from his father from Ibn Abi Umair from Hammad from al-Halabi from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: I asked him about a free woman whose husband, who is a male slave, accuses her of adultery. He said: He performs Li'an with her.
[1330] 2 - Muhammad ibn Yaqub from Muhammad ibn Yahya from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from al-'Ala from Muhammad ibn Muslim from one of the two (peace be upon them) that he was asked about a slave who accuses his wife of adultery. He said: They perform Li'an as free people perform Li'an.
[1331] 3 - From him, from Ali, from his father, from Ibn Abi Umair, from Jamil ibn Darraj, from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: I asked him about a free man between whom and a female slave there is Li'an? He said: Yes, and between a male slave and a free woman, and between a slave and a female slave, and between a Muslim and a Jewish woman or a Christian woman, and they do not inherit from each other, nor do the free man and the female slave inherit from each other.
[1332] 4 - As for what al-Hasan ibn Mahbub narrated from Ibn Sinan from Abi Abdullah (peace be upon him) who said: A free man does not perform Li'an with a female slave, nor with a Dhimmi woman, nor with the one he enjoys temporarily.
This can be interpreted in two ways: The first: that the free man does not perform Li'an with a female slave if he has sexual relations with her by right of possession, and his saying "nor the Dhimmi woman" is like that if she is a Dhimmi female slave. He differentiated between his saying "the female slave" and "the Dhimmi woman" because he may have meant by his saying "female slave" if she is a Muslim, then he clarified by his saying "nor the Dhimmi woman," meaning if she is a Dhimmi female slave. This is one interpretation. The other interpretation: is that what is meant by the free man is if he marries a female slave without her master's permission, because if that is the case, there is no Li'an between them, and the children are slaves to her master if there is a child. What indicates that is:
[1333] 5 - What Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Mahbub narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Hasan ibn Mahbub from al-'Ala from Muhammad ibn Muslim who said: I asked Abu Ja'far (peace be upon him) about a free man who performs Li'an with a female slave.

[1338] 10 - As for what Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Ṣaffār narrated from Ibrāhīm ibn Hāshim from al-Ḥusayn ibn Yazīd al-Nawfalī from Ismāʿīl ibn Abī Ziyād from Jaʿfar from his father, that ʿAlī (peace be upon him) said:

There is no *mulāʿana* (mutual cursing) between five types of women and their husbands: a Jewish woman married to a Muslim who accuses her of adultery, a Christian woman, a slave woman married to a free man who accuses her, a free woman married to a slave who accuses her, and one who has been flogged for false accusation, because God Almighty says: "And never accept their testimony." (Quran 24:4) And a mute woman, there is no *liʿān* (legal cursing) between her and her husband, for *liʿān* is only with the tongue.

The explanation for this narration is one of two things: The first is that it is based on *taqiyya* (dissimulation), because that is the *madhhab* (legal school) of some of the *ʿāmma* (Sunnis), as we have previously stated. The other is that *liʿān* is not established between a Jewish woman and a Muslim, nor between him and a slave woman, merely by the accusation of adultery. Rather, *liʿān* is only established merely by the accusation of adultery in the situation where, if he does not perform *mulāʿana*, he would be subject to the punishment for false accusation. This is not the case with a Muslim who accuses a Jewish woman or a slave woman, because he is not flogged as a false accuser if he accuses her, but he is subject to *taʿzīr* (discretionary punishment), as we will explain in the Book of Punishments, God willing. Thus, *liʿān* is established between these individuals by disavowing the child, and nothing else.
[218 - Chapter: That *liʿān* is established with a pregnant woman]
[1339] 1 - Al-Ḥusayn ibn Saʿīd from Ibn Abī ʿUmayr from ʿAlī from al-Ḥalabī, who said: I asked Abū ʿAbd Allāh (peace be upon him) about a man who performed *liʿān* with his wife while she was pregnant and her pregnancy was evident, and he denied what was in her womb. When she gave birth, he claimed the child and acknowledged it and claimed that it was his. He said: His child is returned to him, and he inherits from him, and he is not flogged because the *liʿān* has already taken place.

من ولدها ويلاعنها ويفارقها ثم يقول بعد ذلك الولد ولدي ويكذب نفسه فقال:
أما المرأة فلا ترجع إليه أبدا وأما الولد فأنا أرده إليه إذا ادعاه ولا أدع ولده وليس له ميراث ويرث الابن الأب ولا يرث الأب الابن يكون ميراثه لأخواله فإن لم يدعه أبوه فإن أخواله يرثونه ولا يرثهم وإن دعاه أحد ابن الزانية جلد الحد.
[220 - باب الرجل يقول لامرأته لم أجدك عذراء] [1345] 1 - يونس عن زرارة عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل قال لامرأته لم تأتني عذراء قال: ليس بشئ لان العذرة تذهب بغير جماع.
[1346] 2 - فأما ما رواه الحسين بن سعيد عن ابن أبي عمير عن حماد عن الحلبي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: إذا قال الرجل لامرأته لم أجدك عذراء وليس له بينة قال: يجلد الحد ويخلى بينه وبين امرأته.
فلا ينافي الخبر الأول لان الوجه فيه أن نحمله على أنه يضرب تعزيرا لا حدا كاملا لئلا يؤذي امرأة مسلمة بالتعريض يدل على ذلك:
[1347] 3 - ما رواه محمد بن يعقوب عن علي بن إبراهيم عن محمد بن عيسى بن عبيد عن يونس عن إسحاق بن عمار عن أبي بصير قال: قال أبو عبد الله عليه السلام في رجل قال لامرأته لم أجدك عذراء قال: يضرب، قلت فإنه عاد قال: يضرب فإنه يوشك أن ينتهي، قال يونس يضرب ضرب أدب ليس بضرب الحدود لئلا يؤذي امرأة مؤمنة بالتعريض.
تم القسم الأول من الجزء الثالث من كتاب الاستبصار فيما اختلف من الاخبار ويتلوه انشاء الله تعالى القسم الثاني وأوله كتاب العتق بحمد الله ومنه وحسن توفيقه.
انتهى الجزء الثالث من الكتاب

...from her offspring, and curses her, and separates from her, then says after that, "The child is mine," and contradicts himself? He said:

"As for the woman, she never returns to him. As for the child, I return him to him if he claims him, and I do not deny his child. He has no inheritance, but the son inherits from the father, and the father does not inherit from the son; his inheritance goes to his maternal uncles. If his father does not claim him, then his maternal uncles inherit him, and he does not inherit them. If someone calls him the son of a fornicatress, he is flogged with the prescribed punishment."
[220 - Chapter on a man who says to his wife, "I did not find you a virgin"] [1345] 1 - Yunus from Zurarah from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, concerning a man who said to his wife, "You did not come to me a virgin." He said: "It is nothing because the hymen can be lost without intercourse."
[1346] 2 - As for what Al-Hussein bin Saeed narrated from Ibn Abi Umair from Hammad from al-Halabi from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: "If a man says to his wife, 'I did not find you a virgin,' and he has no proof, he is flogged with the prescribed punishment, and she is left to him as his wife.”

This does not contradict the first report, because the interpretation of it is that we understand it to mean that he is struck with a ta'zir (discretionary punishment) not a complete ḥadd (prescribed punishment), so as not to harm a Muslim woman by insinuation, which is indicated by:
[1347] 3 - What Muhammad bin Yaqub narrated from Ali bin Ibrahim from Muhammad bin Isa bin Ubaid from Yunus from Ishaq bin Ammar from Abi Basir, who said: Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him, said concerning a man who said to his wife, "I did not find you a virgin," he said: "He is struck." I said, "What if he repeats it?" He said: "He is struck, for he is about to stop." Yunus said: "He is struck with a strike of discipline, not a strike of the prescribed punishments, so as not to harm a believing woman by insinuation."
The first section of the third part of the book Al-Istibsar fi ma Ikhtalafa min al-Akhbar is completed, and it is followed, God willing, by the second section, the beginning of which is the Book of Emancipation, by the grace of God, His favor, and His good success.
The third part of the book has ended.
